ArabicText: وَلَوۡ أَنَّهُمۡ صَبَرُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ تَخۡرُجَ إِلَیۡهِمۡ لَكَانَ خَیۡرࣰا لَّهُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورࣱ رَّحِیمࣱ ۝٥
Translation: If only they had patience until thou couldst come out to them, it would be best for them: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوۤا۟ إِن جَاۤءَكُمۡ فَاسِقُۢ بِنَبَإࣲ فَتَبَیَّنُوۤا۟ أَن تُصِیبُوا۟ قَوۡمَۢا بِجَهَـٰلَةࣲ فَتُصۡبِحُوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلۡتُمۡ نَـٰدِمِینَ ۝٦
Translation: O ye who believe! If a wicked person comes to you with any news, ascertain the truth, lest ye harm people unwittingly, and afterwards become full of repentance for what ye have done.

ArabicText: وَٱعۡلَمُوۤا۟ أَنَّ فِیكُمۡ رَسُولَ ٱللَّهِۚ لَوۡ یُطِیعُكُمۡ فِی كَثِیرࣲ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَمۡرِ لَعَنِتُّمۡ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ حَبَّبَ إِلَیۡكُمُ ٱلۡإِیمَـٰنَ وَزَیَّنَهُۥ فِی قُلُوبِكُمۡ وَكَرَّهَ إِلَیۡكُمُ ٱلۡكُفۡرَ وَٱلۡفُسُوقَ وَٱلۡعِصۡیَانَۚ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلرَّ ٰ⁠شِدُونَ ۝٧
Translation: And know that among you is Allah´s Messenger: were he, in many matters, to follow your (wishes), ye would certainly fall into misfortune: But Allah has endeared the Faith to you, and has made it beautiful in your hearts, and He has made hateful to you Unbelief, wickedness, and rebellion: such indeed are those who walk in righteousness;-

ArabicText: فَضۡلࣰا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَنِعۡمَةࣰۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِیمٌ حَكِیمࣱ ۝٨
Translation: A Grace and Favour from Allah; and Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.

ArabicText: وَإِن طَاۤىِٕفَتَانِ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ ٱقۡتَتَلُوا۟ فَأَصۡلِحُوا۟ بَیۡنَهُمَاۖ فَإِنۢ بَغَتۡ إِحۡدَىٰهُمَا عَلَى ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰ فَقَـٰتِلُوا۟ ٱلَّتِی تَبۡغِی حَتَّىٰ تَفِیۤءَ إِلَىٰۤ أَمۡرِ ٱللَّهِۚ فَإِن فَاۤءَتۡ فَأَصۡلِحُوا۟ بَیۡنَهُمَا بِٱلۡعَدۡلِ وَأَقۡسِطُوۤا۟ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ یُحِبُّ ٱلۡمُقۡسِطِینَ ۝٩
Translation: If two parties among the Believers fall into a quarrel, make ye peace between them: but if one of them transgresses beyond bounds against the other, then fight ye (all) against the one that transgresses until it complies with the command of Allah; but if it complies, then make peace between them with justice, and be fair: for Allah loves those who are fair (and just).

ArabicText: إِنَّمَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ إِخۡوَةࣱ فَأَصۡلِحُوا۟ بَیۡنَ أَخَوَیۡكُمۡۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تُرۡحَمُونَ ۝١٠
Translation: The Believers are but a single Brotherhood: So make peace and reconciliation between your two (contending) brothers; and fear Allah, that ye may receive Mercy.

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا یَسۡخَرۡ قَوۡمࣱ مِّن قَوۡمٍ عَسَىٰۤ أَن یَكُونُوا۟ خَیۡرࣰا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَلَا نِسَاۤءࣱ مِّن نِّسَاۤءٍ عَسَىٰۤ أَن یَكُنَّ خَیۡرࣰا مِّنۡهُنَّۖ وَلَا تَلۡمِزُوۤا۟ أَنفُسَكُمۡ وَلَا تَنَابَزُوا۟ بِٱلۡأَلۡقَـٰبِۖ بِئۡسَ ٱلِٱسۡمُ ٱلۡفُسُوقُ بَعۡدَ ٱلۡإِیمَـٰنِۚ وَمَن لَّمۡ یَتُبۡ فَأُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ ۝١١
Translation: O ye who believe! Let not some men among you laugh at others: It may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): Nor let some women laugh at others: It may be that the (latter are better than the (former): Nor defame nor be sarcastic to each other, nor call each other by (offensive) nicknames: Ill-seeming is a name connoting wickedness, (to be used of one) after he has believed: And those who do not desist are (indeed) doing wrong.

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱجۡتَنِبُوا۟ كَثِیرࣰا مِّنَ ٱلظَّنِّ إِنَّ بَعۡضَ ٱلظَّنِّ إِثۡمࣱۖ وَلَا تَجَسَّسُوا۟ وَلَا یَغۡتَب بَّعۡضُكُم بَعۡضًاۚ أَیُحِبُّ أَحَدُكُمۡ أَن یَأۡكُلَ لَحۡمَ أَخِیهِ مَیۡتࣰا فَكَرِهۡتُمُوهُۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ تَوَّابࣱ رَّحِیمࣱ ۝١٢
Translation: O ye who believe! Avoid suspicion as much (as possible): for suspicion in some cases is a sin: And spy not on each other behind their backs. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay, ye would abhor it...But fear Allah: For Allah is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَـٰكُم مِّن ذَكَرࣲ وَأُنثَىٰ وَجَعَلۡنَـٰكُمۡ شُعُوبࣰا وَقَبَاۤىِٕلَ لِتَعَارَفُوۤا۟ۚ إِنَّ أَكۡرَمَكُمۡ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ أَتۡقَىٰكُمۡۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِیمٌ خَبِیرࣱ ۝١٣
Translation: O mankind! We created you from a single (pair) of a male and a female, and made you into nations and tribes, that ye may know each other (not that ye may despise (each other). Verily the most honoured of you in the sight of Allah is (he who is) the most righteous of you. And Allah has full knowledge and is well acquainted (with all things).

ArabicText: ۞ قَالَتِ ٱلۡأَعۡرَابُ ءَامَنَّاۖ قُل لَّمۡ تُؤۡمِنُوا۟ وَلَـٰكِن قُولُوۤا۟ أَسۡلَمۡنَا وَلَمَّا یَدۡخُلِ ٱلۡإِیمَـٰنُ فِی قُلُوبِكُمۡۖ وَإِن تُطِیعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ لَا یَلِتۡكُم مِّنۡ أَعۡمَـٰلِكُمۡ شَیۡـًٔاۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورࣱ رَّحِیمٌ ۝١٤
Translation: The desert Arabs say, "We believe." Say, "Ye have no faith; but ye (only)say, ´We have submitted our wills to Allah,´ For not yet has Faith entered your hearts. But if ye obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not belittle aught of your deeds: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

ArabicText: إِنَّمَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ ثُمَّ لَمۡ یَرۡتَابُوا۟ وَجَـٰهَدُوا۟ بِأَمۡوَ ٰ⁠لِهِمۡ وَأَنفُسِهِمۡ فِی سَبِیلِ ٱللَّهِۚ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلصَّـٰدِقُونَ ۝١٥
Translation: Only those are Believers who have believed in Allah and His Messenger, and have never since doubted, but have striven with their belongings and their persons in the Cause of Allah: Such are the sincere ones.

ArabicText: قُلۡ أَتُعَلِّمُونَ ٱللَّهَ بِدِینِكُمۡ وَٱللَّهُ یَعۡلَمُ مَا فِی ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَمَا فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَیۡءٍ عَلِیمࣱ ۝١٦
Translation: Say: "What! Will ye instruct Allah about your religion? But Allah knows all that is in the heavens and on earth: He has full knowledge of all things.

ArabicText: یَمُنُّونَ عَلَیۡكَ أَنۡ أَسۡلَمُوا۟ۖ قُل لَّا تَمُنُّوا۟ عَلَیَّ إِسۡلَـٰمَكُمۖ بَلِ ٱللَّهُ یَمُنُّ عَلَیۡكُمۡ أَنۡ هَدَىٰكُمۡ لِلۡإِیمَـٰنِ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَـٰدِقِینَ ۝١٧
Translation: They impress on thee as a favour that they have embraced Islam. Say, "Count not your Islam as a favour upon me: Nay, Allah has conferred a favour upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if ye be true and sincere.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ یَعۡلَمُ غَیۡبَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ بَصِیرُۢ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ ۝١٨
Translation: "Verily Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth: and Allah Sees well all that ye do."

ArabicText: قۤۚ وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ ٱلۡمَجِیدِ ۝١
Translation: Qaf: By the Glorious Qur´an (Thou art Allah´s Messenger).

ArabicText: بَلۡ عَجِبُوۤا۟ أَن جَاۤءَهُم مُّنذِرࣱ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَقَالَ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا شَیۡءٌ عَجِیبٌ ۝٢
Translation: But they wonder that there has come to them a Warner from among themselves. So the Unbelievers say: "This is a wonderful thing!

ArabicText: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابࣰاۖ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ رَجۡعُۢ بَعِیدࣱ ۝٣
Translation: "What! When we die and become dust, (shall we live again?) That is a (sort of) return far (from our understanding)."

ArabicText: قَدۡ عَلِمۡنَا مَا تَنقُصُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مِنۡهُمۡۖ وَعِندَنَا كِتَـٰبٌ حَفِیظُۢ ۝٤
Translation: We already know how much of them the earth takes away: With Us is a record guarding (the full account).

ArabicText: بَلۡ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلۡحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاۤءَهُمۡ فَهُمۡ فِیۤ أَمۡرࣲ مَّرِیجٍ ۝٥
Translation: But they deny the Truth when it comes to them: so they are in a confused state.

ArabicText: أَفَلَمۡ یَنظُرُوۤا۟ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ فَوۡقَهُمۡ كَیۡفَ بَنَیۡنَـٰهَا وَزَیَّنَّـٰهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِن فُرُوجࣲ ۝٦
Translation: Do they not look at the sky above them?- How We have made it and adorned it, and there are no flaws in it?

ArabicText: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ مَدَدۡنَـٰهَا وَأَلۡقَیۡنَا فِیهَا رَوَ ٰ⁠سِیَ وَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِیهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجِۭ بَهِیجࣲ ۝٧
Translation: And the earth- We have spread it out, and set thereon mountains standing firm, and produced therein every kind of beautiful growth (in pairs)-

ArabicText: تَبۡصِرَةࣰ وَذِكۡرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبۡدࣲ مُّنِیبࣲ ۝٨
Translation: To be observed and commemorated by every devotee turning (to Allah).

ArabicText: وَنَزَّلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ مَاۤءࣰ مُّبَـٰرَكࣰا فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا بِهِۦ جَنَّـٰتࣲ وَحَبَّ ٱلۡحَصِیدِ ۝٩
Translation: And We send down from the sky rain charted with blessing, and We produce therewith gardens and Grain for harvests;

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّخۡلَ بَاسِقَـٰتࣲ لَّهَا طَلۡعࣱ نَّضِیدࣱ ۝١٠
Translation: And tall (and stately) palm-trees, with shoots of fruit-stalks, piled one over another;-

ArabicText: رِّزۡقࣰا لِّلۡعِبَادِۖ وَأَحۡیَیۡنَا بِهِۦ بَلۡدَةࣰ مَّیۡتࣰاۚ كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡخُرُوجُ ۝١١
Translation: As sustenance for (Allah´s) Servants;- and We give (new) life therewith to land that is dead: Thus will be the Resurrection.

ArabicText: كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحࣲ وَأَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ ۝١٢
Translation: Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the People of Noah, the Companions of the Rass, the Thamud,

ArabicText: وَعَادࣱ وَفِرۡعَوۡنُ وَإِخۡوَ ٰ⁠نُ لُوطࣲ ۝١٣
Translation: The ´Ad, Pharaoh, the brethren of Lut,

ArabicText: وَأَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡأَیۡكَةِ وَقَوۡمُ تُبَّعࣲۚ كُلࣱّ كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِیدِ ۝١٤
Translation: The Companions of the Wood, and the People of Tubba´; each one (of them) rejected the messengers, and My warning was duly fulfilled (in them).

ArabicText: أَفَعَیِینَا بِٱلۡخَلۡقِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ فِی لَبۡسࣲ مِّنۡ خَلۡقࣲ جَدِیدࣲ ۝١٥
Translation: Were We then weary with the first Creation, that they should be in confused doubt about a new Creation?

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ وَنَعۡلَمُ مَا تُوَسۡوِسُ بِهِۦ نَفۡسُهُۥۖ وَنَحۡنُ أَقۡرَبُ إِلَیۡهِ مِنۡ حَبۡلِ ٱلۡوَرِیدِ ۝١٦
Translation: It was We Who created man, and We know what dark suggestions his soul makes to him: for We are nearer to him than (his) jugular vein.

ArabicText: إِذۡ یَتَلَقَّى ٱلۡمُتَلَقِّیَانِ عَنِ ٱلۡیَمِینِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ قَعِیدࣱ ۝١٧
Translation: Behold, two (guardian angels) appointed to learn (his doings) learn (and noted them), one sitting on the right and one on the left.

ArabicText: مَّا یَلۡفِظُ مِن قَوۡلٍ إِلَّا لَدَیۡهِ رَقِیبٌ عَتِیدࣱ ۝١٨
Translation: Not a word does he utter but there is a sentinel by him, ready (to note it).

ArabicText: وَجَاۤءَتۡ سَكۡرَةُ ٱلۡمَوۡتِ بِٱلۡحَقِّۖ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنۡهُ تَحِیدُ ۝١٩
Translation: And the stupor of death will bring Truth (before his eyes): "This was the thing which thou wast trying to escape!"

ArabicText: وَنُفِخَ فِی ٱلصُّورِۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ یَوۡمُ ٱلۡوَعِیدِ ۝٢٠
Translation: And the Trumpet shall be blown: that will be the Day whereof Warning (had been given).

ArabicText: وَجَاۤءَتۡ كُلُّ نَفۡسࣲ مَّعَهَا سَاۤىِٕقࣱ وَشَهِیدࣱ ۝٢١
Translation: And there will come forth every soul: with each will be an (angel) to drive, and an (angel) to bear witness.

ArabicText: لَّقَدۡ كُنتَ فِی غَفۡلَةࣲ مِّنۡ هَـٰذَا فَكَشَفۡنَا عَنكَ غِطَاۤءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمَ حَدِیدࣱ ۝٢٢
Translation: (It will be said:) "Thou wast heedless of this; now have We removed thy veil, and sharp is thy sight this Day!"

ArabicText: وَقَالَ قَرِینُهُۥ هَـٰذَا مَا لَدَیَّ عَتِیدٌ ۝٢٣
Translation: And his Companion will say: "Here is (his Record) ready with me!"

ArabicText: أَلۡقِیَا فِی جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِیدࣲ ۝٢٤
Translation: (The sentence will be:) "Throw, throw into Hell every contumacious Rejecter (of Allah)!-

ArabicText: مَّنَّاعࣲ لِّلۡخَیۡرِ مُعۡتَدࣲ مُّرِیبٍ ۝٢٥
Translation: "Who forbade what was good, transgressed all bounds, cast doubts and suspicions;

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی جَعَلَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَأَلۡقِیَاهُ فِی ٱلۡعَذَابِ ٱلشَّدِیدِ ۝٢٦
Translation: "Who set up another god beside Allah: Throw him into a severe penalty."

ArabicText: ۞ قَالَ قَرِینُهُۥ رَبَّنَا مَاۤ أَطۡغَیۡتُهُۥ وَلَـٰكِن كَانَ فِی ضَلَـٰلِۭ بَعِیدࣲ ۝٢٧
Translation: His Companion will say: "Our Lord! I did not make him transgress, but he was (himself) far astray."

ArabicText: قَالَ لَا تَخۡتَصِمُوا۟ لَدَیَّ وَقَدۡ قَدَّمۡتُ إِلَیۡكُم بِٱلۡوَعِیدِ ۝٢٨
Translation: He will say: "Dispute not with each other in My Presence: I had already in advance sent you Warning.

ArabicText: مَا یُبَدَّلُ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ لَدَیَّ وَمَاۤ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّـٰمࣲ لِّلۡعَبِیدِ ۝٢٩
Translation: "The Word changes not before Me, and I do not the least injustice to My Servants."

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمۡتَلَأۡتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلۡ مِن مَّزِیدࣲ ۝٣٠
Translation: One Day We will ask Hell, "Art thou filled to the full?" It will say, "Are there any more (to come)?"

ArabicText: وَأُزۡلِفَتِ ٱلۡجَنَّةُ لِلۡمُتَّقِینَ غَیۡرَ بَعِیدٍ ۝٣١
Translation: And the Garden will be brought nigh to the Righteous,- no more a thing distant.

ArabicText: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِیظࣲ ۝٣٢
Translation: (A voice will say:) "This is what was promised for you,- for every one who turned (to Allah) in sincere repentance, who kept (His Law),

ArabicText: مَّنۡ خَشِیَ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنَ بِٱلۡغَیۡبِ وَجَاۤءَ بِقَلۡبࣲ مُّنِیبٍ ۝٣٣
Translation: "Who feared (Allah) Most Gracious Unseen, and brought a heart turned in devotion (to Him):

ArabicText: ٱدۡخُلُوهَا بِسَلَـٰمࣲۖ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ یَوۡمُ ٱلۡخُلُودِ ۝٣٤
Translation: "Enter ye therein in Peace and Security; this is a Day of Eternal Life!"

ArabicText: لَهُم مَّا یَشَاۤءُونَ فِیهَا وَلَدَیۡنَا مَزِیدࣱ ۝٣٥
Translation: There will be for them therein all that they wish,- and more besides in Our Presence.

ArabicText: وَكَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا قَبۡلَهُم مِّن قَرۡنٍ هُمۡ أَشَدُّ مِنۡهُم بَطۡشࣰا فَنَقَّبُوا۟ فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ هَلۡ مِن مَّحِیصٍ ۝٣٦
Translation: But how many generations before them did We destroy (for their sins),- stronger in power than they? Then did they wander through the land: was there any place of escape (for them)?

ArabicText: إِنَّ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ لَذِكۡرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُۥ قَلۡبٌ أَوۡ أَلۡقَى ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَهُوَ شَهِیدࣱ ۝٣٧
Translation: Verily in this is a Message for any that has a heart and understanding or who gives ear and earnestly witnesses (the truth).

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَیۡنَهُمَا فِی سِتَّةِ أَیَّامࣲ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبࣲ ۝٣٨
Translation: We created the heavens and the earth and all between them in Six Days, nor did any sense of weariness touch Us.

ArabicText: فَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا یَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ قَبۡلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمۡسِ وَقَبۡلَ ٱلۡغُرُوبِ ۝٣٩
Translation: Bear, then, with patience, all that they say, and celebrate the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun and before (its) setting.

ArabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلَّیۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَأَدۡبَـٰرَ ٱلسُّجُودِ ۝٤٠
Translation: And during part of the night, (also,) celebrate His praises, and (so likewise) after the postures of adoration.

ArabicText: وَٱسۡتَمِعۡ یَوۡمَ یُنَادِ ٱلۡمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانࣲ قَرِیبࣲ ۝٤١
Translation: And listen for the Day when the Caller will call out from a place quiet near,-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَسۡمَعُونَ ٱلصَّیۡحَةَ بِٱلۡحَقِّۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ یَوۡمُ ٱلۡخُرُوجِ ۝٤٢
Translation: The Day when they will hear a (mighty) Blast in (very) truth: that will be the Day of Resurrection.

ArabicText: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نُحۡیِۦ وَنُمِیتُ وَإِلَیۡنَا ٱلۡمَصِیرُ ۝٤٣
Translation: Verily it is We Who give Life and Death; and to Us is the Final Goal-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ عَنۡهُمۡ سِرَاعࣰاۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ حَشۡرٌ عَلَیۡنَا یَسِیرࣱ ۝٤٤
Translation: The Day when the Earth will be rent asunder, from (men) hurrying out: that will be a gathering together,- quite easy for Us.

ArabicText: نَّحۡنُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا یَقُولُونَۖ وَمَاۤ أَنتَ عَلَیۡهِم بِجَبَّارࣲۖ فَذَكِّرۡ بِٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ مَن یَخَافُ وَعِیدِ ۝٤٥
Translation: We know best what they say; and thou art not one to overawe them by force. So admonish with the Qur´an such as fear My Warning!

ArabicText: وَٱلذَّ ٰ⁠رِیَـٰتِ ذَرۡوࣰا ۝١
Translation: By the (Winds) that scatter broadcast;

ArabicText: فَٱلۡحَـٰمِلَـٰتِ وِقۡرࣰا ۝٢
Translation: And those that lift and bear away heavy weights;

ArabicText: فَٱلۡجَـٰرِیَـٰتِ یُسۡرࣰا ۝٣
Translation: And those that flow with ease and gentleness;

ArabicText: فَٱلۡمُقَسِّمَـٰتِ أَمۡرًا ۝٤
Translation: And those that distribute and apportion by Command;-

ArabicText: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقࣱ ۝٥
Translation: Verily that which ye are promised is true;

ArabicText: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّینَ لَوَ ٰ⁠قِعࣱ ۝٦
Translation: And verily Judgment and Justice must indeed come to pass.

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡحُبُكِ ۝٧
Translation: By the Sky with (its) numerous Paths,

ArabicText: إِنَّكُمۡ لَفِی قَوۡلࣲ مُّخۡتَلِفࣲ ۝٨
Translation: Truly ye are in a doctrine discordant,

ArabicText: یُؤۡفَكُ عَنۡهُ مَنۡ أُفِكَ ۝٩
Translation: Through which are deluded (away from the Truth) such as would be deluded.

ArabicText: قُتِلَ ٱلۡخَرَّ ٰ⁠صُونَ ۝١٠
Translation: Woe to the falsehood-mongers,-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ فِی غَمۡرَةࣲ سَاهُونَ ۝١١
Translation: Those who (flounder) heedless in a flood of confusion:

ArabicText: یَسۡـَٔلُونَ أَیَّانَ یَوۡمُ ٱلدِّینِ ۝١٢
Translation: They ask, "When will be the Day of Judgment and Justice?"

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ هُمۡ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ یُفۡتَنُونَ ۝١٣
Translation: (It will be) a Day when they will be tried (and tested) over the Fire!

ArabicText: ذُوقُوا۟ فِتۡنَتَكُمۡ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِی كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ ۝١٤
Translation: "Taste ye your trial! This is what ye used to ask to be hastened!"

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِینَ فِی جَنَّـٰتࣲ وَعُیُونٍ ۝١٥
Translation: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Springs,

ArabicText: ءَاخِذِینَ مَاۤ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوا۟ قَبۡلَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ مُحۡسِنِینَ ۝١٦
Translation: Taking joy in the things which their Lord gives them, because, before then, they lived a good life.

ArabicText: كَانُوا۟ قَلِیلࣰا مِّنَ ٱلَّیۡلِ مَا یَهۡجَعُونَ ۝١٧
Translation: They were in the habit of sleeping but little by night,

ArabicText: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ یَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ ۝١٨
Translation: And in the hour of early dawn, they (were found) praying for Forgiveness;

ArabicText: وَفِیۤ أَمۡوَ ٰ⁠لِهِمۡ حَقࣱّ لِّلسَّاۤىِٕلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ ۝١٩
Translation: And in their wealth and possessions (was remembered) the right of the (needy,) him who asked, and him who (for some reason) was prevented (from asking).

ArabicText: وَفِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَایَـٰتࣱ لِّلۡمُوقِنِینَ ۝٢٠
Translation: On the earth are signs for those of assured Faith,

ArabicText: وَفِیۤ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ ۝٢١
Translation: As also in your own selves: Will ye not then see?

ArabicText: وَفِی ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ ۝٢٢
Translation: And in heaven is your Sustenance, as (also) that which ye are promised.

ArabicText: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقࣱّ مِّثۡلَ مَاۤ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ ۝٢٣
Translation: Then, by the Lord of heaven and earth, this is the very Truth, as much as the fact that ye can speak intelligently to each other.

ArabicText: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِیثُ ضَیۡفِ إِبۡرَ ٰ⁠هِیمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِینَ ۝٢٤
Translation: Has the story reached thee, of the honoured guests of Abraham?

ArabicText: إِذۡ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَیۡهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمࣰاۖ قَالَ سَلَـٰمࣱ قَوۡمࣱ مُّنكَرُونَ ۝٢٥
Translation: Behold, they entered his presence, and said: "Peace!" He said, "Peace!" (and thought, "These seem) unusual people."

ArabicText: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَاۤءَ بِعِجۡلࣲ سَمِینࣲ ۝٢٦
Translation: Then he turned quickly to his household, brought out a fatted calf,

ArabicText: فَقَرَّبَهُۥۤ إِلَیۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ ۝٢٧
Translation: And placed it before them.. he said, "Will ye not eat?"

ArabicText: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِیفَةࣰۖ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِیمࣲ ۝٢٨
Translation: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them. They said, "Fear not," and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.

ArabicText: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِی صَرَّةࣲ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِیمࣱ ۝٢٩
Translation: But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her forehead and said: "A barren old woman!"

ArabicText: قَالُوا۟ كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِیمُ ٱلۡعَلِیمُ ۝٣٠
Translation: They said, "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge."

ArabicText: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَیُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ ۝٣١
Translation: (Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"

ArabicText: قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّاۤ أُرۡسِلۡنَاۤ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمࣲ مُّجۡرِمِینَ ۝٣٢
Translation: They said, "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin;-

ArabicText: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَیۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةࣰ مِّن طِینࣲ ۝٣٣
Translation: "To bring on, on them, (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstone),

ArabicText: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِینَ ۝٣٤
Translation: "Marked as from thy Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds."

ArabicText: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِیهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ ۝٣٥
Translation: Then We evacuated those of the Believers who were there,

ArabicText: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِیهَا غَیۡرَ بَیۡتࣲ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِینَ ۝٣٦
Translation: But We found not there any just (Muslim) persons except in one house:

ArabicText: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِیهَاۤ ءَایَةࣰ لِّلَّذِینَ یَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِیمَ ۝٣٧
Translation: And We left there a Sign for such as fear the Grievous Penalty.

ArabicText: وَفِی مُوسَىٰۤ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَـٰنࣲ مُّبِینࣲ ۝٣٨
Translation: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.

ArabicText: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَـٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونࣱ ۝٣٩
Translation: But (Pharaoh) turned back with his Chiefs, and said, "A sorcerer, or one possessed!"

ArabicText: فَأَخَذۡنَـٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَـٰهُمۡ فِی ٱلۡیَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِیمࣱ ۝٤٠
Translation: So We took him and his forces, and threw them into the sea; and his was the blame.

ArabicText: وَفِی عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَیۡهِمُ ٱلرِّیحَ ٱلۡعَقِیمَ ۝٤١
Translation: And in the ´Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold, We sent against them the devastating Wind:

ArabicText: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَیۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَیۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِیمِ ۝٤٢
Translation: It left nothing whatever that it came up against, but reduced it to ruin and rottenness.

ArabicText: وَفِی ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِیلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ حِینࣲ ۝٤٣
Translation: And in the Thamud (was another Sign): Behold, they were told, "Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!"

ArabicText: فَعَتَوۡا۟ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّـٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ یَنظُرُونَ ۝٤٤
Translation: But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord: So the stunning noise (of an earthquake) seized them, even while they were looking on.

ArabicText: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَـٰعُوا۟ مِن قِیَامࣲ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُنتَصِرِینَ ۝٤٥
Translation: Then they could not even stand (on their feet), nor could they help themselves.

ArabicText: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحࣲ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوا۟ قَوۡمࣰا فَـٰسِقِینَ ۝٤٦
Translation: So were the People of Noah before them for they wickedly transgressed.

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءَ بَنَیۡنَـٰهَا بِأَیۡی۟دࣲ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ ۝٤٧
Translation: With power and skill did We construct the Firmament: for it is We Who create the vastness of pace.

ArabicText: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَـٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَـٰهِدُونَ ۝٤٨
Translation: And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: How excellently We do spread out!

ArabicText: وَمِن كُلِّ شَیۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَیۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ ۝٤٩
Translation: And of every thing We have created pairs: That ye may receive instruction.

ArabicText: فَفِرُّوۤا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّی لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِیرࣱ مُّبِینࣱ ۝٥٠
Translation: Hasten ye then (at once) to Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!

ArabicText: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّی لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِیرࣱ مُّبِینࣱ ۝٥١
Translation: And make not another an object of worship with Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!

ArabicText: كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ مَاۤ أَتَى ٱلَّذِینَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا۟ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ ۝٥٢
Translation: Similarly, no messenger came to the Peoples before them, but they said (of him) in like manner, "A sorcerer, or one possessed"!

ArabicText: أَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمࣱ طَاغُونَ ۝٥٣
Translation: Is this the legacy they have transmitted, one to another? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds!

ArabicText: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَاۤ أَنتَ بِمَلُومࣲ ۝٥٤
Translation: So turn away from them: not thine is the blame.

ArabicText: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ ۝٥٥
Translation: But teach (thy Message) for teaching benefits the Believers.

ArabicText: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِیَعۡبُدُونِ ۝٥٦
Translation: I have only created Jinns and men, that they may serve Me.

ArabicText: مَاۤ أُرِیدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقࣲ وَمَاۤ أُرِیدُ أَن یُطۡعِمُونِ ۝٥٧
Translation: No Sustenance do I require of them, nor do I require that they should feed Me.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِینُ ۝٥٨
Translation: For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance,- Lord of Power,- Steadfast (for ever).

ArabicText: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِینَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ذَنُوبࣰا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَـٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا یَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ ۝٥٩
Translation: For the Wrong-doers, their portion is like unto the portion of their fellows (of earlier generations): then let them not ask Me to hasten (that portion)!

ArabicText: فَوَیۡلࣱ لِّلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن یَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِی یُوعَدُونَ ۝٦٠
Translation: Woe, then, to the Unbelievers, on account of that Day of theirs which they have been promised!

ArabicText: وَٱلطُّورِ ۝١
Translation: By the Mount (of Revelation);

ArabicText: وَكِتَـٰبࣲ مَّسۡطُورࣲ ۝٢
Translation: By a Decree inscribed

ArabicText: فِی رَقࣲّ مَّنشُورࣲ ۝٣
Translation: In a Scroll unfolded;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡبَیۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡمُورِ ۝٤
Translation: By the much-frequented Fane;

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّقۡفِ ٱلۡمَرۡفُوعِ ۝٥
Translation: By the Canopy Raised High;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡبَحۡرِ ٱلۡمَسۡجُورِ ۝٦
Translation: And by the Ocean filled with Swell;-

ArabicText: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَ ٰ⁠قِعࣱ ۝٧
Translation: Verily, the Doom of thy Lord will indeed come to pass;-

ArabicText: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعࣲ ۝٨
Translation: There is none can avert it;-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ مَوۡرࣰا ۝٩
Translation: On the Day when the firmament will be in dreadful commotion.

ArabicText: وَتَسِیرُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ سَیۡرࣰا ۝١٠
Translation: And the mountains will fly hither and thither.

ArabicText: فَوَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝١١
Translation: Then woe that Day to those that treat (Truth) as Falsehood;-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ فِی خَوۡضࣲ یَلۡعَبُونَ ۝١٢
Translation: That play (and paddle) in shallow trifles.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا ۝١٣
Translation: That Day shall they be thrust down to the Fire of Hell, irresistibly.

ArabicText: هَـٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِی كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ ۝١٤
Translation: "This:, it will be said, "Is the Fire,- which ye were wont to deny!

ArabicText: أَفَسِحۡرٌ هَـٰذَاۤ أَمۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ ۝١٥
Translation: "Is this then a fake, or is it ye that do not see?

ArabicText: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا فَٱصۡبِرُوۤا۟ أَوۡ لَا تَصۡبِرُوا۟ سَوَاۤءٌ عَلَیۡكُمۡۖ إِنَّمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ ۝١٦
Translation: "Burn ye therein: the same is it to you whether ye bear it with patience, or not: Ye but receive the recompense of your (own) deeds."

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِینَ فِی جَنَّـٰتࣲ وَنَعِیمࣲ ۝١٧
Translation: As to the Righteous, they will be in Gardens, and in Happiness,-

ArabicText: فَـٰكِهِینَ بِمَاۤ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ وَوَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِیمِ ۝١٨
Translation: Enjoying the (Bliss) which their Lord hath bestowed on them, and their Lord shall deliver them from the Penalty of the Fire.

ArabicText: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشۡرَبُوا۟ هَنِیۤـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ ۝١٩
Translation: (To them will be said:) "Eat and drink ye, with profit and health, because of your (good) deeds."

ArabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرࣲ مَّصۡفُوفَةࣲۖ وَزَوَّجۡنَـٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِینࣲ ۝٢٠
Translation: They will recline (with ease) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; and We shall join them to Companions, with beautiful big and lustrous eyes.

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعَتۡهُمۡ ذُرِّیَّتُهُم بِإِیمَـٰنٍ أَلۡحَقۡنَا بِهِمۡ ذُرِّیَّتَهُمۡ وَمَاۤ أَلَتۡنَـٰهُم مِّنۡ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَیۡءࣲۚ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِىِٕۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِینࣱ ۝٢١
Translation: And those who believe and whose families follow them in Faith,- to them shall We join their families: Nor shall We deprive them (of the fruit) of aught of their works: (Yet) is each individual in pledge for his deeds.

ArabicText: وَأَمۡدَدۡنَـٰهُم بِفَـٰكِهَةࣲ وَلَحۡمࣲ مِّمَّا یَشۡتَهُونَ ۝٢٢
Translation: And We shall bestow on them, of fruit and meat, anything they shall desire.

ArabicText: یَتَنَـٰزَعُونَ فِیهَا كَأۡسࣰا لَّا لَغۡوࣱ فِیهَا وَلَا تَأۡثِیمࣱ ۝٢٣
Translation: They shall there exchange, one with another, a (loving) cup free of frivolity, free of all taint of ill.

ArabicText: ۞ وَیَطُوفُ عَلَیۡهِمۡ غِلۡمَانࣱ لَّهُمۡ كَأَنَّهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤࣱ مَّكۡنُونࣱ ۝٢٤
Translation: Round about them will serve, (devoted) to them, young male servants (handsome) as Pearls well-guarded.

ArabicText: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضࣲ یَتَسَاۤءَلُونَ ۝٢٥
Translation: They will advance to each other, engaging in mutual enquiry.

ArabicText: قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبۡلُ فِیۤ أَهۡلِنَا مُشۡفِقِینَ ۝٢٦
Translation: They will say: "Aforetime, we were not without fear for the sake of our people.

ArabicText: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَیۡنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ ۝٢٧
Translation: "But Allah has been good to us, and has delivered us from the Penalty of the Scorching Wind.

ArabicText: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبۡلُ نَدۡعُوهُۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِیمُ ۝٢٨
Translation: "Truly, we did call unto Him from of old: truly it is He, the Beneficent, the Merciful!"

ArabicText: فَذَكِّرۡ فَمَاۤ أَنتَ بِنِعۡمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنࣲ وَلَا مَجۡنُونٍ ۝٢٩
Translation: Therefore proclaim thou the praises (of thy Lord): for by the Grace of thy Lord, thou art no (vulgar) soothsayer, nor art thou one possessed.

ArabicText: أَمۡ یَقُولُونَ شَاعِرࣱ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَیۡبَ ٱلۡمَنُونِ ۝٣٠
Translation: Or do they say:- "A Poet! we await for him some calamity (hatched) by Time!"

ArabicText: قُلۡ تَرَبَّصُوا۟ فَإِنِّی مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡمُتَرَبِّصِینَ ۝٣١
Translation: Say thou: "Await ye!- I too will wait along with you!"

ArabicText: أَمۡ تَأۡمُرُهُمۡ أَحۡلَـٰمُهُم بِهَـٰذَاۤۚ أَمۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمࣱ طَاغُونَ ۝٣٢
Translation: Is it that their faculties of understanding urge them to this, or are they but a people transgressing beyond bounds?

ArabicText: أَمۡ یَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥۚ بَل لَّا یُؤۡمِنُونَ ۝٣٣
Translation: Or do they say, "He fabricated the (Message)"? Nay, they have no faith!

ArabicText: فَلۡیَأۡتُوا۟ بِحَدِیثࣲ مِّثۡلِهِۦۤ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِینَ ۝٣٤
Translation: Let them then produce a recital like unto it,- If (it be) they speak the truth!

ArabicText: أَمۡ خُلِقُوا۟ مِنۡ غَیۡرِ شَیۡءٍ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡخَـٰلِقُونَ ۝٣٥
Translation: Were they created of nothing, or were they themselves the creators?

ArabicText: أَمۡ خَلَقُوا۟ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَۚ بَل لَّا یُوقِنُونَ ۝٣٦
Translation: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, they have no firm belief.

ArabicText: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَاۤىِٕنُ رَبِّكَ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡمُصَۣیۡطِرُونَ ۝٣٧
Translation: Or are the Treasures of thy Lord with them, or are they the managers (of affairs)?

ArabicText: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ سُلَّمࣱ یَسۡتَمِعُونَ فِیهِۖ فَلۡیَأۡتِ مُسۡتَمِعُهُم بِسُلۡطَـٰنࣲ مُّبِینٍ ۝٣٨
Translation: Or have they a ladder, by which they can (climb up to heaven and) listen (to its secrets)? Then let (such a) listener of theirs produce a manifest proof.

ArabicText: أَمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡبَنَـٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ ۝٣٩
Translation: Or has He only daughters and ye have sons?

ArabicText: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرࣰا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمࣲ مُّثۡقَلُونَ ۝٤٠
Translation: Or is it that thou dost ask for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-

ArabicText: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَیۡبُ فَهُمۡ یَكۡتُبُونَ ۝٤١
Translation: Or that the Unseen in it their hands, and they write it down?

ArabicText: أَمۡ یُرِیدُونَ كَیۡدࣰاۖ فَٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلۡمَكِیدُونَ ۝٤٢
Translation: Or do they intend a plot (against thee)? But those who defy Allah are themselves involved in a Plot!

ArabicText: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ إِلَـٰهٌ غَیۡرُ ٱللَّهِۚ سُبۡحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا یُشۡرِكُونَ ۝٤٣
Translation: Or have they a god other than Allah? Exalted is Allah far above the things they associate with Him!

ArabicText: وَإِن یَرَوۡا۟ كِسۡفࣰا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ سَاقِطࣰا یَقُولُوا۟ سَحَابࣱ مَّرۡكُومࣱ ۝٤٤
Translation: Were they to see a piece of the sky falling (on them), they would (only) say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"

ArabicText: فَذَرۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ یُلَـٰقُوا۟ یَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِی فِیهِ یُصۡعَقُونَ ۝٤٥
Translation: So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs, wherein they shall (perforce) swoon (with terror),-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ لَا یُغۡنِی عَنۡهُمۡ كَیۡدُهُمۡ شَیۡـࣰٔا وَلَا هُمۡ یُنصَرُونَ ۝٤٦
Translation: The Day when their plotting will avail them nothing and no help shall be given them.

ArabicText: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِینَ ظَلَمُوا۟ عَذَابࣰا دُونَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ لَا یَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٤٧
Translation: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment besides this: But most of them understand not.

ArabicText: وَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعۡیُنِنَاۖ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ حِینَ تَقُومُ ۝٤٨
Translation: Now await in patience the command of thy Lord: for verily thou art in Our eyes: and celebrate the praises of thy Lord the while thou standest forth,

ArabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلَّیۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَإِدۡبَـٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ ۝٤٩
Translation: And for part of the night also praise thou Him,- and at the retreat of the stars!

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّجۡمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ ۝١
Translation: By the Star when it goes down,-

ArabicText: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمۡ وَمَا غَوَىٰ ۝٢
Translation: Your Companion is neither astray nor being misled.

ArabicText: وَمَا یَنطِقُ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰۤ ۝٣
Translation: Nor does he say (aught) of (his own) Desire.

ArabicText: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحۡیࣱ یُوحَىٰ ۝٤
Translation: It is no less than inspiration sent down to him:

ArabicText: عَلَّمَهُۥ شَدِیدُ ٱلۡقُوَىٰ ۝٥
Translation: He was taught by one Mighty in Power,

ArabicText: ذُو مِرَّةࣲ فَٱسۡتَوَىٰ ۝٦
Translation: Endued with Wisdom: for he appeared (in stately form);

ArabicText: وَهُوَ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ ۝٧
Translation: While he was in the highest part of the horizon:

ArabicText: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ ۝٨
Translation: Then he approached and came closer,

ArabicText: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوۡسَیۡنِ أَوۡ أَدۡنَىٰ ۝٩
Translation: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;

ArabicText: فَأَوۡحَىٰۤ إِلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦ مَاۤ أَوۡحَىٰ ۝١٠
Translation: So did (Allah) convey the inspiration to His Servant- (conveyed) what He (meant) to convey.

ArabicText: مَا كَذَبَ ٱلۡفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰۤ ۝١١
Translation: The (Prophet´s) (mind and) heart in no way falsified that which he saw.

ArabicText: أَفَتُمَـٰرُونَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَا یَرَىٰ ۝١٢
Translation: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he saw?

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ نَزۡلَةً أُخۡرَىٰ ۝١٣
Translation: For indeed he saw him at a second descent,

ArabicText: عِندَ سِدۡرَةِ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ ۝١٤
Translation: Near the Lote-tree beyond which none may pass:

ArabicText: عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰۤ ۝١٥
Translation: Near it is the Garden of Abode.

ArabicText: إِذۡ یَغۡشَى ٱلسِّدۡرَةَ مَا یَغۡشَىٰ ۝١٦
Translation: Behold, the Lote-tree was shrouded (in mystery unspeakable!)

ArabicText: مَا زَاغَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ ۝١٧
Translation: (His) sight never swerved, nor did it go wrong!

ArabicText: لَقَدۡ رَأَىٰ مِنۡ ءَایَـٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰۤ ۝١٨
Translation: For truly did he see, of the Signs of his Lord, the Greatest!

ArabicText: أَفَرَءَیۡتُمُ ٱللَّـٰتَ وَٱلۡعُزَّىٰ ۝١٩
Translation: Have ye seen Lat. and ´Uzza,

ArabicText: وَمَنَوٰةَ ٱلثَّالِثَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰۤ ۝٢٠
Translation: And another, the third (goddess), Manat?

ArabicText: أَلَكُمُ ٱلذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ ۝٢١
Translation: What! for you the male sex, and for Him, the female?

ArabicText: تِلۡكَ إِذࣰا قِسۡمَةࣱ ضِیزَىٰۤ ۝٢٢
Translation: Behold, such would be indeed a division most unfair!

ArabicText: إِنۡ هِیَ إِلَّاۤ أَسۡمَاۤءࣱ سَمَّیۡتُمُوهَاۤ أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَاۤؤُكُم مَّاۤ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلۡطَـٰنٍۚ إِن یَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهۡوَى ٱلۡأَنفُسُۖ وَلَقَدۡ جَاۤءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلۡهُدَىٰۤ ۝٢٣
Translation: These are nothing but names which ye have devised,- ye and your fathers,- for which Allah has sent down no authority (whatever). They follow nothing but conjecture and what their own souls desire!- Even though there has already come to them Guidance from their Lord!

ArabicText: أَمۡ لِلۡإِنسَـٰنِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ ۝٢٤
Translation: Nay, shall man have (just) anything he hankers after?

ArabicText: فَلِلَّهِ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةُ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ ۝٢٥
Translation: But it is to Allah that the End and the Beginning (of all things) belong.

ArabicText: ۞ وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكࣲ فِی ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ لَا تُغۡنِی شَفَـٰعَتُهُمۡ شَیۡـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ أَن یَأۡذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن یَشَاۤءُ وَیَرۡضَىٰۤ ۝٢٦
Translation: How many-so-ever be the angels in the heavens, their intercession will avail nothing except after Allah has given leave for whom He pleases and that he is acceptable to Him.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ لَا یُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةِ لَیُسَمُّونَ ٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةَ تَسۡمِیَةَ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ ۝٢٧
Translation: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.

ArabicText: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنۡ عِلۡمٍۖ إِن یَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا یُغۡنِی مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ شَیۡـࣰٔا ۝٢٨
Translation: But they have no knowledge therein. They follow nothing but conjecture; and conjecture avails nothing against Truth.

ArabicText: فَأَعۡرِضۡ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكۡرِنَا وَلَمۡ یُرِدۡ إِلَّا ٱلۡحَیَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡیَا ۝٢٩
Translation: Therefore shun those who turn away from Our Message and desire nothing but the life of this world.

ArabicText: ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ مَبۡلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِیلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهۡتَدَىٰ ۝٣٠
Translation: That is as far as knowledge will reach them. Verily thy Lord knoweth best those who stray from His Path, and He knoweth best those who receive guidance.

ArabicText: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِی ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَمَا فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ لِیَجۡزِیَ ٱلَّذِینَ أَسَـٰۤـُٔوا۟ بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَیَجۡزِیَ ٱلَّذِینَ أَحۡسَنُوا۟ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَى ۝٣١
Translation: Yea, to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: so that He rewards those who do evil, according to their deeds, and He rewards those who do good, with what is best.

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ یَجۡتَنِبُونَ كَبَـٰۤىِٕرَ ٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡفَوَ ٰ⁠حِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَ ٰ⁠سِعُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِۚ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِكُمۡ إِذۡ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِذۡ أَنتُمۡ أَجِنَّةࣱ فِی بُطُونِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمۡۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوۤا۟ أَنفُسَكُمۡۖ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰۤ ۝٣٢
Translation: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults,- verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you well when He brings you out of the earth, And when ye are hidden in your mothers´ wombs. Therefore justify not yourselves: He knows best who it is that guards against evil.

ArabicText: أَفَرَءَیۡتَ ٱلَّذِی تَوَلَّىٰ ۝٣٣
Translation: Seest thou one who turns back,

ArabicText: وَأَعۡطَىٰ قَلِیلࣰا وَأَكۡدَىٰۤ ۝٣٤
Translation: Gives a little, then hardens (his heart)?

ArabicText: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلۡمُ ٱلۡغَیۡبِ فَهُوَ یَرَىٰۤ ۝٣٥
Translation: What! Has he knowledge of the Unseen so that he can see?

ArabicText: أَمۡ لَمۡ یُنَبَّأۡ بِمَا فِی صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ ۝٣٦
Translation: Nay, is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses-

ArabicText: وَإِبۡرَ ٰ⁠هِیمَ ٱلَّذِی وَفَّىٰۤ ۝٣٧
Translation: And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-

ArabicText: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةࣱ وِزۡرَ أُخۡرَىٰ ۝٣٨
Translation: Namely, that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;

ArabicText: وَأَن لَّیۡسَ لِلۡإِنسَـٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ ۝٣٩
Translation: That man can have nothing but what he strives for;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّ سَعۡیَهُۥ سَوۡفَ یُرَىٰ ۝٤٠
Translation: That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight:

ArabicText: ثُمَّ یُجۡزَىٰهُ ٱلۡجَزَاۤءَ ٱلۡأَوۡفَىٰ ۝٤١
Translation: Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ ۝٤٢
Translation: That to thy Lord is the final Goal;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضۡحَكَ وَأَبۡكَىٰ ۝٤٣
Translation: That it is He Who granteth Laughter and Tears;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحۡیَا ۝٤٤
Translation: That it is He Who granteth Death and Life;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوۡجَیۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰ ۝٤٥
Translation: That He did create in pairs,- male and female,

ArabicText: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ إِذَا تُمۡنَىٰ ۝٤٦
Translation: From a seed when lodged (in its place);

ArabicText: وَأَنَّ عَلَیۡهِ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰ ۝٤٧
Translation: That He hath promised a Second Creation (Raising of the Dead);

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغۡنَىٰ وَأَقۡنَىٰ ۝٤٨
Translation: That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعۡرَىٰ ۝٤٩
Translation: That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star);

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥۤ أَهۡلَكَ عَادًا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ ۝٥٠
Translation: And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient ´Ad (people),

ArabicText: وَثَمُودَا۟ فَمَاۤ أَبۡقَىٰ ۝٥١
Translation: And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.

ArabicText: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحࣲ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوا۟ هُمۡ أَظۡلَمَ وَأَطۡغَىٰ ۝٥٢
Translation: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,

ArabicText: وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَةَ أَهۡوَىٰ ۝٥٣
Translation: And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah).

ArabicText: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ ۝٥٤
Translation: So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ ۝٥٥
Translation: Then which of the gifts of thy Lord, (O man,) wilt thou dispute about?

ArabicText: هَـٰذَا نَذِیرࣱ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰۤ ۝٥٦
Translation: This is a Warner, of the (series of) Warners of old!

ArabicText: أَزِفَتِ ٱلۡـَٔازِفَةُ ۝٥٧
Translation: The (Judgment) ever approaching draws nigh:

ArabicText: لَیۡسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ ۝٥٨
Translation: No (soul) but Allah can lay it bare.

ArabicText: أَفَمِنۡ هَـٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِیثِ تَعۡجَبُونَ ۝٥٩
Translation: Do ye then wonder at this recital?

ArabicText: وَتَضۡحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبۡكُونَ ۝٦٠
Translation: And will ye laugh and not weep,-

ArabicText: وَأَنتُمۡ سَـٰمِدُونَ ۝٦١
Translation: Wasting your time in vanities?

ArabicText: فَٱسۡجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ وَٱعۡبُدُوا۟ ۩ ۝٦٢
Translation: But fall ye down in prostration to Allah, and adore (Him)!

ArabicText: ٱقۡتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلۡقَمَرُ ۝١
Translation: The Hour (of Judgment) is nigh, and the moon is cleft asunder.

ArabicText: وَإِن یَرَوۡا۟ ءَایَةࣰ یُعۡرِضُوا۟ وَیَقُولُوا۟ سِحۡرࣱ مُّسۡتَمِرࣱّ ۝٢
Translation: But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."

ArabicText: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعُوۤا۟ أَهۡوَاۤءَهُمۡۚ وَكُلُّ أَمۡرࣲ مُّسۡتَقِرࣱّ ۝٣
Translation: They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) lusts but every matter has its appointed time.

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ جَاۤءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۢبَاۤءِ مَا فِیهِ مُزۡدَجَرٌ ۝٤
Translation: There have already come to them Recitals wherein there is (enough) to check (them),

ArabicText: حِكۡمَةُۢ بَـٰلِغَةࣱۖ فَمَا تُغۡنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ ۝٥
Translation: Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.

ArabicText: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡۘ یَوۡمَ یَدۡعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَیۡءࣲ نُّكُرٍ ۝٦
Translation: Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day that the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair,

ArabicText: خُشَّعًا أَبۡصَـٰرُهُمۡ یَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمۡ جَرَادࣱ مُّنتَشِرࣱ ۝٧
Translation: They will come forth,- their eyes humbled - from (their) graves, (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad,

ArabicText: مُّهۡطِعِینَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِۖ یَقُولُ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا یَوۡمٌ عَسِرࣱ ۝٨
Translation: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!", the Unbelievers will say.

ArabicText: ۞ كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحࣲ فَكَذَّبُوا۟ عَبۡدَنَا وَقَالُوا۟ مَجۡنُونࣱ وَٱزۡدُجِرَ ۝٩
Translation: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.

ArabicText: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥۤ أَنِّی مَغۡلُوبࣱ فَٱنتَصِرۡ ۝١٠
Translation: Then he called on his Lord: "I am one overcome: do Thou then help (me)!"

ArabicText: فَفَتَحۡنَاۤ أَبۡوَ ٰ⁠بَ ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ بِمَاۤءࣲ مُّنۡهَمِرࣲ ۝١١
Translation: So We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth.

ArabicText: وَفَجَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ عُیُونࣰا فَٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡمَاۤءُ عَلَىٰۤ أَمۡرࣲ قَدۡ قُدِرَ ۝١٢
Translation: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.

ArabicText: وَحَمَلۡنَـٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلۡوَ ٰ⁠حࣲ وَدُسُرࣲ ۝١٣
Translation: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

ArabicText: تَجۡرِی بِأَعۡیُنِنَا جَزَاۤءࣰ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ ۝١٤
Translation: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!

ArabicText: وَلَقَد تَّرَكۡنَـٰهَاۤ ءَایَةࣰ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرࣲ ۝١٥
Translation: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?

ArabicText: فَكَیۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِی وَنُذُرِ ۝١٦
Translation: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ یَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرࣲ ۝١٧
Translation: And We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?

ArabicText: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادࣱ فَكَیۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِی وَنُذُرِ ۝١٨
Translation: The ´Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَیۡهِمۡ رِیحࣰا صَرۡصَرࣰا فِی یَوۡمِ نَحۡسࣲ مُّسۡتَمِرࣲّ ۝١٩
Translation: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,

ArabicText: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلࣲ مُّنقَعِرࣲ ۝٢٠
Translation: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).

ArabicText: فَكَیۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِی وَنُذُرِ ۝٢١
Translation: Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ یَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرࣲ ۝٢٢
Translation: But We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?

ArabicText: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ ۝٢٣
Translation: The Thamud (also) rejected (their) Warners.

ArabicText: فَقَالُوۤا۟ أَبَشَرࣰا مِّنَّا وَ ٰ⁠حِدࣰا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥۤ إِنَّاۤ إِذࣰا لَّفِی ضَلَـٰلࣲ وَسُعُرٍ ۝٢٤
Translation: For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind, and mad!

ArabicText: أَءُلۡقِیَ ٱلذِّكۡرُ عَلَیۡهِ مِنۢ بَیۡنِنَا بَلۡ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرࣱ ۝٢٥
Translation: "Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"

ArabicText: سَیَعۡلَمُونَ غَدࣰا مَّنِ ٱلۡكَذَّابُ ٱلۡأَشِرُ ۝٢٦
Translation: Ah! they will know on the morrow, which is the liar, the insolent one!

ArabicText: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةࣰ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ ۝٢٧
Translation: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!

ArabicText: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ أَنَّ ٱلۡمَاۤءَ قِسۡمَةُۢ بَیۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلُّ شِرۡبࣲ مُّحۡتَضَرࣱ ۝٢٨
Translation: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one´s right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).

ArabicText: فَنَادَوۡا۟ صَاحِبَهُمۡ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ ۝٢٩
Translation: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).

ArabicText: فَكَیۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِی وَنُذُرِ ۝٣٠
Translation: Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَیۡهِمۡ صَیۡحَةࣰ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣰ فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِیمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ ۝٣١
Translation: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ یَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرࣲ ۝٣٢
Translation: And We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?

ArabicText: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطِۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ ۝٣٣
Translation: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَیۡهِمۡ حَاصِبًا إِلَّاۤ ءَالَ لُوطࣲۖ نَّجَّیۡنَـٰهُم بِسَحَرࣲ ۝٣٤
Translation: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut´s household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-

ArabicText: نِّعۡمَةࣰ مِّنۡ عِندِنَاۚ كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ نَجۡزِی مَن شَكَرَ ۝٣٥
Translation: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ أَنذَرَهُم بَطۡشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوۡا۟ بِٱلنُّذُرِ ۝٣٦
Translation: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ رَ ٰ⁠وَدُوهُ عَن ضَیۡفِهِۦ فَطَمَسۡنَاۤ أَعۡیُنَهُمۡ فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِی وَنُذُرِ ۝٣٧
Translation: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ صَبَّحَهُم بُكۡرَةً عَذَابࣱ مُّسۡتَقِرࣱّ ۝٣٨
Translation: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:

ArabicText: فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِی وَنُذُرِ ۝٣٩
Translation: "So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ یَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرࣲ ۝٤٠
Translation: And We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ جَاۤءَ ءَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ ۝٤١
Translation: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from Allah).

ArabicText: كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذۡنَـٰهُمۡ أَخۡذَ عَزِیزࣲ مُّقۡتَدِرٍ ۝٤٢
Translation: The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His Will.

ArabicText: أَكُفَّارُكُمۡ خَیۡرࣱ مِّنۡ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكُمۡ أَمۡ لَكُم بَرَاۤءَةࣱ فِی ٱلزُّبُرِ ۝٤٣
Translation: Are your Unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?

ArabicText: أَمۡ یَقُولُونَ نَحۡنُ جَمِیعࣱ مُّنتَصِرࣱ ۝٤٤
Translation: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?

ArabicText: سَیُهۡزَمُ ٱلۡجَمۡعُ وَیُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ ۝٤٥
Translation: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.

ArabicText: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوۡعِدُهُمۡ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدۡهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ ۝٤٦
Translation: Nay, the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِینَ فِی ضَلَـٰلࣲ وَسُعُرࣲ ۝٤٧
Translation: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یُسۡحَبُونَ فِی ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ ذُوقُوا۟ مَسَّ سَقَرَ ۝٤٨
Translation: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"

ArabicText: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَیۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَـٰهُ بِقَدَرࣲ ۝٤٩
Translation: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَمۡرُنَاۤ إِلَّا وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣱ كَلَمۡحِۭ بِٱلۡبَصَرِ ۝٥٠
Translation: And Our Command is but a single (Act),- like the twinkling of an eye.

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَاۤ أَشۡیَاعَكُمۡ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرࣲ ۝٥١
Translation: And (oft) in the past, have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?

ArabicText: وَكُلُّ شَیۡءࣲ فَعَلُوهُ فِی ٱلزُّبُرِ ۝٥٢
Translation: All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):

ArabicText: وَكُلُّ صَغِیرࣲ وَكَبِیرࣲ مُّسۡتَطَرٌ ۝٥٣
Translation: Every matter, small and great, is on record.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِینَ فِی جَنَّـٰتࣲ وَنَهَرࣲ ۝٥٤
Translation: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,

ArabicText: فِی مَقۡعَدِ صِدۡقٍ عِندَ مَلِیكࣲ مُّقۡتَدِرِۭ ۝٥٥
Translation: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.

ArabicText: ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنُ ۝١
Translation: (Allah) Most Gracious!

ArabicText: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ ۝٢
Translation: It is He Who has taught the Qur´an.

ArabicText: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ ۝٣
Translation: He has created man:

ArabicText: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلۡبَیَانَ ۝٤
Translation: He has taught him speech (and intelligence).

ArabicText: ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ بِحُسۡبَانࣲ ۝٥
Translation: The sun and the moon follow courses (exactly) computed;

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّجۡمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ یَسۡجُدَانِ ۝٦
Translation: And the herbs and the trees - both (alike) prostrate in adoration.

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلۡمِیزَانَ ۝٧
Translation: And the Firmament has He raised high, and He has set up the Balance (of Justice),

ArabicText: أَلَّا تَطۡغَوۡا۟ فِی ٱلۡمِیزَانِ ۝٨
Translation: In order that ye may not transgress (due) balance.

ArabicText: وَأَقِیمُوا۟ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُوا۟ ٱلۡمِیزَانَ ۝٩
Translation: So establish weight with justice and fall not short in the balance.

ArabicText: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلۡأَنَامِ ۝١٠
Translation: It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) creatures:

ArabicText: فِیهَا فَـٰكِهَةࣱ وَٱلنَّخۡلُ ذَاتُ ٱلۡأَكۡمَامِ ۝١١
Translation: Therein is fruit and date-palms, producing spathes (enclosing dates);

ArabicText: وَٱلۡحَبُّ ذُو ٱلۡعَصۡفِ وَٱلرَّیۡحَانُ ۝١٢
Translation: Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-smelling plants.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝١٣
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَـٰلࣲ كَٱلۡفَخَّارِ ۝١٤
Translation: He created man from sounding clay like unto pottery,

ArabicText: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَاۤنَّ مِن مَّارِجࣲ مِّن نَّارࣲ ۝١٥
Translation: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝١٦
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقَیۡنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَغۡرِبَیۡنِ ۝١٧
Translation: (He is) Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝١٨
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: مَرَجَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَیۡنِ یَلۡتَقِیَانِ ۝١٩
Translation: He has let free the two bodies of flowing water, meeting together:

ArabicText: بَیۡنَهُمَا بَرۡزَخࣱ لَّا یَبۡغِیَانِ ۝٢٠
Translation: Between them is a Barrier which they do not transgress:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٢١
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: یَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهُمَا ٱللُّؤۡلُؤُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ ۝٢٢
Translation: Out of them come Pearls and Coral:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٢٣
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِی ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَـٰمِ ۝٢٤
Translation: And His are the Ships sailing smoothly through the seas, lofty as mountains:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٢٥
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: كُلُّ مَنۡ عَلَیۡهَا فَانࣲ ۝٢٦
Translation: All that is on earth will perish:

ArabicText: وَیَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ ۝٢٧
Translation: But will abide (for ever) the Face of thy Lord,- full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٢٨
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: یَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِی ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ یَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِی شَأۡنࣲ ۝٢٩
Translation: Of Him seeks (its need) every creature in the heavens and on earth: every day in (new) Splendour doth He (shine)!

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٣٠
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: سَنَفۡرُغُ لَكُمۡ أَیُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ ۝٣١
Translation: Soon shall We settle your affairs, O both ye worlds!

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٣٢
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: یَـٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُوا۟ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُوا۟ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَـٰنࣲ ۝٣٣
Translation: O ye assembly of Jinns and men! If it be ye can pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, pass ye! not without authority shall ye be able to pass!

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٣٤
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: یُرۡسَلُ عَلَیۡكُمَا شُوَاظࣱ مِّن نَّارࣲ وَنُحَاسࣱ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ ۝٣٥
Translation: On you will be sent (O ye evil ones twain!) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke): no defence will ye have:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٣٦
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةࣰ كَٱلدِّهَانِ ۝٣٧
Translation: When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٣٨
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: فَیَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّا یُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦۤ إِنسࣱ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ ۝٣٩
Translation: On that Day no question will be asked of man or Jinn as to his sin.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٤٠
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: یُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِیمَـٰهُمۡ فَیُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَ ٰ⁠صِی وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ ۝٤١
Translation: (For) the sinners will be known by their marks: and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٤٢
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: هَـٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِی یُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ ۝٤٣
Translation: This is the Hell which the Sinners deny:

ArabicText: یَطُوفُونَ بَیۡنَهَا وَبَیۡنَ حَمِیمٍ ءَانࣲ ۝٤٤
Translation: In its midst and in the midst of boiling hot water will they wander round!

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٤٥
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: وَلِمَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ ۝٤٦
Translation: But for such as fear the time when they will stand before (the Judgment Seat of) their Lord, there will be two Gardens-

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٤٧
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: ذَوَاتَاۤ أَفۡنَانࣲ ۝٤٨
Translation: Containing all kinds (of trees and delights);-

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٤٩
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: فِیهِمَا عَیۡنَانِ تَجۡرِیَانِ ۝٥٠
Translation: In them (each) will be two Springs flowing (free);

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٥١
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: فِیهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَـٰكِهَةࣲ زَوۡجَانِ ۝٥٢
Translation: In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٥٣
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَاۤىِٕنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقࣲۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَیۡنِ دَانࣲ ۝٥٤
Translation: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٥٥
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: فِیهِنَّ قَـٰصِرَ ٰ⁠تُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ یَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسࣱ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ ۝٥٦
Translation: In them will be (Maidens), chaste, restraining their glances, whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٥٧
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلۡیَاقُوتُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ ۝٥٨
Translation: Like unto Rubies and coral.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٥٩
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: هَلۡ جَزَاۤءُ ٱلۡإِحۡسَـٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلۡإِحۡسَـٰنُ ۝٦٠
Translation: Is there any Reward for Good - other than Good?

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٦١
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ ۝٦٢
Translation: And besides these two, there are two other Gardens,-

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٦٣
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: مُدۡهَاۤمَّتَانِ ۝٦٤
Translation: Dark-green in colour (from plentiful watering).

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٦٥
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: فِیهِمَا عَیۡنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ ۝٦٦
Translation: In them (each) will be two Springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٦٧
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: فِیهِمَا فَـٰكِهَةࣱ وَنَخۡلࣱ وَرُمَّانࣱ ۝٦٨
Translation: In them will be Fruits, and dates and pomegranates:

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٦٩
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: فِیهِنَّ خَیۡرَ ٰ⁠تٌ حِسَانࣱ ۝٧٠
Translation: In them will be fair (Companions), good, beautiful;-

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٧١
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: حُورࣱ مَّقۡصُورَ ٰ⁠تࣱ فِی ٱلۡخِیَامِ ۝٧٢
Translation: Companions restrained (as to their glances), in (goodly) pavilions;-

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٧٣
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: لَمۡ یَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسࣱ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ ۝٧٤
Translation: Whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٧٥
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-

ArabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرࣲ وَعَبۡقَرِیٍّ حِسَانࣲ ۝٧٦
Translation: Reclining on green Cushions and rich Carpets of beauty.

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ ءَالَاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ ۝٧٧
Translation: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?

ArabicText: تَبَـٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِی ٱلۡجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ ۝٧٨
Translation: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.

ArabicText: إِذَا وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ ۝١
Translation: When the Event inevitable cometh to pass,

ArabicText: لَیۡسَ لِوَقۡعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ ۝٢
Translation: Then will no (soul) entertain falsehood concerning its coming.

ArabicText: خَافِضَةࣱ رَّافِعَةٌ ۝٣
Translation: (Many) will it bring low; (many) will it exalt;

ArabicText: إِذَا رُجَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ رَجࣰّا ۝٤
Translation: When the earth shall be shaken to its depths,

ArabicText: وَبُسَّتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ بَسࣰّا ۝٥
Translation: And the mountains shall be crumbled to atoms,

ArabicText: فَكَانَتۡ هَبَاۤءࣰ مُّنۢبَثࣰّا ۝٦
Translation: Becoming dust scattered abroad,

ArabicText: وَكُنتُمۡ أَزۡوَ ٰ⁠جࣰا ثَلَـٰثَةࣰ ۝٧
Translation: And ye shall be sorted out into three classes.

ArabicText: فَأَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَیۡمَنَةِ مَاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَیۡمَنَةِ ۝٨
Translation: Then (there will be) the Companions of the Right Hand;- What will be the Companions of the Right Hand?

ArabicText: وَأَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ مَاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ ۝٩
Translation: And the Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّـٰبِقُونَ ٱلسَّـٰبِقُونَ ۝١٠
Translation: And those Foremost (in Faith) will be Foremost (in the Hereafter).

ArabicText: أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ ۝١١
Translation: These will be those Nearest to Allah:

ArabicText: فِی جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِیمِ ۝١٢
Translation: In Gardens of Bliss:

ArabicText: ثُلَّةࣱ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ ۝١٣
Translation: A number of people from those of old,

ArabicText: وَقَلِیلࣱ مِّنَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرِینَ ۝١٤
Translation: And a few from those of later times.

ArabicText: عَلَىٰ سُرُرࣲ مَّوۡضُونَةࣲ ۝١٥
Translation: (They will be) on Thrones encrusted (with gold and precious stones),

ArabicText: مُّتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَیۡهَا مُتَقَـٰبِلِینَ ۝١٦
Translation: Reclining on them, facing each other.

ArabicText: یَطُوفُ عَلَیۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَ ٰ⁠نࣱ مُّخَلَّدُونَ ۝١٧
Translation: Round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness),

ArabicText: بِأَكۡوَابࣲ وَأَبَارِیقَ وَكَأۡسࣲ مِّن مَّعِینࣲ ۝١٨
Translation: With goblets, (shining) beakers, and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:

ArabicText: لَّا یُصَدَّعُونَ عَنۡهَا وَلَا یُنزِفُونَ ۝١٩
Translation: No after-ache will they receive therefrom, nor will they suffer intoxication:

ArabicText: وَفَـٰكِهَةࣲ مِّمَّا یَتَخَیَّرُونَ ۝٢٠
Translation: And with fruits, any that they may select:

ArabicText: وَلَحۡمِ طَیۡرࣲ مِّمَّا یَشۡتَهُونَ ۝٢١
Translation: And the flesh of fowls, any that they may desire.

ArabicText: وَحُورٌ عِینࣱ ۝٢٢
Translation: And (there will be) Companions with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes,-

ArabicText: كَأَمۡثَـٰلِ ٱللُّؤۡلُوِٕ ٱلۡمَكۡنُونِ ۝٢٣
Translation: Like unto Pearls well-guarded.

ArabicText: جَزَاۤءَۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ یَعۡمَلُونَ ۝٢٤
Translation: A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).

ArabicText: لَا یَسۡمَعُونَ فِیهَا لَغۡوࣰا وَلَا تَأۡثِیمًا ۝٢٥
Translation: Not frivolity will they hear therein, nor any taint of ill,-

ArabicText: إِلَّا قِیلࣰا سَلَـٰمࣰا سَلَـٰمࣰا ۝٢٦
Translation: Only the saying, "Peace! Peace".

ArabicText: وَأَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡیَمِینِ مَاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡیَمِینِ ۝٢٧
Translation: The Companions of the Right Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Right Hand?

ArabicText: فِی سِدۡرࣲ مَّخۡضُودࣲ ۝٢٨
Translation: (They will be) among Lote-trees without thorns,

ArabicText: وَطَلۡحࣲ مَّنضُودࣲ ۝٢٩
Translation: Among Talh trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another,-

ArabicText: وَظِلࣲّ مَّمۡدُودࣲ ۝٣٠
Translation: In shade long-extended,

ArabicText: وَمَاۤءࣲ مَّسۡكُوبࣲ ۝٣١
Translation: By water flowing constantly,

ArabicText: وَفَـٰكِهَةࣲ كَثِیرَةࣲ ۝٣٢
Translation: And fruit in abundance.

ArabicText: لَّا مَقۡطُوعَةࣲ وَلَا مَمۡنُوعَةࣲ ۝٣٣
Translation: Whose season is not limited, nor (supply) forbidden,

ArabicText: وَفُرُشࣲ مَّرۡفُوعَةٍ ۝٣٤
Translation: And on Thrones (of Dignity), raised high.

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَنشَأۡنَـٰهُنَّ إِنشَاۤءࣰ ۝٣٥
Translation: We have created (their Companions) of special creation.

ArabicText: فَجَعَلۡنَـٰهُنَّ أَبۡكَارًا ۝٣٦
Translation: And made them virgin - pure (and undefiled), -

ArabicText: عُرُبًا أَتۡرَابࣰا ۝٣٧
Translation: Beloved (by nature), equal in age,-

ArabicText: لِّأَصۡحَـٰبِ ٱلۡیَمِینِ ۝٣٨
Translation: For the Companions of the Right Hand.

ArabicText: ثُلَّةࣱ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ ۝٣٩
Translation: A (goodly) number from those of old,

ArabicText: وَثُلَّةࣱ مِّنَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرِینَ ۝٤٠
Translation: And a (goodly) number from those of later times.

ArabicText: وَأَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ مَاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ ۝٤١
Translation: The Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?

ArabicText: فِی سَمُومࣲ وَحَمِیمࣲ ۝٤٢
Translation: (They will be) in the midst of a Fierce Blast of Fire and in Boiling Water,

ArabicText: وَظِلࣲّ مِّن یَحۡمُومࣲ ۝٤٣
Translation: And in the shades of Black Smoke:

ArabicText: لَّا بَارِدࣲ وَلَا كَرِیمٍ ۝٤٤
Translation: Nothing (will there be) to refresh, nor to please:

ArabicText: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوا۟ قَبۡلَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ مُتۡرَفِینَ ۝٤٥
Translation: For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),

ArabicText: وَكَانُوا۟ یُصِرُّونَ عَلَى ٱلۡحِنثِ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ ۝٤٦
Translation: And persisted obstinately in wickedness supreme!

ArabicText: وَكَانُوا۟ یَقُولُونَ أَىِٕذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابࣰا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ ۝٤٧
Translation: And they used to say, "What! when we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be raised up again?-

ArabicText: أَوَءَابَاۤؤُنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ ۝٤٨
Translation: "(We) and our fathers of old?"

ArabicText: قُلۡ إِنَّ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ وَٱلۡـَٔاخِرِینَ ۝٤٩
Translation: Say: "Yea, those of old and those of later times,

ArabicText: لَمَجۡمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِیقَـٰتِ یَوۡمࣲ مَّعۡلُومࣲ ۝٥٠
Translation: "All will certainly be gathered together for the meeting appointed for a Day well-known.

ArabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمۡ أَیُّهَا ٱلضَّاۤلُّونَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبُونَ ۝٥١
Translation: "Then will ye truly,- O ye that go wrong, and treat (Truth) as Falsehood!-

ArabicText: لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرࣲ مِّن زَقُّومࣲ ۝٥٢
Translation: "Ye will surely taste of the Tree of Zaqqum.

ArabicText: فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ ۝٥٣
Translation: "Then will ye fill your insides therewith,

ArabicText: فَشَـٰرِبُونَ عَلَیۡهِ مِنَ ٱلۡحَمِیمِ ۝٥٤
Translation: "And drink Boiling Water on top of it:

ArabicText: فَشَـٰرِبُونَ شُرۡبَ ٱلۡهِیمِ ۝٥٥
Translation: "Indeed ye shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst!"

ArabicText: هَـٰذَا نُزُلُهُمۡ یَوۡمَ ٱلدِّینِ ۝٥٦
Translation: Such will be their entertainment on the Day of Requital!

ArabicText: نَحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَـٰكُمۡ فَلَوۡلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ ۝٥٧
Translation: It is We Who have created you: why will ye not witness the Truth?

ArabicText: أَفَرَءَیۡتُم مَّا تُمۡنُونَ ۝٥٨
Translation: Do ye then see?- The (human Seed) that ye throw out,-

ArabicText: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَخۡلُقُونَهُۥۤ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡخَـٰلِقُونَ ۝٥٩
Translation: Is it ye who create it, or are We the Creators?

ArabicText: نَحۡنُ قَدَّرۡنَا بَیۡنَكُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِینَ ۝٦٠
Translation: We have decreed Death to be your common lot, and We are not to be frustrated

ArabicText: عَلَىٰۤ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمۡثَـٰلَكُمۡ وَنُنشِئَكُمۡ فِی مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٦١
Translation: from changing your Forms and creating you (again) in (forms) that ye know not.

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتُمُ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ فَلَوۡلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ ۝٦٢
Translation: And ye certainly know already the first form of creation: why then do ye not celebrate His praises?

ArabicText: أَفَرَءَیۡتُم مَّا تَحۡرُثُونَ ۝٦٣
Translation: See ye the seed that ye sow in the ground?

ArabicText: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَزۡرَعُونَهُۥۤ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلزَّ ٰ⁠رِعُونَ ۝٦٤
Translation: Is it ye that cause it to grow, or are We the Cause?

ArabicText: لَوۡ نَشَاۤءُ لَجَعَلۡنَـٰهُ حُطَـٰمࣰا فَظَلۡتُمۡ تَفَكَّهُونَ ۝٦٥
Translation: Were it Our Will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and ye would be left in wonderment,

ArabicText: إِنَّا لَمُغۡرَمُونَ ۝٦٦
Translation: (Saying), "We are indeed left with debts (for nothing):

ArabicText: بَلۡ نَحۡنُ مَحۡرُومُونَ ۝٦٧
Translation: "Indeed are we shut out (of the fruits of our labour)"

ArabicText: أَفَرَءَیۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَاۤءَ ٱلَّذِی تَشۡرَبُونَ ۝٦٨
Translation: See ye the water which ye drink?

ArabicText: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنزَلۡتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُزۡنِ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنزِلُونَ ۝٦٩
Translation: Do ye bring it down (in rain) from the cloud or do We?

ArabicText: لَوۡ نَشَاۤءُ جَعَلۡنَـٰهُ أُجَاجࣰا فَلَوۡلَا تَشۡكُرُونَ ۝٧٠
Translation: Were it Our Will, We could make it salt (and unpalatable): then why do ye not give thanks?

ArabicText: أَفَرَءَیۡتُمُ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِی تُورُونَ ۝٧١
Translation: See ye the Fire which ye kindle?

ArabicText: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنشَأۡتُمۡ شَجَرَتَهَاۤ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنشِـُٔونَ ۝٧٢
Translation: Is it ye who grow the tree which feeds the fire, or do We grow it?

ArabicText: نَحۡنُ جَعَلۡنَـٰهَا تَذۡكِرَةࣰ وَمَتَـٰعࣰا لِّلۡمُقۡوِینَ ۝٧٣
Translation: We have made it a memorial (of Our handiwork), and an article of comfort and convenience for the denizens of deserts.

ArabicText: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ ۝٧٤
Translation: Then celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme!

ArabicText: ۞ فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِمَوَ ٰ⁠قِعِ ٱلنُّجُومِ ۝٧٥
Translation: Furthermore I call to witness the setting of the Stars,-

ArabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَقَسَمࣱ لَّوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عَظِیمٌ ۝٧٦
Translation: And that is indeed a mighty adjuration if ye but knew,-

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ لَقُرۡءَانࣱ كَرِیمࣱ ۝٧٧
Translation: That this is indeed a qur´an Most Honourable,

ArabicText: فِی كِتَـٰبࣲ مَّكۡنُونࣲ ۝٧٨
Translation: In Book well-guarded,

ArabicText: لَّا یَمَسُّهُۥۤ إِلَّا ٱلۡمُطَهَّرُونَ ۝٧٩
Translation: Which none shall touch but those who are clean:

ArabicText: تَنزِیلࣱ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ ۝٨٠
Translation: A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

ArabicText: أَفَبِهَـٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِیثِ أَنتُم مُّدۡهِنُونَ ۝٨١
Translation: Is it such a Message that ye would hold in light esteem?

ArabicText: وَتَجۡعَلُونَ رِزۡقَكُمۡ أَنَّكُمۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ ۝٨٢
Translation: And have ye made it your livelihood that ye should declare it false?

ArabicText: فَلَوۡلَاۤ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلۡحُلۡقُومَ ۝٨٣
Translation: Then why do ye not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throat,-

ArabicText: وَأَنتُمۡ حِینَىِٕذࣲ تَنظُرُونَ ۝٨٤
Translation: And ye the while (sit) looking on,-

ArabicText: وَنَحۡنُ أَقۡرَبُ إِلَیۡهِ مِنكُمۡ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تُبۡصِرُونَ ۝٨٥
Translation: But We are nearer to him than ye, and yet see not,-

ArabicText: فَلَوۡلَاۤ إِن كُنتُمۡ غَیۡرَ مَدِینِینَ ۝٨٦
Translation: Then why do ye not,- If you are exempt from (future) account,-

ArabicText: تَرۡجِعُونَهَاۤ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَـٰدِقِینَ ۝٨٧
Translation: Call back the soul, if ye are true (in the claim of independence)?

ArabicText: فَأَمَّاۤ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِینَ ۝٨٨
Translation: Thus, then, if he be of those Nearest to Allah,

ArabicText: فَرَوۡحࣱ وَرَیۡحَانࣱ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِیمࣲ ۝٨٩
Translation: (There is for him) Rest and Satisfaction, and a Garden of Delights.

ArabicText: وَأَمَّاۤ إِن كَانَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَـٰبِ ٱلۡیَمِینِ ۝٩٠
Translation: And if he be of the Companions of the Right Hand,

ArabicText: فَسَلَـٰمࣱ لَّكَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَـٰبِ ٱلۡیَمِینِ ۝٩١
Translation: (For him is the salutation), "Peace be unto thee", from the Companions of the Right Hand.

ArabicText: وَأَمَّاۤ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ٱلضَّاۤلِّینَ ۝٩٢
Translation: And if he be of those who treat (Truth) as Falsehood, who go wrong,

ArabicText: فَنُزُلࣱ مِّنۡ حَمِیمࣲ ۝٩٣
Translation: For him is Entertainment with Boiling Water.

ArabicText: وَتَصۡلِیَةُ جَحِیمٍ ۝٩٤
Translation: And burning in Hell-Fire.

ArabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ حَقُّ ٱلۡیَقِینِ ۝٩٥
Translation: Verily, this is the Very Truth and Certainly.

ArabicText: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ ۝٩٦
Translation: So celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord, the Supreme.

ArabicText: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِی ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِیزُ ٱلۡحَكِیمُ ۝١
Translation: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth,- let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ArabicText: لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ یُحۡیِۦ وَیُمِیتُۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَیۡءࣲ قَدِیرٌ ۝٢
Translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and He has Power over all things.

ArabicText: هُوَ ٱلۡأَوَّلُ وَٱلۡـَٔاخِرُ وَٱلظَّـٰهِرُ وَٱلۡبَاطِنُۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَیۡءٍ عَلِیمٌ ۝٣
Translation: He is the First and the Last, the Evident and the Immanent: and He has full knowledge of all things.

ArabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِی خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فِی سِتَّةِ أَیَّامࣲ ثُمَّ ٱسۡتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡعَرۡشِۖ یَعۡلَمُ مَا یَلِجُ فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا یَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهَا وَمَا یَنزِلُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ وَمَا یَعۡرُجُ فِیهَاۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمۡ أَیۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ بَصِیرࣱ ۝٤
Translation: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in Six Days, and is moreover firmly established on the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes forth out of it, what comes down from heaven and what mounts up to it. And He is with you wheresoever ye may be. And Allah sees well all that ye do.

ArabicText: لَّهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرۡجَعُ ٱلۡأُمُورُ ۝٥
Translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: and all affairs are referred back to Allah.

ArabicText: یُولِجُ ٱلَّیۡلَ فِی ٱلنَّهَارِ وَیُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِی ٱلَّیۡلِۚ وَهُوَ عَلِیمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ ۝٦
Translation: He merges Night into Day, and He merges Day into Night; and He has full knowledge of the secrets of (all) hearts.

ArabicText: ءَامِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَأَنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا جَعَلَكُم مُّسۡتَخۡلَفِینَ فِیهِۖ فَٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنكُمۡ وَأَنفَقُوا۟ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرࣱ كَبِیرࣱ ۝٧
Translation: Believe in Allah and His messenger, and spend (in charity) out of the (substance) whereof He has made you heirs. For, those of you who believe and spend (in charity),- for them is a great Reward.

ArabicText: وَمَا لَكُمۡ لَا تُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلرَّسُولُ یَدۡعُوكُمۡ لِتُؤۡمِنُوا۟ بِرَبِّكُمۡ وَقَدۡ أَخَذَ مِیثَـٰقَكُمۡ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِینَ ۝٨
Translation: What cause have ye why ye should not believe in Allah?- and the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and has indeed taken your Covenant, if ye are men of Faith.

ArabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِی یُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦۤ ءَایَـٰتِۭ بَیِّنَـٰتࣲ لِّیُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنَ ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُمۡ لَرَءُوفࣱ رَّحِیمࣱ ۝٩
Translation: He is the One Who sends to His Servant Manifest Signs, that He may lead you from the depths of Darkness into the Light and verily Allah is to you most kind and Merciful.

ArabicText: وَمَا لَكُمۡ أَلَّا تُنفِقُوا۟ فِی سَبِیلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِیرَ ٰ⁠ثُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ لَا یَسۡتَوِی مِنكُم مَّنۡ أَنفَقَ مِن قَبۡلِ ٱلۡفَتۡحِ وَقَـٰتَلَۚ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ أَعۡظَمُ دَرَجَةࣰ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِینَ أَنفَقُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعۡدُ وَقَـٰتَلُوا۟ۚ وَكُلࣰّا وَعَدَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِیرࣱ ۝١٠
Translation: And what cause have ye why ye should not spend in the cause of Allah?- For to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (freely) and fought, before the Victory, (with those who did so later). Those are higher in rank than those who spent (freely) and fought afterwards. But to all has Allah promised a goodly (reward). And Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.

ArabicText: مَّن ذَا ٱلَّذِی یُقۡرِضُ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنࣰا فَیُضَـٰعِفَهُۥ لَهُۥ وَلَهُۥۤ أَجۡرࣱ كَرِیمࣱ ۝١١
Translation: Who is he that will Loan to Allah a beautiful loan? for (Allah) will increase it manifold to his credit, and he will have (besides) a liberal Reward.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ تَرَى ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَـٰتِ یَسۡعَىٰ نُورُهُم بَیۡنَ أَیۡدِیهِمۡ وَبِأَیۡمَـٰنِهِمۖ بُشۡرَىٰكُمُ ٱلۡیَوۡمَ جَنَّـٰتࣱ تَجۡرِی مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِینَ فِیهَاۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِیمُ ۝١٢
Translation: One Day shalt thou see the believing men and the believing women- how their Light runs forward before them and by their right hands: (their greeting will be): "Good News for you this Day! Gardens beneath which flow rivers! to dwell therein for aye! This is indeed the highest Achievement!"

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَقُولُ ٱلۡمُنَـٰفِقُونَ وَٱلۡمُنَـٰفِقَـٰتُ لِلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱنظُرُونَا نَقۡتَبِسۡ مِن نُّورِكُمۡ قِیلَ ٱرۡجِعُوا۟ وَرَاۤءَكُمۡ فَٱلۡتَمِسُوا۟ نُورࣰاۖ فَضُرِبَ بَیۡنَهُم بِسُورࣲ لَّهُۥ بَابُۢ بَاطِنُهُۥ فِیهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَةُ وَظَـٰهِرُهُۥ مِن قِبَلِهِ ٱلۡعَذَابُ ۝١٣
