Translation: And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.

ArabicText: فَلَمَّا رَأَوۡهَا قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّا لَضَاۤلُّونَ ۝٢٦
Translation: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:

ArabicText: بَلۡ نَحۡنُ مَحۡرُومُونَ ۝٢٧
Translation: "Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"

ArabicText: قَالَ أَوۡسَطُهُمۡ أَلَمۡ أَقُل لَّكُمۡ لَوۡلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ ۝٢٨
Translation: Said one of them, more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you, ´Why not glorify (Allah)?´"

ArabicText: قَالُوا۟ سُبۡحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَاۤ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِینَ ۝٢٩
Translation: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"

ArabicText: فَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضࣲ یَتَلَـٰوَمُونَ ۝٣٠
Translation: Then they turned, one against another, in reproach.

ArabicText: قَالُوا۟ یَـٰوَیۡلَنَاۤ إِنَّا كُنَّا طَـٰغِینَ ۝٣١
Translation: They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!

ArabicText: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَاۤ أَن یُبۡدِلَنَا خَیۡرࣰا مِّنۡهَاۤ إِنَّاۤ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَ ٰ⁠غِبُونَ ۝٣٢
Translation: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"

ArabicText: كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡعَذَابُۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكۡبَرُۚ لَوۡ كَانُوا۟ یَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٣٣
Translation: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!

ArabicText: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِینَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِیمِ ۝٣٤
Translation: Verily, for the Righteous, are Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord.

ArabicText: أَفَنَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِینَ كَٱلۡمُجۡرِمِینَ ۝٣٥
Translation: Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?

ArabicText: مَا لَكُمۡ كَیۡفَ تَحۡكُمُونَ ۝٣٦
Translation: What is the matter with you? How judge ye?

ArabicText: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ كِتَـٰبࣱ فِیهِ تَدۡرُسُونَ ۝٣٧
Translation: Or have ye a book through which ye learn-

ArabicText: إِنَّ لَكُمۡ فِیهِ لَمَا تَخَیَّرُونَ ۝٣٨
Translation: That ye shall have, through it whatever ye choose?

ArabicText: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ أَیۡمَـٰنٌ عَلَیۡنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ یَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِیَـٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمۡ لَمَا تَحۡكُمُونَ ۝٣٩
Translation: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?

ArabicText: سَلۡهُمۡ أَیُّهُم بِذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ زَعِیمٌ ۝٤٠
Translation: Ask thou of them, which of them will stand surety for that!

ArabicText: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ شُرَكَاۤءُ فَلۡیَأۡتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَاۤىِٕهِمۡ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِینَ ۝٤١
Translation: Or have they some "Partners" (in Allahhead)? Then let them produce their "partners", if they are truthful!

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یُكۡشَفُ عَن سَاقࣲ وَیُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا یَسۡتَطِیعُونَ ۝٤٢
Translation: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-

ArabicText: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَـٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةࣱۖ وَقَدۡ كَانُوا۟ یُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمۡ سَـٰلِمُونَ ۝٤٣
Translation: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).

ArabicText: فَذَرۡنِی وَمَن یُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِیثِۖ سَنَسۡتَدۡرِجُهُم مِّنۡ حَیۡثُ لَا یَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٤٤
Translation: Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.

ArabicText: وَأُمۡلِی لَهُمۡۚ إِنَّ كَیۡدِی مَتِینٌ ۝٤٥
Translation: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.

ArabicText: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرࣰا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمࣲ مُّثۡقَلُونَ ۝٤٦
Translation: Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-

ArabicText: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَیۡبُ فَهُمۡ یَكۡتُبُونَ ۝٤٧
Translation: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down?

ArabicText: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلۡحُوتِ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكۡظُومࣱ ۝٤٨
Translation: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.

ArabicText: لَّوۡلَاۤ أَن تَدَ ٰ⁠رَكَهُۥ نِعۡمَةࣱ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلۡعَرَاۤءِ وَهُوَ مَذۡمُومࣱ ۝٤٩
Translation: Had not Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore, in disgrace.

ArabicText: فَٱجۡتَبَـٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَجَعَلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِینَ ۝٥٠
Translation: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.

ArabicText: وَإِن یَكَادُ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَیُزۡلِقُونَكَ بِأَبۡصَـٰرِهِمۡ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَیَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجۡنُونࣱ ۝٥١
Translation: And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"

ArabicText: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرࣱ لِّلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ ۝٥٢
Translation: But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.

ArabicText: ٱلۡحَاۤقَّةُ ۝١
Translation: The Sure Reality!

ArabicText: مَا ٱلۡحَاۤقَّةُ ۝٢
Translation: What is the Sure Reality?

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡحَاۤقَّةُ ۝٣
Translation: And what will make thee realise what the Sure Reality is?

ArabicText: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ وَعَادُۢ بِٱلۡقَارِعَةِ ۝٤
Translation: The Thamud and the ´Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهۡلِكُوا۟ بِٱلطَّاغِیَةِ ۝٥
Translation: But the Thamud,- they were destroyed by a terrible Storm of thunder and lightning!

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا عَادࣱ فَأُهۡلِكُوا۟ بِرِیحࣲ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِیَةࣲ ۝٦
Translation: And the ´Ad, they were destroyed by a furious Wind, exceedingly violent;

ArabicText: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَیۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَیَالࣲ وَثَمَـٰنِیَةَ أَیَّامٍ حُسُومࣰاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِیهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِیَةࣲ ۝٧
Translation: He made it rage against them seven nights and eight days in succession: so that thou couldst see the (whole) people lying prostrate in its (path), as they had been roots of hollow palm-trees tumbled down!

ArabicText: فَهَلۡ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِیَةࣲ ۝٨
Translation: Then seest thou any of them left surviving?

ArabicText: وَجَاۤءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ ۝٩
Translation: And Pharaoh, and those before him, and the Cities Overthrown, committed habitual Sin.

ArabicText: فَعَصَوۡا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةࣰ رَّابِیَةً ۝١٠
Translation: And disobeyed (each) the messenger of their Lord; so He punished them with an abundant Penalty.

ArabicText: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَاۤءُ حَمَلۡنَـٰكُمۡ فِی ٱلۡجَارِیَةِ ۝١١
Translation: We, when the water (of Noah´s Flood) overflowed beyond its limits, carried you (mankind), in the floating (Ark),

ArabicText: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةࣰ وَتَعِیَهَاۤ أُذُنࣱ وَ ٰ⁠عِیَةࣱ ۝١٢
Translation: That We might make it a Message unto you, and that ears (that should hear the tale and) retain its memory should bear its (lessons) in remembrance.

ArabicText: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِی ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةࣱ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣱ ۝١٣
Translation: Then, when one blast is sounded on the Trumpet,

ArabicText: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةࣰ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣰ ۝١٤
Translation: And the earth is moved, and its mountains, and they are crushed to powder at one stroke,-

ArabicText: فَیَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ ۝١٥
Translation: On that Day shall the (Great) Event come to pass.

ArabicText: وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فَهِیَ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ وَاهِیَةࣱ ۝١٦
Translation: And the sky will be rent asunder, for it will that Day be flimsy,

ArabicText: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰۤ أَرۡجَاۤىِٕهَاۚ وَیَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ ثَمَـٰنِیَةࣱ ۝١٧
Translation: And the angels will be on its sides, and eight will, that Day, bear the Throne of thy Lord above them.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِیَةࣱ ۝١٨
Translation: That Day shall ye be brought to Judgment: not an act of yours that ye hide will be hidden.

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِیَمِینِهِۦ فَیَقُولُ هَاۤؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِیَهۡ ۝١٩
Translation: Then he that will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Ah here! Read ye my Record!

ArabicText: إِنِّی ظَنَنتُ أَنِّی مُلَـٰقٍ حِسَابِیَهۡ ۝٢٠
Translation: "I did really understand that my Account would (One Day) reach me!"

ArabicText: فَهُوَ فِی عِیشَةࣲ رَّاضِیَةࣲ ۝٢١
Translation: And he will be in a life of Bliss,

ArabicText: فِی جَنَّةٍ عَالِیَةࣲ ۝٢٢
Translation: In a Garden on high,

ArabicText: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِیَةࣱ ۝٢٣
Translation: The Fruits whereof (will hang in bunches) low and near.

ArabicText: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشۡرَبُوا۟ هَنِیۤـَٔۢا بِمَاۤ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِی ٱلۡأَیَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِیَةِ ۝٢٤
Translation: "Eat ye and drink ye, with full satisfaction; because of the (good) that ye sent before you, in the days that are gone!"

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَیَقُولُ یَـٰلَیۡتَنِی لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِیَهۡ ۝٢٥
Translation: And he that will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "Ah! Would that my Record had not been given to me!

ArabicText: وَلَمۡ أَدۡرِ مَا حِسَابِیَهۡ ۝٢٦
Translation: "And that I had never realised how my account (stood)!

ArabicText: یَـٰلَیۡتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلۡقَاضِیَةَ ۝٢٧
Translation: "Ah! Would that (Death) had made an end of me!

ArabicText: مَاۤ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنِّی مَالِیَهۡۜ ۝٢٨
Translation: "Of no profit to me has been my wealth!

ArabicText: هَلَكَ عَنِّی سُلۡطَـٰنِیَهۡ ۝٢٩
Translation: "My power has perished from me!"...

ArabicText: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ ۝٣٠
Translation: (The stern command will say): "Seize ye him, and bind ye him,

ArabicText: ثُمَّ ٱلۡجَحِیمَ صَلُّوهُ ۝٣١
Translation: "And burn ye him in the Blazing Fire.

ArabicText: ثُمَّ فِی سِلۡسِلَةࣲ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعࣰا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ ۝٣٢
Translation: "Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا یُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ ۝٣٣
Translation: "This was he that would not believe in Allah Most High.

ArabicText: وَلَا یَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِینِ ۝٣٤
Translation: "And would not encourage the feeding of the indigent!

ArabicText: فَلَیۡسَ لَهُ ٱلۡیَوۡمَ هَـٰهُنَا حَمِیمࣱ ۝٣٥
Translation: "So no friend hath he here this Day.

ArabicText: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنۡ غِسۡلِینࣲ ۝٣٦
Translation: "Nor hath he any food except the corruption from the washing of wounds,

ArabicText: لَّا یَأۡكُلُهُۥۤ إِلَّا ٱلۡخَـٰطِـُٔونَ ۝٣٧
Translation: "Which none do eat but those in sin."

ArabicText: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِمَا تُبۡصِرُونَ ۝٣٨
Translation: So I do call to witness what ye see,

ArabicText: وَمَا لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ ۝٣٩
Translation: And what ye see not,

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولࣲ كَرِیمࣲ ۝٤٠
Translation: That this is verily the word of an honoured messenger;

ArabicText: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرࣲۚ قَلِیلࣰا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ ۝٤١
Translation: It is not the word of a poet: little it is ye believe!

ArabicText: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنࣲۚ قَلِیلࣰا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ ۝٤٢
Translation: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer: little admonition it is ye receive.

ArabicText: تَنزِیلࣱ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ ۝٤٣
Translation: (This is) a Message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds.

ArabicText: وَلَوۡ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَیۡنَا بَعۡضَ ٱلۡأَقَاوِیلِ ۝٤٤
Translation: And if the messenger were to invent any sayings in Our name,

ArabicText: لَأَخَذۡنَا مِنۡهُ بِٱلۡیَمِینِ ۝٤٥
Translation: We should certainly seize him by his right hand,

ArabicText: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعۡنَا مِنۡهُ ٱلۡوَتِینَ ۝٤٦
Translation: And We should certainly then cut off the artery of his heart:

ArabicText: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَـٰجِزِینَ ۝٤٧
Translation: Nor could any of you withhold him (from Our wrath).

ArabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذۡكِرَةࣱ لِّلۡمُتَّقِینَ ۝٤٨
Translation: But verily this is a Message for the Allah-fearing.

ArabicText: وَإِنَّا لَنَعۡلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِینَ ۝٤٩
Translation: And We certainly know that there are amongst you those that reject (it).

ArabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسۡرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ ۝٥٠
Translation: But truly (Revelation) is a cause of sorrow for the Unbelievers.

ArabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلۡیَقِینِ ۝٥١
Translation: But verily it is Truth of assured certainty.

ArabicText: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ ۝٥٢
Translation: So glorify the name of thy Lord Most High.

ArabicText: سَأَلَ سَاۤىِٕلُۢ بِعَذَابࣲ وَاقِعࣲ ۝١
Translation: A questioner asked about a Penalty to befall-

ArabicText: لِّلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ لَیۡسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعࣱ ۝٢
Translation: The Unbelievers, the which there is none to ward off,-

ArabicText: مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِی ٱلۡمَعَارِجِ ۝٣
Translation: (A Penalty) from Allah, Lord of the Ways of Ascent.

ArabicText: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَیۡهِ فِی یَوۡمࣲ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِینَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةࣲ ۝٤
Translation: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

ArabicText: فَٱصۡبِرۡ صَبۡرࣰا جَمِیلًا ۝٥
Translation: Therefore do thou hold Patience,- a Patience of beautiful (contentment).

ArabicText: إِنَّهُمۡ یَرَوۡنَهُۥ بَعِیدࣰا ۝٦
Translation: They see the (Day) indeed as a far-off (event):

ArabicText: وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِیبࣰا ۝٧
Translation: But We see it (quite) near.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ كَٱلۡمُهۡلِ ۝٨
Translation: The Day that the sky will be like molten brass,

ArabicText: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ ۝٩
Translation: And the mountains will be like wool,

ArabicText: وَلَا یَسۡـَٔلُ حَمِیمٌ حَمِیمࣰا ۝١٠
Translation: And no friend will ask after a friend,

ArabicText: یُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ یَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ یَفۡتَدِی مِنۡ عَذَابِ یَوۡمِىِٕذِۭ بِبَنِیهِ ۝١١
Translation: Though they will be put in sight of each other,- the sinner´s desire will be: Would that he could redeem himself from the Penalty of that Day by (sacrificing) his children,

ArabicText: وَصَـٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَأَخِیهِ ۝١٢
Translation: His wife and his brother,

ArabicText: وَفَصِیلَتِهِ ٱلَّتِی تُـٔۡوِیهِ ۝١٣
Translation: His kindred who sheltered him,

ArabicText: وَمَن فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِیعࣰا ثُمَّ یُنجِیهِ ۝١٤
Translation: And all, all that is on earth,- so it could deliver him:

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ ۝١٥
Translation: By no means! for it would be the Fire of Hell!-

ArabicText: نَزَّاعَةࣰ لِّلشَّوَىٰ ۝١٦
Translation: Plucking out (his being) right to the skull!-

ArabicText: تَدۡعُوا۟ مَنۡ أَدۡبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ ۝١٧
Translation: Inviting (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from the Right).

ArabicText: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوۡعَىٰۤ ۝١٨
Translation: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from use)!

ArabicText: ۞ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا ۝١٩
Translation: Truly man was created very impatient;-

ArabicText: إِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلشَّرُّ جَزُوعࣰا ۝٢٠
Translation: Fretful when evil touches him;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلۡخَیۡرُ مَنُوعًا ۝٢١
Translation: And niggardly when good reaches him;-

ArabicText: إِلَّا ٱلۡمُصَلِّینَ ۝٢٢
Translation: Not so those devoted to Prayer;-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمۡ دَاۤىِٕمُونَ ۝٢٣
Translation: Those who remain steadfast to their prayer;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ فِیۤ أَمۡوَ ٰ⁠لِهِمۡ حَقࣱّ مَّعۡلُومࣱ ۝٢٤
Translation: And those in whose wealth is a recognised right.

ArabicText: لِّلسَّاۤىِٕلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ ۝٢٥
Translation: For the (needy) who asks and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking);

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ یُصَدِّقُونَ بِیَوۡمِ ٱلدِّینِ ۝٢٦
Translation: And those who hold to the truth of the Day of Judgment;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ ۝٢٧
Translation: And those who fear the displeasure of their Lord,-

ArabicText: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمۡ غَیۡرُ مَأۡمُونࣲ ۝٢٨
Translation: For their Lord´s displeasure is the opposite of Peace and Tranquillity;-

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ لِفُرُوجِهِمۡ حَـٰفِظُونَ ۝٢٩
Translation: And those who guard their chastity,

ArabicText: إِلَّا عَلَىٰۤ أَزۡوَ ٰ⁠جِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَیۡمَـٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَیۡرُ مَلُومِینَ ۝٣٠
Translation: Except with their wives and the (captives) whom their right hands possess,- for (then) they are not to be blamed,

ArabicText: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَاۤءَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ ۝٣١
Translation: But those who trespass beyond this are transgressors;-

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ لِأَمَـٰنَـٰتِهِمۡ وَعَهۡدِهِمۡ رَ ٰ⁠عُونَ ۝٣٢
Translation: And those who respect their trusts and covenants;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ هُم بِشَهَـٰدَ ٰ⁠تِهِمۡ قَاۤىِٕمُونَ ۝٣٣
Translation: And those who stand firm in their testimonies;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمۡ یُحَافِظُونَ ۝٣٤
Translation: And those who guard (the sacredness) of their worship;-

ArabicText: أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ فِی جَنَّـٰتࣲ مُّكۡرَمُونَ ۝٣٥
Translation: Such will be the honoured ones in the Gardens (of Bliss).

ArabicText: فَمَالِ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ قِبَلَكَ مُهۡطِعِینَ ۝٣٦
Translation: Now what is the matter with the Unbelievers that they rush madly before thee-

ArabicText: عَنِ ٱلۡیَمِینِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ عِزِینَ ۝٣٧
Translation: From the right and from the left, in crowds?

ArabicText: أَیَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِئࣲ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن یُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِیمࣲ ۝٣٨
Translation: Does every man of them long to enter the Garden of Bliss?

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤۖ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَـٰهُم مِّمَّا یَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٣٩
Translation: By no means! For We have created them out of the (base matter) they know!

ArabicText: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَـٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَـٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَـٰدِرُونَ ۝٤٠
Translation: Now I do call to witness the Lord of all points in the East and the West that We can certainly-

ArabicText: عَلَىٰۤ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَیۡرࣰا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِینَ ۝٤١
Translation: Substitute for them better (men) than they; And We are not to be defeated (in Our Plan).

ArabicText: فَذَرۡهُمۡ یَخُوضُوا۟ وَیَلۡعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ یُلَـٰقُوا۟ یَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِی یُوعَدُونَ ۝٤٢
Translation: So leave them to plunge in vain talk and play about, until they encounter that Day of theirs which they have been promised!-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعࣰا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبࣲ یُوفِضُونَ ۝٤٣
Translation: The Day whereon they will issue from their sepulchres in sudden haste as if they were rushing to a goal-post (fixed for them),-

ArabicText: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَـٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةࣱۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِی كَانُوا۟ یُوعَدُونَ ۝٤٤
Translation: Their eyes lowered in dejection,- ignominy covering them (all over)! such is the Day the which they are promised!

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦۤ أَنۡ أَنذِرۡ قَوۡمَكَ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن یَأۡتِیَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِیمࣱ ۝١
Translation: We sent Noah to his People (with the Command): "Do thou warn thy People before there comes to them a grievous Penalty."

ArabicText: قَالَ یَـٰقَوۡمِ إِنِّی لَكُمۡ نَذِیرࣱ مُّبِینٌ ۝٢
Translation: He said: "O my People! I am to you a Warner, clear and open:

ArabicText: أَنِ ٱعۡبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِیعُونِ ۝٣
Translation: "That ye should worship Allah, fear Him and obey me:

ArabicText: یَغۡفِرۡ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمۡ وَیُؤَخِّرۡكُمۡ إِلَىٰۤ أَجَلࣲ مُّسَمًّىۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَاۤءَ لَا یُؤَخَّرُۚ لَوۡ كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٤
Translation: "So He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a stated Term: for when the Term given by Allah is accomplished, it cannot be put forward: if ye only knew."

ArabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّی دَعَوۡتُ قَوۡمِی لَیۡلࣰا وَنَهَارࣰا ۝٥
Translation: He said: "O my Lord! I have called to my People night and day:

ArabicText: فَلَمۡ یَزِدۡهُمۡ دُعَاۤءِیۤ إِلَّا فِرَارࣰا ۝٦
Translation: "But my call only increases (their) flight (from the Right).

ArabicText: وَإِنِّی كُلَّمَا دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ لِتَغۡفِرَ لَهُمۡ جَعَلُوۤا۟ أَصَـٰبِعَهُمۡ فِیۤ ءَاذَانِهِمۡ وَٱسۡتَغۡشَوۡا۟ ثِیَابَهُمۡ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُوا۟ ٱسۡتِكۡبَارࣰا ۝٧
Translation: "And every time I have called to them, that Thou mightest forgive them, they have (only) thrust their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, grown obstinate, and given themselves up to arrogance.

ArabicText: ثُمَّ إِنِّی دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ جِهَارࣰا ۝٨
Translation: "So I have called to them aloud;

ArabicText: ثُمَّ إِنِّیۤ أَعۡلَنتُ لَهُمۡ وَأَسۡرَرۡتُ لَهُمۡ إِسۡرَارࣰا ۝٩
Translation: "Further I have spoken to them in public and secretly in private,

ArabicText: فَقُلۡتُ ٱسۡتَغۡفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمۡ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارࣰا ۝١٠
Translation: "Saying, ´Ask forgiveness from your Lord; for He is Oft-Forgiving;

ArabicText: یُرۡسِلِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءَ عَلَیۡكُم مِّدۡرَارࣰا ۝١١
Translation: "´He will send rain to you in abundance;

ArabicText: وَیُمۡدِدۡكُم بِأَمۡوَ ٰ⁠لࣲ وَبَنِینَ وَیَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ جَنَّـٰتࣲ وَیَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ أَنۡهَـٰرࣰا ۝١٢
Translation: "´Give you increase in wealth and sons; and bestow on you gardens and bestow on you rivers (of flowing water).

ArabicText: مَّا لَكُمۡ لَا تَرۡجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارࣰا ۝١٣
Translation: "´What is the matter with you, that ye place not your hope for kindness and long-suffering in Allah,-

ArabicText: وَقَدۡ خَلَقَكُمۡ أَطۡوَارًا ۝١٤
Translation: "´Seeing that it is He that has created you in diverse stages?

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ تَرَوۡا۟ كَیۡفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبۡعَ سَمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تࣲ طِبَاقࣰا ۝١٥
Translation: "´See ye not how Allah has created the seven heavens one above another,

ArabicText: وَجَعَلَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ فِیهِنَّ نُورࣰا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ سِرَاجࣰا ۝١٦
Translation: "´And made the moon a light in their midst, and made the sun as a (Glorious) Lamp?

ArabicText: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ نَبَاتࣰا ۝١٧
Translation: "´And Allah has produced you from the earth growing (gradually),

ArabicText: ثُمَّ یُعِیدُكُمۡ فِیهَا وَیُخۡرِجُكُمۡ إِخۡرَاجࣰا ۝١٨
Translation: "´And in the End He will return you into the (earth), and raise you forth (again at the Resurrection)?

ArabicText: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِسَاطࣰا ۝١٩
Translation: "´And Allah has made the earth for you as a carpet (spread out),

ArabicText: لِّتَسۡلُكُوا۟ مِنۡهَا سُبُلࣰا فِجَاجࣰا ۝٢٠
Translation: "´That ye may go about therein, in spacious roads.´"

ArabicText: قَالَ نُوحࣱ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمۡ عَصَوۡنِی وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمۡ یَزِدۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥۤ إِلَّا خَسَارࣰا ۝٢١
Translation: Noah said: "O my Lord! They have disobeyed me, but they follow (men) whose wealth and children give them no increase but only Loss.

ArabicText: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكۡرࣰا كُبَّارࣰا ۝٢٢
Translation: "And they have devised a tremendous Plot.

ArabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدࣰّا وَلَا سُوَاعࣰا وَلَا یَغُوثَ وَیَعُوقَ وَنَسۡرࣰا ۝٢٣
Translation: "And they have said (to each other), ´Abandon not your gods: Abandon neither Wadd nor Suwa´, neither Yaguth nor Ya´uq, nor Nasr´;-

ArabicText: وَقَدۡ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِیرࣰاۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِینَ إِلَّا ضَلَـٰلࣰا ۝٢٤
Translation: "They have already misled many; and grant Thou no increase to the wrong-doers but in straying (from their mark)."

ArabicText: مِّمَّا خَطِیۤـَٔـٰتِهِمۡ أُغۡرِقُوا۟ فَأُدۡخِلُوا۟ نَارࣰا فَلَمۡ یَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارࣰا ۝٢٥
Translation: Because of their sins they were drowned (in the flood), and were made to enter the Fire (of Punishment): and they found- in lieu of Allah- none to help them.

ArabicText: وَقَالَ نُوحࣱ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرۡ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِنَ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ دَیَّارًا ۝٢٦
Translation: And Noah, said: "O my Lord! Leave not of the Unbelievers, a single one on earth!

ArabicText: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرۡهُمۡ یُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا یَلِدُوۤا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرࣰا كَفَّارࣰا ۝٢٧
Translation: "For, if Thou dost leave (any of) them, they will but mislead Thy devotees, and they will breed none but wicked ungrateful ones.

ArabicText: رَّبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِی وَلِوَ ٰ⁠لِدَیَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَیۡتِیَ مُؤۡمِنࣰا وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَـٰتِۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِینَ إِلَّا تَبَارَۢا ۝٢٨
Translation: "O my Lord! Forgive me, my parents, all who enter my house in Faith, and (all) believing men and believing women: and to the wrong-doers grant Thou no increase but in perdition!"

ArabicText: قُلۡ أُوحِیَ إِلَیَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسۡتَمَعَ نَفَرࣱ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَقَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّا سَمِعۡنَا قُرۡءَانًا عَجَبࣰا ۝١
Translation: Say: It has been revealed to me that a company of Jinns listened (to the Qur´an). They said, ´We have really heard a wonderful Recital!

ArabicText: یَهۡدِیۤ إِلَى ٱلرُّشۡدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِرَبِّنَاۤ أَحَدࣰا ۝٢
Translation: ´It gives guidance to the Right, and we have believed therein: we shall not join (in worship) any (gods) with our Lord.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَـٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَـٰحِبَةࣰ وَلَا وَلَدࣰا ۝٣
Translation: ´And Exalted is the Majesty of our Lord: He has taken neither a wife nor a son.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ یَقُولُ سَفِیهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطࣰا ۝٤
Translation: ´There were some foolish ones among us, who used to utter extravagant lies against Allah;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّاۤ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلۡإِنسُ وَٱلۡجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبࣰا ۝٥
Translation: ´But we do think that no man or spirit should say aught that untrue against Allah.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالࣱ مِّنَ ٱلۡإِنسِ یَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالࣲ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمۡ رَهَقࣰا ۝٦
Translation: ´True, there were persons among mankind who took shelter with persons among the Jinns, but they increased them in folly.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُمۡ ظَنُّوا۟ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن لَّن یَبۡعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدࣰا ۝٧
Translation: ´And they (came to) think as ye thought, that Allah would not raise up any one (to Judgment).

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا لَمَسۡنَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءَ فَوَجَدۡنَـٰهَا مُلِئَتۡ حَرَسࣰا شَدِیدࣰا وَشُهُبࣰا ۝٨
Translation: ´And we pried into the secrets of heaven; but we found it filled with stern guards and flaming fires.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقۡعُدُ مِنۡهَا مَقَـٰعِدَ لِلسَّمۡعِۖ فَمَن یَسۡتَمِعِ ٱلۡـَٔانَ یَجِدۡ لَهُۥ شِهَابࣰا رَّصَدࣰا ۝٩
Translation: ´We used, indeed, to sit there in (hidden) stations, to (steal) a hearing; but any who listen now will find a flaming fire watching him in ambush.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدۡرِیۤ أَشَرٌّ أُرِیدَ بِمَن فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ أَرَادَ بِهِمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ رَشَدࣰا ۝١٠
Translation: ´And we understand not whether ill is intended to those on earth, or whether their Lord (really) intends to guide them to right conduct.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّـٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَاۤىِٕقَ قِدَدࣰا ۝١١
Translation: ´There are among us some that are righteous, and some the contrary: we follow divergent paths.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّاۤ أَن لَّن نُّعۡجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَن نُّعۡجِزَهُۥ هَرَبࣰا ۝١٢
Translation: ´But we think that we can by no means frustrate Allah throughout the earth, nor can we frustrate Him by flight.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعۡنَا ٱلۡهُدَىٰۤ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن یُؤۡمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا یَخَافُ بَخۡسࣰا وَلَا رَهَقࣰا ۝١٣
Translation: ´And as for us, since we have listened to the Guidance, we have accepted it: and any who believes in his Lord has no fear, either of a short (account) or of any injustice.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلۡمُسۡلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلۡقَـٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ فَأُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ تَحَرَّوۡا۟ رَشَدࣰا ۝١٤
Translation: ´Amongst us are some that submit their wills (to Allah), and some that swerve from justice. Now those who submit their wills - they have sought out (the path) of right conduct:

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا ٱلۡقَـٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا۟ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبࣰا ۝١٥
Translation: ´But those who swerve,- they are (but) fuel for Hell-fire´-

ArabicText: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسۡتَقَـٰمُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِیقَةِ لَأَسۡقَیۡنَـٰهُم مَّاۤءً غَدَقࣰا ۝١٦
Translation: (And Allah´s Message is): "If they (the Pagans) had (only) remained on the (right) Way, We should certainly have bestowed on them Rain in abundance.

ArabicText: لِّنَفۡتِنَهُمۡ فِیهِۚ وَمَن یُعۡرِضۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِۦ یَسۡلُكۡهُ عَذَابࣰا صَعَدࣰا ۝١٧
Translation: "That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.

ArabicText: وَأَنَّ ٱلۡمَسَـٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدۡعُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدࣰا ۝١٨
Translation: "And the places of worship are for Allah (alone): So invoke not any one along with Allah;

ArabicText: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ یَدۡعُوهُ كَادُوا۟ یَكُونُونَ عَلَیۡهِ لِبَدࣰا ۝١٩
Translation: "Yet when the Devotee of Allah stands forth to invoke Him, they just make round him a dense crowd."

ArabicText: قُلۡ إِنَّمَاۤ أَدۡعُوا۟ رَبِّی وَلَاۤ أُشۡرِكُ بِهِۦۤ أَحَدࣰا ۝٢٠
Translation: Say: "I do no more than invoke my Lord, and I join not with Him any (false god)."

ArabicText: قُلۡ إِنِّی لَاۤ أَمۡلِكُ لَكُمۡ ضَرࣰّا وَلَا رَشَدࣰا ۝٢١
Translation: Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm, or to bring you to right conduct."

ArabicText: قُلۡ إِنِّی لَن یُجِیرَنِی مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدࣱ وَلَنۡ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلۡتَحَدًا ۝٢٢
Translation: Say: "No one can deliver me from Allah (If I were to disobey Him), nor should I find refuge except in Him,

ArabicText: إِلَّا بَلَـٰغࣰا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَـٰلَـٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن یَعۡصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِینَ فِیهَاۤ أَبَدًا ۝٢٣
Translation: "Unless I proclaim what I receive from Allah and His Messages: for any that disobey Allah and His Messenger,- for them is Hell: they shall dwell therein for ever."

ArabicText: حَتَّىٰۤ إِذَا رَأَوۡا۟ مَا یُوعَدُونَ فَسَیَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ أَضۡعَفُ نَاصِرࣰا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدࣰا ۝٢٤
Translation: At length, when they see (with their own eyes) that which they are promised,- then will they know who it is that is weakest in (his) helper and least important in point of numbers.

ArabicText: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِیۤ أَقَرِیبࣱ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ یَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّیۤ أَمَدًا ۝٢٥
Translation: Say: "I know not whether the (Punishment) which ye are promised is near, or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.

ArabicText: عَـٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَیۡبِ فَلَا یُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَیۡبِهِۦۤ أَحَدًا ۝٢٦
Translation: "He (alone) knows the Unseen, nor does He make any one acquainted with His Mysteries,-

ArabicText: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولࣲ فَإِنَّهُۥ یَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَیۡنِ یَدَیۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدࣰا ۝٢٧
Translation: "Except a messenger whom He has chosen: and then He makes a band of watchers march before him and behind him,

ArabicText: لِّیَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُوا۟ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَیۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَیۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا ۝٢٨
Translation: "That He may know that they have (truly) brought and delivered the Messages of their Lord: and He surrounds (all the mysteries) that are with them, and takes account of every single thing."

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡمُزَّمِّلُ ۝١
Translation: O thou folded in garments!

ArabicText: قُمِ ٱلَّیۡلَ إِلَّا قَلِیلࣰا ۝٢
Translation: Stand (to prayer) by night, but not all night,-

ArabicText: نِّصۡفَهُۥۤ أَوِ ٱنقُصۡ مِنۡهُ قَلِیلًا ۝٣
Translation: Half of it,- or a little less,

ArabicText: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَیۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِیلًا ۝٤
Translation: Or a little more; and recite the Qur´an in slow, measured rhythmic tones.

ArabicText: إِنَّا سَنُلۡقِی عَلَیۡكَ قَوۡلࣰا ثَقِیلًا ۝٥
Translation: Soon shall We send down to thee a weighty Message.

ArabicText: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّیۡلِ هِیَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـࣰٔا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِیلًا ۝٦
Translation: Truly the rising by night is most potent for governing (the soul), and most suitable for (framing) the Word (of Prayer and Praise).

ArabicText: إِنَّ لَكَ فِی ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحࣰا طَوِیلࣰا ۝٧
Translation: True, there is for thee by day prolonged occupation with ordinary duties:

ArabicText: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَیۡهِ تَبۡتِیلࣰا ۝٨
Translation: But keep in remembrance the name of thy Lord and devote thyself to Him whole-heartedly.

ArabicText: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَاۤ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِیلࣰا ۝٩
Translation: (He is) Lord of the East and the West: there is no god but He: take Him therefore for (thy) Disposer of Affairs.

ArabicText: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا یَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرࣰا جَمِیلࣰا ۝١٠
Translation: And have patience with what they say, and leave them with noble (dignity).

ArabicText: وَذَرۡنِی وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ أُو۟لِی ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِیلًا ۝١١
Translation: And leave Me (alone to deal with) those in possession of the good things of life, who (yet) deny the Truth; and bear with them for a little while.

ArabicText: إِنَّ لَدَیۡنَاۤ أَنكَالࣰا وَجَحِیمࣰا ۝١٢
Translation: With Us are Fetters (to bind them), and a Fire (to burn them),

ArabicText: وَطَعَامࣰا ذَا غُصَّةࣲ وَعَذَابًا أَلِیمࣰا ۝١٣
Translation: And a Food that chokes, and a Penalty Grievous.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِیبࣰا مَّهِیلًا ۝١٤
Translation: One Day the earth and the mountains will be in violent commotion. And the mountains will be as a heap of sand poured out and flowing down.

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَاۤ إِلَیۡكُمۡ رَسُولࣰا شَـٰهِدًا عَلَیۡكُمۡ كَمَاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَاۤ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولࣰا ۝١٥
Translation: We have sent to you, (O men!) a messenger, to be a witness concerning you, even as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh.

ArabicText: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَـٰهُ أَخۡذࣰا وَبِیلࣰا ۝١٦
Translation: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger; so We seized him with a heavy Punishment.

ArabicText: فَكَیۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ یَوۡمࣰا یَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَ ٰ⁠نَ شِیبًا ۝١٧
Translation: Then how shall ye, if ye deny (Allah), guard yourselves against a Day that will make children hoary-headed?-

ArabicText: ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا ۝١٨
Translation: Whereon the sky will be cleft asunder? His Promise needs must be accomplished.

ArabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةࣱۖ فَمَن شَاۤءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِیلًا ۝١٩
Translation: Verily this is an Admonition: therefore, whoso will, let him take a (straight) path to his Lord!

ArabicText: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ یَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَیِ ٱلَّیۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَاۤىِٕفَةࣱ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِینَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ یُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّیۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَیۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُوا۟ مَا تَیَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَیَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ یَضۡرِبُونَ فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ یَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ یُقَـٰتِلُونَ فِی سَبِیلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُوا۟ مَا تَیَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِیمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنࣰاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَیۡرࣲ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَیۡرࣰا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرࣰاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورࣱ رَّحِیمُۢ ۝٢٠
Translation: Thy Lord doth know that thou standest forth (to prayer) nigh two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or a third of the night, and so doth a party of those with thee. But Allah doth appoint night and day in due measure He knoweth that ye are unable to keep count thereof. So He hath turned to you (in mercy): read ye, therefore, of the Qur´an as much as may be easy for you. He knoweth that there may be (some) among you in ill-health; others travelling through the land, seeking of Allah´s bounty; yet others fighting in Allah´s Cause, read ye, therefore, as much of the Qur´an as may be easy (for you); and establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan. And whatever good ye send forth for your souls ye shall find it in Allah´s Presence,- yea, better and greater, in Reward and seek ye the Grace of Allah: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡمُدَّثِّرُ ۝١
Translation: O thou wrapped up (in the mantle)!

ArabicText: قُمۡ فَأَنذِرۡ ۝٢
Translation: Arise and deliver thy warning!

ArabicText: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرۡ ۝٣
Translation: And thy Lord do thou magnify!

ArabicText: وَثِیَابَكَ فَطَهِّرۡ ۝٤
Translation: And thy garments keep free from stain!

ArabicText: وَٱلرُّجۡزَ فَٱهۡجُرۡ ۝٥
Translation: And all abomination shun!

ArabicText: وَلَا تَمۡنُن تَسۡتَكۡثِرُ ۝٦
Translation: Nor expect, in giving, any increase (for thyself)!

ArabicText: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصۡبِرۡ ۝٧
Translation: But, for thy Lord´s (Cause), be patient and constant!

ArabicText: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِی ٱلنَّاقُورِ ۝٨
Translation: Finally, when the Trumpet is sounded,

ArabicText: فَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَوۡمٌ عَسِیرٌ ۝٩
Translation: That will be- that Day - a Day of Distress,-

ArabicText: عَلَى ٱلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ غَیۡرُ یَسِیرࣲ ۝١٠
Translation: Far from easy for those without Faith.

ArabicText: ذَرۡنِی وَمَنۡ خَلَقۡتُ وَحِیدࣰا ۝١١
Translation: Leave Me alone, (to deal) with the (creature) whom I created (bare and) alone!-

ArabicText: وَجَعَلۡتُ لَهُۥ مَالࣰا مَّمۡدُودࣰا ۝١٢
Translation: To whom I granted resources in abundance,

ArabicText: وَبَنِینَ شُهُودࣰا ۝١٣
Translation: And sons to be by his side!-

ArabicText: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمۡهِیدࣰا ۝١٤
Translation: To whom I made (life) smooth and comfortable!

ArabicText: ثُمَّ یَطۡمَعُ أَنۡ أَزِیدَ ۝١٥
Translation: Yet is he greedy-that I should add (yet more);-

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا عَنِیدࣰا ۝١٦
Translation: By no means! For to Our Signs he has been refractory!

ArabicText: سَأُرۡهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا ۝١٧
Translation: Soon will I visit him with a mount of calamities!

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ ۝١٨
Translation: For he thought and he plotted;-

ArabicText: فَقُتِلَ كَیۡفَ قَدَّرَ ۝١٩
Translation: And woe to him! How he plotted!-

ArabicText: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَیۡفَ قَدَّرَ ۝٢٠
Translation: Yea, Woe to him; How he plotted!-
Then he looked round;

ArabicText: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ ۝٢٢
Translation: Then he frowned and he scowled;

ArabicText: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ ۝٢٣
Translation: Then he turned back and was haughty;

ArabicText: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَـٰذَاۤ إِلَّا سِحۡرࣱ یُؤۡثَرُ ۝٢٤
Translation: Then said he: "This is nothing but magic, derived from of old;

ArabicText: إِنۡ هَـٰذَاۤ إِلَّا قَوۡلُ ٱلۡبَشَرِ ۝٢٥
Translation: "This is nothing but the word of a mortal!"

ArabicText: سَأُصۡلِیهِ سَقَرَ ۝٢٦
Translation: Soon will I cast him into Hell-Fire!

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ ۝٢٧
Translation: And what will explain to thee what Hell-Fire is?

ArabicText: لَا تُبۡقِی وَلَا تَذَرُ ۝٢٨
Translation: Naught doth it permit to endure, and naught doth it leave alone!-

ArabicText: لَوَّاحَةࣱ لِّلۡبَشَرِ ۝٢٩
Translation: Darkening and changing the colour of man!

ArabicText: عَلَیۡهَا تِسۡعَةَ عَشَرَ ۝٣٠
Translation: Over it are Nineteen.

ArabicText: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةࣰۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةࣰ لِّلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِیَسۡتَیۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلۡكِتَـٰبَ وَیَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوۤا۟ إِیمَـٰنࣰا وَلَا یَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِینَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلۡكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِیَقُولَ ٱلَّذِینَ فِی قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضࣱ وَٱلۡكَـٰفِرُونَ مَاذَاۤ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَـٰذَا مَثَلࣰاۚ كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ یُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن یَشَاۤءُ وَیَهۡدِی مَن یَشَاۤءُۚ وَمَا یَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِیَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ ۝٣١
Translation: And We have set none but angels as Guardians of the Fire; and We have fixed their number only as a trial for Unbelievers,- in order that the People of the Book may arrive at certainty, and the Believers may increase in Faith,- and that no doubts may be left for the People of the Book and the Believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the Unbelievers may say, "What symbol doth Allah intend by this?" Thus doth Allah leave to stray whom He pleaseth, and guide whom He pleaseth: and none can know the forces of thy Lord, except He and this is no other than a warning to mankind.

ArabicText: كَلَّا وَٱلۡقَمَرِ ۝٣٢
Translation: Nay, verily: By the Moon,

ArabicText: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذۡ أَدۡبَرَ ۝٣٣
Translation: And by the Night as it retreateth,

ArabicText: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَاۤ أَسۡفَرَ ۝٣٤
Translation: And by the Dawn as it shineth forth,-

ArabicText: إِنَّهَا لَإِحۡدَى ٱلۡكُبَرِ ۝٣٥
Translation: This is but one of the mighty (portents),

ArabicText: نَذِیرࣰا لِّلۡبَشَرِ ۝٣٦
Translation: A warning to mankind,-

ArabicText: لِمَن شَاۤءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن یَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ یَتَأَخَّرَ ۝٣٧
Translation: To any of you that chooses to press forward, or to follow behind;-

ArabicText: كُلُّ نَفۡسِۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتۡ رَهِینَةٌ ۝٣٨
Translation: Every soul will be (held) in pledge for its deeds.

ArabicText: إِلَّاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبَ ٱلۡیَمِینِ ۝٣٩
Translation: Except the Companions of the Right Hand.

ArabicText: فِی جَنَّـٰتࣲ یَتَسَاۤءَلُونَ ۝٤٠
Translation: (They will be) in Gardens (of Delight): they will question each other,

ArabicText: عَنِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِینَ ۝٤١
Translation: And (ask) of the Sinners:

ArabicText: مَا سَلَكَكُمۡ فِی سَقَرَ ۝٤٢
Translation: "What led you into Hell Fire?"

ArabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَمۡ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُصَلِّینَ ۝٤٣
Translation: They will say: "We were not of those who prayed;

ArabicText: وَلَمۡ نَكُ نُطۡعِمُ ٱلۡمِسۡكِینَ ۝٤٤
Translation: "Nor were we of those who fed the indigent;

ArabicText: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلۡخَاۤىِٕضِینَ ۝٤٥
Translation: "But we used to talk vanities with vain talkers;

ArabicText: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِیَوۡمِ ٱلدِّینِ ۝٤٦
Translation: "And we used to deny the Day of Judgment,

ArabicText: حَتَّىٰۤ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلۡیَقِینُ ۝٤٧
Translation: "Until there came to us (the Hour) that is certain."

ArabicText: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمۡ شَفَـٰعَةُ ٱلشَّـٰفِعِینَ ۝٤٨
Translation: Then will no intercession of (any) intercessors profit them.

ArabicText: فَمَا لَهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلتَّذۡكِرَةِ مُعۡرِضِینَ ۝٤٩
Translation: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from admonition?-

ArabicText: كَأَنَّهُمۡ حُمُرࣱ مُّسۡتَنفِرَةࣱ ۝٥٠
Translation: As if they were affrighted asses,

ArabicText: فَرَّتۡ مِن قَسۡوَرَةِۭ ۝٥١
Translation: Fleeing from a lion!

ArabicText: بَلۡ یُرِیدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِئࣲ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن یُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفࣰا مُّنَشَّرَةࣰ ۝٥٢
Translation: Forsooth, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of revelation) spread out!

ArabicText: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا یَخَافُونَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةَ ۝٥٣
Translation: By no means! But they fear not the Hereafter,

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهُۥ تَذۡكِرَةࣱ ۝٥٤
Translation: Nay, this surely is an admonition:

ArabicText: فَمَن شَاۤءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ ۝٥٥
Translation: Let any who will, keep it in remembrance!

ArabicText: وَمَا یَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّاۤ أَن یَشَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ ۝٥٦
Translation: But none will keep it in remembrance except as Allah wills: He is the Lord of Righteousness, and the Lord of Forgiveness.

ArabicText: لَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِیَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِیَـٰمَةِ ۝١
Translation: I do call to witness the Resurrection Day;

ArabicText: وَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلنَّفۡسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ ۝٢
Translation: And I do call to witness the self-reproaching spirit: (Eschew Evil).

ArabicText: أَیَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجۡمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ ۝٣
Translation: Does man think that We cannot assemble his bones?

ArabicText: بَلَىٰ قَـٰدِرِینَ عَلَىٰۤ أَن نُّسَوِّیَ بَنَانَهُۥ ۝٤
Translation: Nay, We are able to put together in perfect order the very tips of his fingers.

ArabicText: بَلۡ یُرِیدُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ لِیَفۡجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ ۝٥
Translation: But man wishes to do wrong (even) in the time in front of him.

ArabicText: یَسۡـَٔلُ أَیَّانَ یَوۡمُ ٱلۡقِیَـٰمَةِ ۝٦
Translation: He questions: "When is the Day of Resurrection?"

ArabicText: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ ۝٧
Translation: At length, when the sight is dazed,

ArabicText: وَخَسَفَ ٱلۡقَمَرُ ۝٨
Translation: And the moon is buried in darkness.

ArabicText: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ ۝٩
Translation: And the sun and moon are joined together,-

ArabicText: یَقُولُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ أَیۡنَ ٱلۡمَفَرُّ ۝١٠
Translation: That Day will Man say: "Where is the refuge?"

ArabicText: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ ۝١١
Translation: By no means! No place of safety!

ArabicText: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقَرُّ ۝١٢
Translation: Before thy Lord (alone), that Day will be the place of rest.

ArabicText: یُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ ۝١٣
Translation: That Day will Man be told (all) that he put forward, and all that he put back.

ArabicText: بَلِ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِهِۦ بَصِیرَةࣱ ۝١٤
Translation: Nay, man will be evidence against himself,

ArabicText: وَلَوۡ أَلۡقَىٰ مَعَاذِیرَهُۥ ۝١٥
Translation: Even though he were to put up his excuses.

ArabicText: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦۤ ۝١٦
Translation: Move not thy tongue concerning the (Qur´an) to make haste therewith.

ArabicText: إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا جَمۡعَهُۥ وَقُرۡءَانَهُۥ ۝١٧
Translation: It is for Us to collect it and to promulgate it:

ArabicText: فَإِذَا قَرَأۡنَـٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعۡ قُرۡءَانَهُۥ ۝١٨
Translation: But when We have promulgated it, follow thou its recital (as promulgated):

ArabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا بَیَانَهُۥ ۝١٩
Translation: Nay more, it is for Us to explain it (and make it clear):

ArabicText: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ ۝٢٠
Translation: Nay, (ye men!) but ye love the fleeting life,

ArabicText: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةَ ۝٢١
Translation: And leave alone the Hereafter.

ArabicText: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ نَّاضِرَةٌ ۝٢٢
Translation: Some faces, that Day, will beam (in brightness and beauty);-

ArabicText: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةࣱ ۝٢٣
Translation: Looking towards their Lord;

ArabicText: وَوُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بَاسِرَةࣱ ۝٢٤
Translation: And some faces, that Day, will be sad and dismal,

ArabicText: تَظُنُّ أَن یُفۡعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةࣱ ۝٢٥
Translation: In the thought that some back-breaking calamity was about to be inflicted on them;

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِیَ ۝٢٦
Translation: Yea, when (the soul) reaches to the collar-bone (in its exit),

ArabicText: وَقِیلَ مَنۡۜ رَاقࣲ ۝٢٧
Translation: And there will be a cry, "Who is a magician (to restore him)?"

ArabicText: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡفِرَاقُ ۝٢٨
Translation: And he will conclude that it was (the Time) of Parting;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ ۝٢٩
Translation: And one leg will be joined with another:

ArabicText: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ ٱلۡمَسَاقُ ۝٣٠
Translation: That Day the Drive will be (all) to thy Lord!

ArabicText: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ ۝٣١
Translation: So he gave nothing in charity, nor did he pray!-

ArabicText: وَلَـٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ ۝٣٢
Translation: But on the contrary, he rejected Truth and turned away!

ArabicText: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِۦ یَتَمَطَّىٰۤ ۝٣٣
Translation: Then did he stalk to his family in full conceit!

ArabicText: أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰ ۝٣٤
Translation: Woe to thee, (O men!), yea, woe!

ArabicText: ثُمَّ أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰۤ ۝٣٥
Translation: Again, Woe to thee, (O men!), yea, woe!

ArabicText: أَیَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ أَن یُتۡرَكَ سُدًى ۝٣٦
Translation: Does man think that he will be left uncontrolled, (without purpose)?

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ یَكُ نُطۡفَةࣰ مِّن مَّنِیࣲّ یُمۡنَىٰ ۝٣٧
Translation: Was he not a drop of sperm emitted (in lowly form)?

ArabicText: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةࣰ فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ ۝٣٨
Translation: Then did he become a leech-like clot; then did (Allah) make and fashion (him) in due proportion.

ArabicText: فَجَعَلَ مِنۡهُ ٱلزَّوۡجَیۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰۤ ۝٣٩
Translation: And of him He made two sexes, male and female.

ArabicText: أَلَیۡسَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ بِقَـٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰۤ أَن یُحۡـِۧیَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ ۝٤٠
Translation: Has not He, (the same), the power to give life to the dead?

ArabicText: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنِ حِینࣱ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ یَكُن شَیۡـࣰٔا مَّذۡكُورًا ۝١
Translation: Has there not been over Man a long period of Time, when he was nothing - (not even) mentioned?

ArabicText: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجࣲ نَّبۡتَلِیهِ فَجَعَلۡنَـٰهُ سَمِیعَۢا بَصِیرًا ۝٢
Translation: Verily We created Man from a drop of mingled sperm, in order to try him: So We gave him (the gifts), of Hearing and Sight.

ArabicText: إِنَّا هَدَیۡنَـٰهُ ٱلسَّبِیلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرࣰا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا ۝٣
Translation: We showed him the Way: whether he be grateful or ungrateful (rests on his will).

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ سَلَـٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغۡلَـٰلࣰا وَسَعِیرًا ۝٤
Translation: For the Rejecters we have prepared chains, yokes, and a blazing Fire.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ یَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسࣲ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا ۝٥
Translation: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-

ArabicText: عَیۡنࣰا یَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ یُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِیرࣰا ۝٦
Translation: A Fountain where the Devotees of Allah do drink, making it flow in unstinted abundance.

ArabicText: یُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَیَخَافُونَ یَوۡمࣰا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِیرࣰا ۝٧
Translation: They perform (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose evil flies far and wide.

ArabicText: وَیُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِینࣰا وَیَتِیمࣰا وَأَسِیرًا ۝٨
Translation: And they feed, for the love of Allah, the indigent, the orphan, and the captive,-

ArabicText: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِیدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَاۤءࣰ وَلَا شُكُورًا ۝٩
Translation: (Saying),"We feed you for the sake of Allah alone: no reward do we desire from you, nor thanks.

ArabicText: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا یَوۡمًا عَبُوسࣰا قَمۡطَرِیرࣰا ۝١٠
Translation: "We only fear a Day of distressful Wrath from the side of our Lord."

ArabicText: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةࣰ وَسُرُورࣰا ۝١١
Translation: But Allah will deliver them from the evil of that Day, and will shed over them a Light of Beauty and (blissful) Joy.

ArabicText: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ جَنَّةࣰ وَحَرِیرࣰا ۝١٢
Translation: And because they were patient and constant, He will reward them with a Garden and (garments of) silk.

ArabicText: مُّتَّكِـِٔینَ فِیهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَاۤىِٕكِۖ لَا یَرَوۡنَ فِیهَا شَمۡسࣰا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِیرࣰا ۝١٣
Translation: Reclining in the (Garden) on raised thrones, they will see there neither the sun´s (excessive heat) nor (the moon´s) excessive cold.

ArabicText: وَدَانِیَةً عَلَیۡهِمۡ ظِلَـٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِیلࣰا ۝١٤
Translation: And the shades of the (Garden) will come low over them, and the bunches (of fruit), there, will hang low in humility.

ArabicText: وَیُطَافُ عَلَیۡهِم بِـَٔانِیَةࣲ مِّن فِضَّةࣲ وَأَكۡوَابࣲ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِیرَا۠ ۝١٥
Translation: And amongst them will be passed round vessels of silver and goblets of crystal,-

ArabicText: قَوَارِیرَا۟ مِن فِضَّةࣲ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِیرࣰا ۝١٦
Translation: Crystal-clear, made of silver: they will determine the measure thereof (according to their wishes).

ArabicText: وَیُسۡقَوۡنَ فِیهَا كَأۡسࣰا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِیلًا ۝١٧
Translation: And they will be given to drink there of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Zanjabil,-

ArabicText: عَیۡنࣰا فِیهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِیلࣰا ۝١٨
Translation: A fountain there, called Salsabil.

ArabicText: ۞ وَیَطُوفُ عَلَیۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَ ٰ⁠نࣱ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَیۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤࣰا مَّنثُورࣰا ۝١٩
Translation: And round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness): If thou seest them, thou wouldst think them scattered Pearls.

ArabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَیۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَیۡتَ نَعِیمࣰا وَمُلۡكࣰا كَبِیرًا ۝٢٠
Translation: And when thou lookest, it is there thou wilt see a Bliss and a Realm Magnificent.

ArabicText: عَـٰلِیَهُمۡ ثِیَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرࣱ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقࣱۖ وَحُلُّوۤا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةࣲ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابࣰا طَهُورًا ۝٢١
Translation: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.

ArabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَاۤءࣰ وَكَانَ سَعۡیُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا ۝٢٢
Translation: "Verily this is a Reward for you, and your Endeavour is accepted and recognised."

ArabicText: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَیۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِیلࣰا ۝٢٣
Translation: It is We Who have sent down the Qur´an to thee by stages.

ArabicText: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورࣰا ۝٢٤
Translation: Therefore be patient with constancy to the Command of thy Lord, and hearken not to the sinner or the ingrate among them.

ArabicText: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةࣰ وَأَصِیلࣰا ۝٢٥
Translation: And celebrate the name of thy Lord morning and evening,

ArabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلَّیۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَیۡلࣰا طَوِیلًا ۝٢٦
Translation: And part of the night, prostrate thyself to Him; and glorify Him a long night through.

ArabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰۤؤُلَاۤءِ یُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَیَذَرُونَ وَرَاۤءَهُمۡ یَوۡمࣰا ثَقِیلࣰا ۝٢٧
Translation: As to these, they love the fleeting life, and put away behind them a Day (that will be) hard.

ArabicText: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَـٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَاۤ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَاۤ أَمۡثَـٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِیلًا ۝٢٨
Translation: It is We Who created them, and We have made their joints strong; but, when We will, We can substitute the like of them by a complete change.

ArabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةࣱۖ فَمَن شَاۤءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِیلࣰا ۝٢٩
Translation: This is an admonition: Whosoever will, let him take a (straight) Path to his Lord.

ArabicText: وَمَا تَشَاۤءُونَ إِلَّاۤ أَن یَشَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِیمًا حَكِیمࣰا ۝٣٠
Translation: But ye will not, except as Allah wills; for Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.

ArabicText: یُدۡخِلُ مَن یَشَاۤءُ فِی رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّـٰلِمِینَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِیمَۢا ۝٣١
Translation: He will admit to His Mercy whom He will; But the wrong-doers,- for them has He prepared a grievous Penalty.

ArabicText: وَٱلۡمُرۡسَلَـٰتِ عُرۡفࣰا ۝١
Translation: By the (Winds) sent forth one after another (to man´s profit);

ArabicText: فَٱلۡعَـٰصِفَـٰتِ عَصۡفࣰا ۝٢
Translation: Which then blow violently in tempestuous Gusts,

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّـٰشِرَ ٰ⁠تِ نَشۡرࣰا ۝٣
Translation: And scatter (things) far and wide;

ArabicText: فَٱلۡفَـٰرِقَـٰتِ فَرۡقࣰا ۝٤
Translation: Then separate them, one from another,

ArabicText: فَٱلۡمُلۡقِیَـٰتِ ذِكۡرًا ۝٥
Translation: Then spread abroad a Message,

ArabicText: عُذۡرًا أَوۡ نُذۡرًا ۝٦
Translation: Whether of Justification or of Warning;-

ArabicText: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَ ٰ⁠قِعࣱ ۝٧
Translation: Assuredly, what ye are promised must come to pass.

ArabicText: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتۡ ۝٨
Translation: Then when the stars become dim;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فُرِجَتۡ ۝٩
Translation: When the heaven is cleft asunder;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ نُسِفَتۡ ۝١٠
Translation: When the mountains are scattered (to the winds) as dust;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتۡ ۝١١
Translation: And when the messengers are (all) appointed a time (to collect);-

ArabicText: لِأَیِّ یَوۡمٍ أُجِّلَتۡ ۝١٢
Translation: For what Day are these (portents) deferred?

ArabicText: لِیَوۡمِ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ۝١٣
Translation: For the Day of Sorting out.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا یَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ۝١٤
Translation: And what will explain to thee what is the Day of Sorting out?

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝١٥
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ نُهۡلِكِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ ۝١٦
Translation: Did We not destroy the men of old (for their evil)?

ArabicText: ثُمَّ نُتۡبِعُهُمُ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرِینَ ۝١٧
Translation: So shall We make later (generations) follow them.

ArabicText: كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِینَ ۝١٨
Translation: Thus do We deal with men of sin.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝١٩
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ نَخۡلُقكُّم مِّن مَّاۤءࣲ مَّهِینࣲ ۝٢٠
Translation: Have We not created you from a fluid (held) despicable?-

ArabicText: فَجَعَلۡنَـٰهُ فِی قَرَارࣲ مَّكِینٍ ۝٢١
Translation: The which We placed in a place of rest, firmly fixed,

ArabicText: إِلَىٰ قَدَرࣲ مَّعۡلُومࣲ ۝٢٢
Translation: For a period (of gestation), determined (according to need)?

ArabicText: فَقَدَرۡنَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡقَـٰدِرُونَ ۝٢٣
Translation: For We do determine (according to need); for We are the best to determine (things).

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٢٤
Translation: Ah woe, that Day! to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ كِفَاتًا ۝٢٥
Translation: Have We not made the earth (as a place) to draw together.

ArabicText: أَحۡیَاۤءࣰ وَأَمۡوَ ٰ⁠تࣰا ۝٢٦
Translation: The living and the dead,

ArabicText: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِیهَا رَوَ ٰ⁠سِیَ شَـٰمِخَـٰتࣲ وَأَسۡقَیۡنَـٰكُم مَّاۤءࣰ فُرَاتࣰا ۝٢٧
Translation: And made therein mountains standing firm, lofty (in stature); and provided for you water sweet (and wholesome)?

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٢٨
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: ٱنطَلِقُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ ۝٢٩
Translation: (It will be said:) "Depart ye to that which ye used to reject as false!

ArabicText: ٱنطَلِقُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰ ظِلࣲّ ذِی ثَلَـٰثِ شُعَبࣲ ۝٣٠
Translation: "Depart ye to a Shadow (of smoke ascending) in three columns,

ArabicText: لَّا ظَلِیلࣲ وَلَا یُغۡنِی مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ ۝٣١
Translation: "(Which yields) no shade of coolness, and is of no use against the fierce Blaze.

ArabicText: إِنَّهَا تَرۡمِی بِشَرَرࣲ كَٱلۡقَصۡرِ ۝٣٢
Translation: "Indeed it throws about sparks (huge) as Forts,

ArabicText: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَـٰلَتࣱ صُفۡرࣱ ۝٣٣
Translation: "As if there were (a string of) yellow camels (marching swiftly)."

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٣٤
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: هَـٰذَا یَوۡمُ لَا یَنطِقُونَ ۝٣٥
Translation: That will be a Day when they shall not be able to speak.

ArabicText: وَلَا یُؤۡذَنُ لَهُمۡ فَیَعۡتَذِرُونَ ۝٣٦
Translation: Nor will it be open to them to put forth pleas.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٣٧
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: هَـٰذَا یَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِۖ جَمَعۡنَـٰكُمۡ وَٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ ۝٣٨
Translation: That will be a Day of Sorting out! We shall gather you together and those before (you)!

ArabicText: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمۡ كَیۡدࣱ فَكِیدُونِ ۝٣٩
Translation: Now, if ye have a trick (or plot), use it against Me!

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٤٠
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِینَ فِی ظِلَـٰلࣲ وَعُیُونࣲ ۝٤١
Translation: As to the Righteous, they shall be amidst (cool) shades and springs (of water).

ArabicText: وَفَوَ ٰ⁠كِهَ مِمَّا یَشۡتَهُونَ ۝٤٢
Translation: And (they shall have) fruits,- all they desire.

ArabicText: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشۡرَبُوا۟ هَنِیۤـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ ۝٤٣
Translation: "Eat ye and drink ye to your heart´s content: for that ye worked (Righteousness).

ArabicText: إِنَّا كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ نَجۡزِی ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِینَ ۝٤٤
Translation: Thus do We certainly reward the Doers of Good.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٤٥
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: كُلُوا۟ وَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ قَلِیلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجۡرِمُونَ ۝٤٦
Translation: (O ye unjust!) Eat ye and enjoy yourselves (but) a little while, for that ye are Sinners.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٤٧
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: وَإِذَا قِیلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُوا۟ لَا یَرۡكَعُونَ ۝٤٨
Translation: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate yourselves!" they do not so.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝٤٩
Translation: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!

ArabicText: فَبِأَیِّ حَدِیثِۭ بَعۡدَهُۥ یُؤۡمِنُونَ ۝٥٠
Translation: Then what Message, after that, will they believe in?

ArabicText: عَمَّ یَتَسَاۤءَلُونَ ۝١
Translation: Concerning what are they disputing?

ArabicText: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ ۝٢
Translation: Concerning the Great News,

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی هُمۡ فِیهِ مُخۡتَلِفُونَ ۝٣
Translation: About which they cannot agree.

ArabicText: كَلَّا سَیَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٤
Translation: Verily, they shall soon (come to) know!

ArabicText: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَیَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٥
Translation: Verily, verily they shall soon (come to) know!

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ مِهَـٰدࣰا ۝٦
Translation: Have We not made the earth as a wide expanse,

ArabicText: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَوۡتَادࣰا ۝٧
Translation: And the mountains as pegs?

ArabicText: وَخَلَقۡنَـٰكُمۡ أَزۡوَ ٰ⁠جࣰا ۝٨
Translation: And (have We not) created you in pairs,

ArabicText: وَجَعَلۡنَا نَوۡمَكُمۡ سُبَاتࣰا ۝٩
Translation: And made your sleep for rest,

ArabicText: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلَّیۡلَ لِبَاسࣰا ۝١٠
Translation: And made the night as a covering,

ArabicText: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشࣰا ۝١١
Translation: And made the day as a means of subsistence?

ArabicText: وَبَنَیۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمۡ سَبۡعࣰا شِدَادࣰا ۝١٢
Translation: And (have We not) built over you the seven firmaments,

ArabicText: وَجَعَلۡنَا سِرَاجࣰا وَهَّاجࣰا ۝١٣
Translation: And placed (therein) a Light of Splendour?

ArabicText: وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُعۡصِرَ ٰ⁠تِ مَاۤءࣰ ثَجَّاجࣰا ۝١٤
Translation: And do We not send down from the clouds water in abundance,

ArabicText: لِّنُخۡرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبࣰّا وَنَبَاتࣰا ۝١٥
Translation: That We may produce therewith corn and vegetables,

ArabicText: وَجَنَّـٰتٍ أَلۡفَافًا ۝١٦
Translation: And gardens of luxurious growth?

ArabicText: إِنَّ یَوۡمَ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ كَانَ مِیقَـٰتࣰا ۝١٧
Translation: Verily the Day of Sorting out is a thing appointed,

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یُنفَخُ فِی ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأۡتُونَ أَفۡوَاجࣰا ۝١٨
Translation: The Day that the Trumpet shall be sounded, and ye shall come forth in crowds;

ArabicText: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فَكَانَتۡ أَبۡوَ ٰ⁠بࣰا ۝١٩
Translation: And the heavens shall be opened as if there were doors,

ArabicText: وَسُیِّرَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ فَكَانَتۡ سَرَابًا ۝٢٠
Translation: And the mountains shall vanish, as if they were a mirage.

ArabicText: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتۡ مِرۡصَادࣰا ۝٢١
Translation: Truly Hell is as a place of ambush,

ArabicText: لِّلطَّـٰغِینَ مَـَٔابࣰا ۝٢٢
Translation: For the transgressors a place of destination:

ArabicText: لَّـٰبِثِینَ فِیهَاۤ أَحۡقَابࣰا ۝٢٣
Translation: They will dwell therein for ages.

ArabicText: لَّا یَذُوقُونَ فِیهَا بَرۡدࣰا وَلَا شَرَابًا ۝٢٤
Translation: Nothing cool shall they taste therein, nor any drink,

ArabicText: إِلَّا حَمِیمࣰا وَغَسَّاقࣰا ۝٢٥
Translation: Save a boiling fluid and a fluid, dark, murky, intensely cold,

ArabicText: جَزَاۤءࣰ وِفَاقًا ۝٢٦
Translation: A fitting recompense (for them).

ArabicText: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوا۟ لَا یَرۡجُونَ حِسَابࣰا ۝٢٧
Translation: For that they used not to fear any account (for their deeds),

ArabicText: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا كِذَّابࣰا ۝٢٨
Translation: But they (impudently) treated Our Signs as false.

ArabicText: وَكُلَّ شَیۡءٍ أَحۡصَیۡنَـٰهُ كِتَـٰبࣰا ۝٢٩
Translation: And all things have We preserved on record.

ArabicText: فَذُوقُوا۟ فَلَن نَّزِیدَكُمۡ إِلَّا عَذَابًا ۝٣٠
Translation: "So taste ye (the fruits of your deeds); for no increase shall We grant you, except in Punishment."

ArabicText: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِینَ مَفَازًا ۝٣١
Translation: Verily for the Righteous there will be a fulfilment of (the heart´s) desires;

ArabicText: حَدَاۤىِٕقَ وَأَعۡنَـٰبࣰا ۝٣٢
Translation: Gardens enclosed, and grapevines;

ArabicText: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتۡرَابࣰا ۝٣٣
Translation: And voluptuous women of equal age;

ArabicText: وَكَأۡسࣰا دِهَاقࣰا ۝٣٤
Translation: And a cup full (to the brim).

ArabicText: لَّا یَسۡمَعُونَ فِیهَا لَغۡوࣰا وَلَا كِذَّ ٰ⁠بࣰا ۝٣٥
Translation: No vanity shall they hear therein, nor Untruth:-

ArabicText: جَزَاۤءࣰ مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَاۤءً حِسَابࣰا ۝٣٦
Translation: Recompense from thy Lord, a gift, (amply) sufficient,

ArabicText: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَیۡنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِۖ لَا یَمۡلِكُونَ مِنۡهُ خِطَابࣰا ۝٣٧
Translation: (From) the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between, (Allah) Most Gracious: None shall have power to argue with Him.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةُ صَفࣰّاۖ لَّا یَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنۡ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابࣰا ۝٣٨
Translation: The Day that the Spirit and the angels will stand forth in ranks, none shall speak except any who is permitted by (Allah) Most Gracious, and He will say what is right.

ArabicText: ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَاۤءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا ۝٣٩
Translation: That Day will be the sure Reality: Therefore, whoso will, let him take a (straight) return to his Lord!

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَنذَرۡنَـٰكُمۡ عَذَابࣰا قَرِیبࣰا یَوۡمَ یَنظُرُ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ یَدَاهُ وَیَقُولُ ٱلۡكَافِرُ یَـٰلَیۡتَنِی كُنتُ تُرَ ٰ⁠بَۢا ۝٤٠
Translation: Verily, We have warned you of a Penalty near, the Day when man will see (the deeds) which his hands have sent forth, and the Unbeliever will say, "Woe unto me! Would that I were (metre) dust!"

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّـٰزِعَـٰتِ غَرۡقࣰا ۝١
Translation: By the (angels) who tear out (the souls of the wicked) with violence;

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّـٰشِطَـٰتِ نَشۡطࣰا ۝٢
Translation: By those who gently draw out (the souls of the blessed);

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّـٰبِحَـٰتِ سَبۡحࣰا ۝٣
Translation: And by those who glide along (on errands of mercy),

ArabicText: فَٱلسَّـٰبِقَـٰتِ سَبۡقࣰا ۝٤
Translation: Then press forward as in a race,

ArabicText: فَٱلۡمُدَبِّرَ ٰ⁠تِ أَمۡرࣰا ۝٥
Translation: Then arrange to do (the Commands of their Lord),

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ ۝٦
Translation: One Day everything that can be in commotion will be in violent commotion,

ArabicText: تَتۡبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ ۝٧
Translation: Followed by oft-repeated (commotions):

ArabicText: قُلُوبࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ وَاجِفَةٌ ۝٨
Translation: Hearts that Day will be in agitation;

ArabicText: أَبۡصَـٰرُهَا خَـٰشِعَةࣱ ۝٩
Translation: Cast down will be (their owners´) eyes.

ArabicText: یَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرۡدُودُونَ فِی ٱلۡحَافِرَةِ ۝١٠
Translation: They say (now): "What! shall we indeed be returned to (our) former state?

ArabicText: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَـٰمࣰا نَّخِرَةࣰ ۝١١
Translation: "What! - when we shall have become rotten bones?"

ArabicText: قَالُوا۟ تِلۡكَ إِذࣰا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةࣱ ۝١٢
Translation: They say: "It would, in that case, be a return with loss!"

ArabicText: فَإِنَّمَا هِیَ زَجۡرَةࣱ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣱ ۝١٣
Translation: But verily, it will be but a single (Compelling) Cry,

ArabicText: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ ۝١٤
Translation: When, behold, they will be in the (full) awakening (to Judgment).

ArabicText: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِیثُ مُوسَىٰۤ ۝١٥
Translation: Has the story of Moses reached thee?

ArabicText: إِذۡ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلۡوَادِ ٱلۡمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى ۝١٦
Translation: Behold, thy Lord did call to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa:-

ArabicText: ٱذۡهَبۡ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ ۝١٧
Translation: "Go thou to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed all bounds:

ArabicText: فَقُلۡ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰۤ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ ۝١٨
Translation: "And say to him, ´Wouldst thou that thou shouldst be purified (from sin)?-

ArabicText: وَأَهۡدِیَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخۡشَىٰ ۝١٩
Translation: "´And that I guide thee to thy Lord, so thou shouldst fear Him?´"

ArabicText: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلۡـَٔایَةَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ ۝٢٠
Translation: Then did (Moses) show him the Great Sign.

ArabicText: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ ۝٢١
Translation: But (Pharaoh) rejected it and disobeyed (guidance);

ArabicText: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ یَسۡعَىٰ ۝٢٢
Translation: Further, he turned his back, striving hard (against Allah).

ArabicText: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ ۝٢٣
Translation: Then he collected (his men) and made a proclamation,

ArabicText: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ ۝٢٤
Translation: Saying, "I am your Lord, Most High".

ArabicText: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةِ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰۤ ۝٢٥
Translation: But Allah did punish him, (and made an) example of him, - in the Hereafter, as in this life.

ArabicText: إِنَّ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ لَعِبۡرَةࣰ لِّمَن یَخۡشَىٰۤ ۝٢٦
Translation: Verily in this is an instructive warning for whosoever feareth (Allah).

ArabicText: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا ۝٢٧
Translation: What! Are ye the more difficult to create or the heaven (above)? (Allah) hath constructed it:

ArabicText: رَفَعَ سَمۡكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا ۝٢٨
Translation: On high hath He raised its canopy, and He hath given it order and perfection.

ArabicText: وَأَغۡطَشَ لَیۡلَهَا وَأَخۡرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا ۝٢٩
Translation: Its night doth He endow with darkness, and its splendour doth He bring out (with light).

ArabicText: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ دَحَىٰهَاۤ ۝٣٠
Translation: And the earth, moreover, hath He extended (to a wide expanse);

ArabicText: أَخۡرَجَ مِنۡهَا مَاۤءَهَا وَمَرۡعَىٰهَا ۝٣١
Translation: He draweth out therefrom its moisture and its pasture;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَرۡسَىٰهَا ۝٣٢
Translation: And the mountains hath He firmly fixed;-

ArabicText: مَتَـٰعࣰا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَـٰمِكُمۡ ۝٣٣
Translation: For use and convenience to you and your cattle.

ArabicText: فَإِذَا جَاۤءَتِ ٱلطَّاۤمَّةُ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ ۝٣٤
Translation: Therefore, when there comes the great, overwhelming (Event),-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ ۝٣٥
Translation: The Day when man shall remember (all) that he strove for,

ArabicText: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلۡجَحِیمُ لِمَن یَرَىٰ ۝٣٦
Translation: And Hell-Fire shall be placed in full view for (all) to see,-

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ ۝٣٧
Translation: Then, for such as had transgressed all bounds,

ArabicText: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلۡحَیَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡیَا ۝٣٨
Translation: And had preferred the life of this world,

ArabicText: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَحِیمَ هِیَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ ۝٣٩
Translation: The Abode will be Hell-Fire;

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفۡسَ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ ۝٤٠
Translation: And for such as had entertained the fear of standing before their Lord´s (tribunal) and had restrained (their) soul from lower desires,

ArabicText: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ هِیَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ ۝٤١
Translation: Their abode will be the Garden.

ArabicText: یَسۡـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَیَّانَ مُرۡسَىٰهَا ۝٤٢
Translation: They ask thee about the Hour,-´When will be its appointed time?

ArabicText: فِیمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكۡرَىٰهَاۤ ۝٤٣
Translation: Wherein art thou (concerned) with the declaration thereof?

ArabicText: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَاۤ ۝٤٤
Translation: With thy Lord in the Limit fixed therefor.

ArabicText: إِنَّمَاۤ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن یَخۡشَىٰهَا ۝٤٥
Translation: Thou art but a Warner for such as fear it.

ArabicText: كَأَنَّهُمۡ یَوۡمَ یَرَوۡنَهَا لَمۡ یَلۡبَثُوۤا۟ إِلَّا عَشِیَّةً أَوۡ ضُحَىٰهَا ۝٤٦
Translation: The Day they see it, (It will be) as if they had tarried but a single evening, or (at most till) the following morn!

ArabicText: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰۤ ۝١
Translation: (The Prophet) frowned and turned away,

ArabicText: أَن جَاۤءَهُ ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ ۝٢
Translation: Because there came to him the blind man (interrupting).

ArabicText: وَمَا یُدۡرِیكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ یَزَّكَّىٰۤ ۝٣
Translation: But what could tell thee but that perchance he might grow (in spiritual understanding)?-

ArabicText: أَوۡ یَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰۤ ۝٤
Translation: Or that he might receive admonition, and the teaching might profit him?

ArabicText: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ ۝٥
Translation: As to one who regards Himself as self-sufficient,

ArabicText: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ ۝٦
Translation: To him dost thou attend;

ArabicText: وَمَا عَلَیۡكَ أَلَّا یَزَّكَّىٰ ۝٧
Translation: Though it is no blame to thee if he grow not (in spiritual understanding).

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا مَن جَاۤءَكَ یَسۡعَىٰ ۝٨
Translation: But as to him who came to thee striving earnestly,

ArabicText: وَهُوَ یَخۡشَىٰ ۝٩
Translation: And with fear (in his heart),

ArabicText: فَأَنتَ عَنۡهُ تَلَهَّىٰ ۝١٠
Translation: Of him wast thou unmindful.

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهَا تَذۡكِرَةࣱ ۝١١
Translation: By no means (should it be so)! For it is indeed a Message of instruction:

ArabicText: فَمَن شَاۤءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ ۝١٢
Translation: Therefore let whoso will, keep it in remembrance.

ArabicText: فِی صُحُفࣲ مُّكَرَّمَةࣲ ۝١٣
Translation: (It is) in Books held (greatly) in honour,
Exalted (in dignity), kept pure and holy,

ArabicText: بِأَیۡدِی سَفَرَةࣲ ۝١٥
Translation: (Written) by the hands of scribes-

ArabicText: كِرَامِۭ بَرَرَةࣲ ۝١٦
Translation: Honourable and Pious and Just.

ArabicText: قُتِلَ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مَاۤ أَكۡفَرَهُۥ ۝١٧
Translation: Woe to man! What hath made him reject Allah;

ArabicText: مِنۡ أَیِّ شَیۡءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ ۝١٨
Translation: From what stuff hath He created him?

ArabicText: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ ۝١٩
Translation: From a sperm-drop: He hath created him, and then mouldeth him in due proportions;

ArabicText: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِیلَ یَسَّرَهُۥ ۝٢٠
Translation: Then doth He make His path smooth for him;

ArabicText: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقۡبَرَهُۥ ۝٢١
Translation: Then He causeth him to die, and putteth him in his grave;

ArabicText: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَاۤءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ ۝٢٢
Translation: Then, when it is His Will, He will raise him up (again).

ArabicText: كَلَّا لَمَّا یَقۡضِ مَاۤ أَمَرَهُۥ ۝٢٣
Translation: By no means hath he fulfilled what Allah hath commanded him.

ArabicText: فَلۡیَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦۤ ۝٢٤
Translation: Then let man look at his food, (and how We provide it):

ArabicText: أَنَّا صَبَبۡنَا ٱلۡمَاۤءَ صَبࣰّا ۝٢٥
Translation: For that We pour forth water in abundance,

ArabicText: ثُمَّ شَقَقۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ شَقࣰّا ۝٢٦
Translation: And We split the earth in fragments,

ArabicText: فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِیهَا حَبࣰّا ۝٢٧
Translation: And produce therein corn,

ArabicText: وَعِنَبࣰا وَقَضۡبࣰا ۝٢٨
Translation: And Grapes and nutritious plants,

ArabicText: وَزَیۡتُونࣰا وَنَخۡلࣰا ۝٢٩
Translation: And Olives and Dates,

ArabicText: وَحَدَاۤىِٕقَ غُلۡبࣰا ۝٣٠
Translation: And enclosed Gardens, dense with lofty trees,

ArabicText: وَفَـٰكِهَةࣰ وَأَبࣰّا ۝٣١
Translation: And fruits and fodder,-

ArabicText: مَّتَـٰعࣰا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَـٰمِكُمۡ ۝٣٢
Translation: For use and convenience to you and your cattle.

ArabicText: فَإِذَا جَاۤءَتِ ٱلصَّاۤخَّةُ ۝٣٣
Translation: At length, when there comes the Deafening Noise,-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَفِرُّ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مِنۡ أَخِیهِ ۝٣٤
Translation: That Day shall a man flee from his own brother,

ArabicText: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِیهِ ۝٣٥
Translation: And from his mother and his father,

ArabicText: وَصَـٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِیهِ ۝٣٦
Translation: And from his wife and his children.

ArabicText: لِكُلِّ ٱمۡرِئࣲ مِّنۡهُمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ شَأۡنࣱ یُغۡنِیهِ ۝٣٧
Translation: Each one of them, that Day, will have enough concern (of his own) to make him indifferent to the others.

ArabicText: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ مُّسۡفِرَةࣱ ۝٣٨
Translation: Some faces that Day will be beaming,

ArabicText: ضَاحِكَةࣱ مُّسۡتَبۡشِرَةࣱ ۝٣٩
Translation: Laughing, rejoicing.

ArabicText: وَوُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ عَلَیۡهَا غَبَرَةࣱ ۝٤٠
Translation: And other faces that Day will be dust-stained,

ArabicText: تَرۡهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ ۝٤١
Translation: Blackness will cover them:

ArabicText: أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلۡكَفَرَةُ ٱلۡفَجَرَةُ ۝٤٢
Translation: Such will be the Rejecters of Allah, the doers of iniquity.

ArabicText: إِذَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ كُوِّرَتۡ ۝١
Translation: When the sun (with its spacious light) is folded up;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتۡ ۝٢
Translation: When the stars fall, losing their lustre;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ سُیِّرَتۡ ۝٣
Translation: When the mountains vanish (like a mirage);

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتۡ ۝٤
Translation: When the she-camels, ten months with young, are left untended;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتۡ ۝٥
Translation: When the wild beasts are herded together (in the human habitations);

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتۡ ۝٦
Translation: When the oceans boil over with a swell;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتۡ ۝٧
Translation: When the souls are sorted out, (being joined, like with like);

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡمَوۡءُۥدَةُ سُىِٕلَتۡ ۝٨
Translation: When the female (infant), buried alive, is questioned -

ArabicText: بِأَیِّ ذَنۢبࣲ قُتِلَتۡ ۝٩
Translation: For what crime she was killed;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتۡ ۝١٠
Translation: When the scrolls are laid open;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ كُشِطَتۡ ۝١١
Translation: When the world on High is unveiled;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَحِیمُ سُعِّرَتۡ ۝١٢
Translation: When the Blazing Fire is kindled to fierce heat;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَنَّةُ أُزۡلِفَتۡ ۝١٣
Translation: And when the Garden is brought near;-

ArabicText: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسࣱ مَّاۤ أَحۡضَرَتۡ ۝١٤
Translation: (Then) shall each soul know what it has put forward.

ArabicText: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلۡخُنَّسِ ۝١٥
Translation: So verily I call to witness the planets - that recede,

ArabicText: ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡكُنَّسِ ۝١٦
Translation: Go straight, or hide;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا عَسۡعَسَ ۝١٧
Translation: And the Night as it dissipates;

ArabicText: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ ۝١٨
Translation: And the Dawn as it breathes away the darkness;-

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولࣲ كَرِیمࣲ ۝١٩
Translation: Verily this is the word of a most honourable Messenger,

ArabicText: ذِی قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِی ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِینࣲ ۝٢٠
Translation: Endued with Power, with rank before the Lord of the Throne,

ArabicText: مُّطَاعࣲ ثَمَّ أَمِینࣲ ۝٢١
Translation: With authority there, (and) faithful to his trust.

ArabicText: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجۡنُونࣲ ۝٢٢
Translation: And (O people!) your companion is not one possessed;

ArabicText: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡمُبِینِ ۝٢٣
Translation: And without doubt he saw him in the clear horizon.

ArabicText: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلۡغَیۡبِ بِضَنِینࣲ ۝٢٤
Translation: Neither doth he withhold grudgingly a knowledge of the Unseen.

ArabicText: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَیۡطَـٰنࣲ رَّجِیمࣲ ۝٢٥
Translation: Nor is it the word of an evil spirit accursed.

ArabicText: فَأَیۡنَ تَذۡهَبُونَ ۝٢٦
Translation: When whither go ye?

ArabicText: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرࣱ لِّلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ ۝٢٧
Translation: Verily this is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds:

ArabicText: لِمَن شَاۤءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن یَسۡتَقِیمَ ۝٢٨
Translation: (With profit) to whoever among you wills to go straight:

ArabicText: وَمَا تَشَاۤءُونَ إِلَّاۤ أَن یَشَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ ۝٢٩
Translation: But ye shall not will except as Allah wills,- the Cherisher of the Worlds.

ArabicText: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ ٱنفَطَرَتۡ ۝١
Translation: When the Sky is cleft asunder;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتۡ ۝٢
Translation: When the Stars are scattered;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتۡ ۝٣
Translation: When the Oceans are suffered to burst forth;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡقُبُورُ بُعۡثِرَتۡ ۝٤
Translation: And when the Graves are turned upside down;-

ArabicText: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسࣱ مَّا قَدَّمَتۡ وَأَخَّرَتۡ ۝٥
Translation: (Then) shall each soul know what it hath sent forward and (what it hath) kept back.

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡكَرِیمِ ۝٦
Translation: O man! What has seduced thee from thy Lord Most Beneficent?-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ ۝٧
Translation: Him Who created thee. Fashioned thee in due proportion, and gave thee a just bias;

ArabicText: فِیۤ أَیِّ صُورَةࣲ مَّا شَاۤءَ رَكَّبَكَ ۝٨
Translation: In whatever Form He wills, does He put thee together.

ArabicText: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّینِ ۝٩
Translation: Nay! But ye do reject Right and Judgment!

ArabicText: وَإِنَّ عَلَیۡكُمۡ لَحَـٰفِظِینَ ۝١٠
Translation: But verily over you (are appointed angels) to protect you,-

ArabicText: كِرَامࣰا كَـٰتِبِینَ ۝١١
Translation: Kind and honourable,- Writing down (your deeds):

ArabicText: یَعۡلَمُونَ مَا تَفۡعَلُونَ ۝١٢
Translation: They know (and understand) all that ye do.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِی نَعِیمࣲ ۝١٣
Translation: As for the Righteous, they will be in bliss;

ArabicText: وَإِنَّ ٱلۡفُجَّارَ لَفِی جَحِیمࣲ ۝١٤
Translation: And the Wicked - they will be in the Fire,

ArabicText: یَصۡلَوۡنَهَا یَوۡمَ ٱلدِّینِ ۝١٥
Translation: Which they will enter on the Day of Judgment,

ArabicText: وَمَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا بِغَاۤىِٕبِینَ ۝١٦
Translation: And they will not be able to keep away therefrom.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا یَوۡمُ ٱلدِّینِ ۝١٧
Translation: And what will explain to thee what the Day of Judgment is?

ArabicText: ثُمَّ مَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا یَوۡمُ ٱلدِّینِ ۝١٨
