Translation: Again, what will explain to thee what the Day of Judgment is?

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ لَا تَمۡلِكُ نَفۡسࣱ لِّنَفۡسࣲ شَیۡـࣰٔاۖ وَٱلۡأَمۡرُ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلَّهِ ۝١٩
Translation: (It will be) the Day when no soul shall have power (to do) aught for another: For the command, that Day, will be (wholly) with Allah.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِینَ ۝١
Translation: Woe to those that deal in fraud,-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ یَسۡتَوۡفُونَ ۝٢
Translation: Those who, when they have to receive by measure from men, exact full measure,

ArabicText: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمۡ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمۡ یُخۡسِرُونَ ۝٣
Translation: But when they have to give by measure or weight to men, give less than due.

ArabicText: أَلَا یَظُنُّ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبۡعُوثُونَ ۝٤
Translation: Do they not think that they will be called to account?-

ArabicText: لِیَوۡمٍ عَظِیمࣲ ۝٥
Translation: On a Mighty Day,

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ ۝٦
Translation: A Day when (all) mankind will stand before the Lord of the Worlds?

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِی سِجِّینࣲ ۝٧
Translation: Nay! Surely the record of the wicked is (preserved) in Sijjin.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّینࣱ ۝٨
Translation: And what will explain to thee what Sijjin is?

ArabicText: كِتَـٰبࣱ مَّرۡقُومࣱ ۝٩
Translation: (There is) a Register (fully) inscribed.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ ۝١٠
Translation: Woe, that Day, to those that deny-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ یُكَذِّبُونَ بِیَوۡمِ ٱلدِّینِ ۝١١
Translation: Those that deny the Day of Judgment.

ArabicText: وَمَا یُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦۤ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِیمٍ ۝١٢
Translation: And none can deny it but the Transgressor beyond bounds the Sinner!

ArabicText: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَیۡهِ ءَایَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِیرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ ۝١٣
Translation: When Our Signs are rehearsed to him, he says, "Tales of the ancients!"

ArabicText: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ یَكۡسِبُونَ ۝١٤
Translation: By no means! but on their hearts is the stain of the (ill) which they do!

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ ۝١٥
Translation: Verily, from (the Light of) their Lord, that Day, will they be veiled.

ArabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمۡ لَصَالُوا۟ ٱلۡجَحِیمِ ۝١٦
Translation: Further, they will enter the Fire of Hell.

ArabicText: ثُمَّ یُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِی كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ ۝١٧
Translation: Further, it will be said to them: "This is the (reality) which ye rejected as false!

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِی عِلِّیِّینَ ۝١٨
Translation: Day, verily the record of the Righteous is (preserved) in ´Illiyin.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّیُّونَ ۝١٩
Translation: And what will explain to thee what ´Illiyun is?

ArabicText: كِتَـٰبࣱ مَّرۡقُومࣱ ۝٢٠
Translation: (There is) a Register (fully) inscribed,

ArabicText: یَشۡهَدُهُ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ ۝٢١
Translation: To which bear witness those Nearest (to Allah).

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِی نَعِیمٍ ۝٢٢
Translation: Truly the Righteous will be in Bliss:

ArabicText: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَاۤىِٕكِ یَنظُرُونَ ۝٢٣
Translation: On Thrones (of Dignity) will they command a sight (of all things):

ArabicText: تَعۡرِفُ فِی وُجُوهِهِمۡ نَضۡرَةَ ٱلنَّعِیمِ ۝٢٤
Translation: Thou wilt recognise in their faces the beaming brightness of Bliss.

ArabicText: یُسۡقَوۡنَ مِن رَّحِیقࣲ مَّخۡتُومٍ ۝٢٥
Translation: Their thirst will be slaked with Pure Wine sealed:

ArabicText: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكࣱۚ وَفِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ فَلۡیَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ ۝٢٦
Translation: The seal thereof will be Musk: And for this let those aspire, who have aspirations:

ArabicText: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسۡنِیمٍ ۝٢٧
Translation: With it will be (given) a mixture of Tasnim:

ArabicText: عَیۡنࣰا یَشۡرَبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ ۝٢٨
Translation: A spring, from (the waters) whereof drink those Nearest to Allah.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ أَجۡرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ یَضۡحَكُونَ ۝٢٩
Translation: Those in sin used to laugh at those who believed,

ArabicText: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِهِمۡ یَتَغَامَزُونَ ۝٣٠
Translation: And whenever they passed by them, used to wink at each other (in mockery);

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِینَ ۝٣١
Translation: And when they returned to their own people, they would return jesting;

ArabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰۤؤُلَاۤءِ لَضَاۤلُّونَ ۝٣٢
Translation: And whenever they saw them, they would say, "Behold! These are the people truly astray!"

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أُرۡسِلُوا۟ عَلَیۡهِمۡ حَـٰفِظِینَ ۝٣٣
Translation: But they had not been sent as keepers over them!

ArabicText: فَٱلۡیَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ یَضۡحَكُونَ ۝٣٤
Translation: But on this Day the Believers will laugh at the Unbelievers:

ArabicText: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَاۤىِٕكِ یَنظُرُونَ ۝٣٥
Translation: On Thrones (of Dignity) they will command (a sight) (of all things).

ArabicText: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ یَفۡعَلُونَ ۝٣٦
Translation: Will not the Unbelievers have been paid back for what they did?

ArabicText: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ ٱنشَقَّتۡ ۝١
Translation: When the sky is rent asunder,

ArabicText: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ ۝٢
Translation: And hearkens to (the Command of) its Lord, and it must needs (do so);-

ArabicText: وَإِذَا ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مُدَّتۡ ۝٣
Translation: And when the earth is flattened out,

ArabicText: وَأَلۡقَتۡ مَا فِیهَا وَتَخَلَّتۡ ۝٤
Translation: And casts forth what is within it and becomes (clean) empty,

ArabicText: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ ۝٥
Translation: And hearkens to (the Command of) its Lord,- and it must needs (do so);- (then will come Home the full reality).

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحࣰا فَمُلَـٰقِیهِ ۝٦
Translation: O thou man! Verily thou art ever toiling on towards thy Lord- painfully toiling,- but thou shalt meet Him.

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِیَمِینِهِۦ ۝٧
Translation: Then he who is given his Record in his right hand,

ArabicText: فَسَوۡفَ یُحَاسَبُ حِسَابࣰا یَسِیرࣰا ۝٨
Translation: Soon will his account be taken by an easy reckoning,

ArabicText: وَیَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورࣰا ۝٩
Translation: And he will turn to his people, rejoicing!

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ وَرَاۤءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ ۝١٠
Translation: But he who is given his Record behind his back,-

ArabicText: فَسَوۡفَ یَدۡعُوا۟ ثُبُورࣰا ۝١١
Translation: Soon will he cry for perdition,

ArabicText: وَیَصۡلَىٰ سَعِیرًا ۝١٢
Translation: And he will enter a Blazing Fire.

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِیۤ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورًا ۝١٣
Translation: Truly, did he go about among his people, rejoicing!

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن یَحُورَ ۝١٤
Translation: Truly, did he think that he would not have to return (to Us)!

ArabicText: بَلَىٰۤۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِیرࣰا ۝١٥
Translation: Nay, nay! for his Lord was (ever) watchful of him!

ArabicText: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ ۝١٦
Translation: So I do call to witness the ruddy glow of Sunset;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّیۡلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ ۝١٧
Translation: The Night and its Homing;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ ۝١٨
Translation: And the Moon in her fullness:

ArabicText: لَتَرۡكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقࣲ ۝١٩
Translation: Ye shall surely travel from stage to stage.

ArabicText: فَمَا لَهُمۡ لَا یُؤۡمِنُونَ ۝٢٠
Translation: What then is the matter with them, that they believe not?-

ArabicText: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَیۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا یَسۡجُدُونَ ۩ ۝٢١
Translation: And when the Qur´an is read to them, they fall not prostrate,

ArabicText: بَلِ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ یُكَذِّبُونَ ۝٢٢
Translation: But on the contrary the Unbelievers reject (it).

ArabicText: وَٱللَّهُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا یُوعُونَ ۝٢٣
Translation: But Allah has full knowledge of what they secrete (in their breasts)

ArabicText: فَبَشِّرۡهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِیمٍ ۝٢٤
Translation: So announce to them a Penalty Grievous,

ArabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَیۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ ۝٢٥
Translation: Except to those who believe and work righteous deeds: For them is a Reward that will never fail.

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡبُرُوجِ ۝١
Translation: By the sky, (displaying) the Zodiacal Signs;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡیَوۡمِ ٱلۡمَوۡعُودِ ۝٢
Translation: By the promised Day (of Judgment);

ArabicText: وَشَاهِدࣲ وَمَشۡهُودࣲ ۝٣
Translation: By one that witnesses, and the subject of the witness;-

ArabicText: قُتِلَ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡأُخۡدُودِ ۝٤
Translation: Woe to the makers of the pit (of fire),

ArabicText: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡوَقُودِ ۝٥
Translation: Fire supplied (abundantly) with fuel:

ArabicText: إِذۡ هُمۡ عَلَیۡهَا قُعُودࣱ ۝٦
Translation: Behold! they sat over against the (fire),

ArabicText: وَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَا یَفۡعَلُونَ بِٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ شُهُودࣱ ۝٧
Translation: And they witnessed (all) that they were doing against the Believers.

ArabicText: وَمَا نَقَمُوا۟ مِنۡهُمۡ إِلَّاۤ أَن یُؤۡمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِیزِ ٱلۡحَمِیدِ ۝٨
Translation: And they ill-treated them for no other reason than that they believed in Allah, Exalted in Power, Worthy of all Praise!-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَیۡءࣲ شَهِیدٌ ۝٩
Translation: Him to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth! And Allah is Witness to all things.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ فَتَنُوا۟ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَـٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمۡ یَتُوبُوا۟ فَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ ٱلۡحَرِیقِ ۝١٠
Translation: Those who persecute (or draw into temptation) the Believers, men and women, and do not turn in repentance, will have the Penalty of Hell: They will have the Penalty of the Burning Fire.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمۡ جَنَّـٰتࣱ تَجۡرِی مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَـٰرُۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡكَبِیرُ ۝١١
Translation: For those who believe and do righteous deeds, will be Gardens; beneath which rivers flow: That is the great Salvation, (the fulfilment of all desires),

ArabicText: إِنَّ بَطۡشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِیدٌ ۝١٢
Translation: Truly strong is the Grip (and Power) of thy Lord.

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ یُبۡدِئُ وَیُعِیدُ ۝١٣
Translation: It is He Who creates from the very beginning, and He can restore (life).

ArabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلۡوَدُودُ ۝١٤
Translation: And He is the Oft-Forgiving, Full of Loving-Kindness,

ArabicText: ذُو ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡمَجِیدُ ۝١٥
Translation: Lord of the Throne of Glory,

ArabicText: فَعَّالࣱ لِّمَا یُرِیدُ ۝١٦
Translation: Doer (without let) of all that He intends.

ArabicText: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِیثُ ٱلۡجُنُودِ ۝١٧
Translation: Has the story reached thee, of the forces-

ArabicText: فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَثَمُودَ ۝١٨
Translation: Of Pharaoh and the Thamud?

ArabicText: بَلِ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِی تَكۡذِیبࣲ ۝١٩
Translation: And yet the Unbelievers (persist) in rejecting (the Truth)!

ArabicText: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَاۤىِٕهِم مُّحِیطُۢ ۝٢٠
Translation: But Allah doth encompass them from behind!

ArabicText: بَلۡ هُوَ قُرۡءَانࣱ مَّجِیدࣱ ۝٢١
Translation: Day, this is a Glorious Qur´an,

ArabicText: فِی لَوۡحࣲ مَّحۡفُوظِۭ ۝٢٢
Translation: (Inscribed) in a Tablet Preserved!

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ ۝١
Translation: By the Sky and the Night-Visitant (therein);-

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ ۝٢
Translation: And what will explain to thee what the Night-Visitant is?-

ArabicText: ٱلنَّجۡمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ ۝٣
Translation: (It is) the Star of piercing brightness;-

ArabicText: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسࣲ لَّمَّا عَلَیۡهَا حَافِظࣱ ۝٤
Translation: There is no soul but has a protector over it.

ArabicText: فَلۡیَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ ۝٥
Translation: Now let man but think from what he is created!

ArabicText: خُلِقَ مِن مَّاۤءࣲ دَافِقࣲ ۝٦
Translation: He is created from a drop emitted-

ArabicText: یَخۡرُجُ مِنۢ بَیۡنِ ٱلصُّلۡبِ وَٱلتَّرَاۤىِٕبِ ۝٧
Translation: Proceeding from between the backbone and the ribs:

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجۡعِهِۦ لَقَادِرࣱ ۝٨
Translation: Surely (Allah) is able to bring him back (to life)!

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ تُبۡلَى ٱلسَّرَاۤىِٕرُ ۝٩
Translation: The Day that (all) things secret will be tested,

ArabicText: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةࣲ وَلَا نَاصِرࣲ ۝١٠
Translation: (Man) will have no power, and no helper.

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجۡعِ ۝١١
Translation: By the Firmament which returns (in its round),

ArabicText: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدۡعِ ۝١٢
Translation: And by the Earth which opens out (for the gushing of springs or the sprouting of vegetation),-

ArabicText: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلࣱ فَصۡلࣱ ۝١٣
Translation: Behold this is the Word that distinguishes (Good from Evil):

ArabicText: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلۡهَزۡلِ ۝١٤
Translation: It is not a thing for amusement.

ArabicText: إِنَّهُمۡ یَكِیدُونَ كَیۡدࣰا ۝١٥
Translation: As for them, they are but plotting a scheme,

ArabicText: وَأَكِیدُ كَیۡدࣰا ۝١٦
Translation: And I am planning a scheme.

ArabicText: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ أَمۡهِلۡهُمۡ رُوَیۡدَۢا ۝١٧
Translation: Therefore grant a delay to the Unbelievers: Give respite to them gently (for awhile).

ArabicText: سَبِّحِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡأَعۡلَى ۝١
Translation: Glorify the name of thy Guardian-Lord Most High,

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ ۝٢
Translation: Who hath created, and further, given order and proportion;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِی قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ ۝٣
Translation: Who hath ordained laws. And granted guidance;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِیۤ أَخۡرَجَ ٱلۡمَرۡعَىٰ ۝٤
Translation: And Who bringeth out the (green and luscious) pasture,

ArabicText: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَاۤءً أَحۡوَىٰ ۝٥
Translation: And then doth make it (but) swarthy stubble.

ArabicText: سَنُقۡرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰۤ ۝٦
Translation: By degrees shall We teach thee to declare (the Message), so thou shalt not forget,

ArabicText: إِلَّا مَا شَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ یَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡجَهۡرَ وَمَا یَخۡفَىٰ ۝٧
Translation: Except as Allah wills: For He knoweth what is manifest and what is hidden.

ArabicText: وَنُیَسِّرُكَ لِلۡیُسۡرَىٰ ۝٨
Translation: And We will make it easy for thee (to follow) the simple (Path).

ArabicText: فَذَكِّرۡ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ ۝٩
Translation: Therefore give admonition in case the admonition profits (the hearer).

ArabicText: سَیَذَّكَّرُ مَن یَخۡشَىٰ ۝١٠
Translation: The admonition will be received by those who fear (Allah):

ArabicText: وَیَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى ۝١١
Translation: But it will be avoided by those most unfortunate ones,

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی یَصۡلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ ۝١٢
Translation: Who will enter the Great Fire,

ArabicText: ثُمَّ لَا یَمُوتُ فِیهَا وَلَا یَحۡیَىٰ ۝١٣
Translation: In which they will then neither die nor live.

ArabicText: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ ۝١٤
Translation: But those will prosper who purify themselves,

ArabicText: وَذَكَرَ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ ۝١٥
Translation: And glorify the name of their Guardian-Lord, and (lift their hearts) in prayer.

ArabicText: بَلۡ تُؤۡثِرُونَ ٱلۡحَیَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡیَا ۝١٦
Translation: Day (behold), ye prefer the life of this world;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةُ خَیۡرࣱ وَأَبۡقَىٰۤ ۝١٧
Translation: But the Hereafter is better and more enduring.

ArabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَفِی ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ ۝١٨
Translation: And this is in the Books of the earliest (Revelation),-

ArabicText: صُحُفِ إِبۡرَ ٰ⁠هِیمَ وَمُوسَىٰ ۝١٩
Translation: The Books of Abraham and Moses.

ArabicText: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِیثُ ٱلۡغَـٰشِیَةِ ۝١
Translation: Has the story reached thee of the overwhelming (Event)?

ArabicText: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ خَـٰشِعَةٌ ۝٢
Translation: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated,

ArabicText: عَامِلَةࣱ نَّاصِبَةࣱ ۝٣
Translation: Labouring (hard), weary,-

ArabicText: تَصۡلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِیَةࣰ ۝٤
Translation: The while they enter the Blazing Fire,-

ArabicText: تُسۡقَىٰ مِنۡ عَیۡنٍ ءَانِیَةࣲ ۝٥
Translation: The while they are given, to drink, of a boiling hot spring,

ArabicText: لَّیۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِیعࣲ ۝٦
Translation: No food will there be for them but a bitter Dhari´

ArabicText: لَّا یُسۡمِنُ وَلَا یُغۡنِی مِن جُوعࣲ ۝٧
Translation: Which will neither nourish nor satisfy hunger.

ArabicText: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ نَّاعِمَةࣱ ۝٨
Translation: (Other) faces that Day will be joyful,

ArabicText: لِّسَعۡیِهَا رَاضِیَةࣱ ۝٩
Translation: Pleased with their striving,-

ArabicText: فِی جَنَّةٍ عَالِیَةࣲ ۝١٠
Translation: In a Garden on high,

ArabicText: لَّا تَسۡمَعُ فِیهَا لَـٰغِیَةࣰ ۝١١
Translation: Where they shall hear no (word) of vanity:

ArabicText: فِیهَا عَیۡنࣱ جَارِیَةࣱ ۝١٢
Translation: Therein will be a bubbling spring:

ArabicText: فِیهَا سُرُرࣱ مَّرۡفُوعَةࣱ ۝١٣
Translation: Therein will be Thrones (of dignity), raised on high,

ArabicText: وَأَكۡوَابࣱ مَّوۡضُوعَةࣱ ۝١٤
Translation: Goblets placed (ready),

ArabicText: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصۡفُوفَةࣱ ۝١٥
Translation: And cushions set in rows,

ArabicText: وَزَرَابِیُّ مَبۡثُوثَةٌ ۝١٦
Translation: And rich carpets (all) spread out.

ArabicText: أَفَلَا یَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَیۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ ۝١٧
Translation: Do they not look at the Camels, how they are made?-

ArabicText: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ كَیۡفَ رُفِعَتۡ ۝١٨
Translation: And at the Sky, how it is raised high?-

ArabicText: وَإِلَى ٱلۡجِبَالِ كَیۡفَ نُصِبَتۡ ۝١٩
Translation: And at the Mountains, how they are fixed firm?-

ArabicText: وَإِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَیۡفَ سُطِحَتۡ ۝٢٠
Translation: And at the Earth, how it is spread out?

ArabicText: فَذَكِّرۡ إِنَّمَاۤ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرࣱ ۝٢١
Translation: Therefore do thou give admonition, for thou art one to admonish.

ArabicText: لَّسۡتَ عَلَیۡهِم بِمُصَیۡطِرٍ ۝٢٢
Translation: Thou art not one to manage (men´s) affairs.

ArabicText: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ ۝٢٣
Translation: But if any turn away and reject Allah,-

ArabicText: فَیُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَكۡبَرَ ۝٢٤
Translation: Allah will punish him with a mighty Punishment,

ArabicText: إِنَّ إِلَیۡنَاۤ إِیَابَهُمۡ ۝٢٥
Translation: For to Us will be their return;

ArabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا حِسَابَهُم ۝٢٦
Translation: Then it will be for Us to call them to account.

ArabicText: وَٱلۡفَجۡرِ ۝١
Translation: By the break of Day

ArabicText: وَلَیَالٍ عَشۡرࣲ ۝٢
Translation: By the Nights twice five;

ArabicText: وَٱلشَّفۡعِ وَٱلۡوَتۡرِ ۝٣
Translation: By the even and odd (contrasted);

ArabicText: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا یَسۡرِ ۝٤
Translation: And by the Night when it passeth away;-

ArabicText: هَلۡ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ قَسَمࣱ لِّذِی حِجۡرٍ ۝٥
Translation: Is there (not) in these an adjuration (or evidence) for those who understand?

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَیۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ ۝٦
Translation: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the ´Ad (people),-

ArabicText: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلۡعِمَادِ ۝٧
Translation: Of the (city of) Iram, with lofty pillars,

ArabicText: ٱلَّتِی لَمۡ یُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ ۝٨
Translation: The like of which were not produced in (all) the land?

ArabicText: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِینَ جَابُوا۟ ٱلصَّخۡرَ بِٱلۡوَادِ ۝٩
Translation: And with the Thamud (people), who cut out (huge) rocks in the valley?-

ArabicText: وَفِرۡعَوۡنَ ذِی ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ ۝١٠
Translation: And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes?

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ طَغَوۡا۟ فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ ۝١١
Translation: (All) these transgressed beyond bounds in the lands,

ArabicText: فَأَكۡثَرُوا۟ فِیهَا ٱلۡفَسَادَ ۝١٢
Translation: And heaped therein mischief (on mischief).

ArabicText: فَصَبَّ عَلَیۡهِمۡ رَبُّكَ سَوۡطَ عَذَابٍ ۝١٣
Translation: Therefore did thy Lord pour on them a scourge of diverse chastisements:

ArabicText: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلۡمِرۡصَادِ ۝١٤
Translation: For thy Lord is (as a Guardian) on a watch-tower.

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَكۡرَمَنِ ۝١٥
Translation: Now, as for man, when his Lord trieth him, giving him honour and gifts, then saith he, (puffed up), "My Lord hath honoured me."

ArabicText: وَأَمَّاۤ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَیۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَهَـٰنَنِ ۝١٦
Translation: But when He trieth him, restricting his subsistence for him, then saith he (in despair), "My Lord hath humiliated me!"

ArabicText: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا تُكۡرِمُونَ ٱلۡیَتِیمَ ۝١٧
Translation: Nay, nay! but ye honour not the orphans!

ArabicText: وَلَا تَحَـٰۤضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِینِ ۝١٨
Translation: Nor do ye encourage one another to feed the poor!-

ArabicText: وَتَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكۡلࣰا لَّمࣰّا ۝١٩
Translation: And ye devour inheritance - all with greed,

ArabicText: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡمَالَ حُبࣰّا جَمࣰّا ۝٢٠
Translation: And ye love wealth with inordinate love!

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكࣰّا دَكࣰّا ۝٢١
Translation: Nay! When the earth is pounded to powder,

ArabicText: وَجَاۤءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلۡمَلَكُ صَفࣰّا صَفࣰّا ۝٢٢
Translation: And thy Lord cometh, and His angels, rank upon rank,

ArabicText: وَجِا۟یۤءَ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ ۝٢٣
Translation: And Hell, that Day, is brought (face to face),- on that Day will man remember, but how will that remembrance profit him?

ArabicText: یَقُولُ یَـٰلَیۡتَنِی قَدَّمۡتُ لِحَیَاتِی ۝٢٤
Translation: He will say: "Ah! Would that I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this) my (Future) Life!"

ArabicText: فَیَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّا یُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥۤ أَحَدࣱ ۝٢٥
Translation: For, that Day, His Chastisement will be such as none (else) can inflict,

ArabicText: وَلَا یُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥۤ أَحَدࣱ ۝٢٦
Translation: And His bonds will be such as none (other) can bind.

ArabicText: یَـٰۤأَیَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفۡسُ ٱلۡمُطۡمَىِٕنَّةُ ۝٢٧
Translation: (To the righteous soul will be said:) "O (thou) soul, in (complete) rest and satisfaction!

ArabicText: ٱرۡجِعِیۤ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِیَةࣰ مَّرۡضِیَّةࣰ ۝٢٨
Translation: "Come back thou to thy Lord,- well pleased (thyself), and well-pleasing unto Him!

ArabicText: فَٱدۡخُلِی فِی عِبَـٰدِی ۝٢٩
Translation: "Enter thou, then, among My devotees!

ArabicText: وَٱدۡخُلِی جَنَّتِی ۝٣٠
Translation: "Yea, enter thou My Heaven!

ArabicText: لَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ ۝١
Translation: I do call to witness this City;-

ArabicText: وَأَنتَ حِلُّۢ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ ۝٢
Translation: And thou art a freeman of this City;-

ArabicText: وَوَالِدࣲ وَمَا وَلَدَ ۝٣
Translation: And (the mystic ties of) parent and child;-

ArabicText: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ فِی كَبَدٍ ۝٤
Translation: Verily We have created man into toil and struggle.

ArabicText: أَیَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن یَقۡدِرَ عَلَیۡهِ أَحَدࣱ ۝٥
Translation: Thinketh he, that none hath power over him?

ArabicText: یَقُولُ أَهۡلَكۡتُ مَالࣰا لُّبَدًا ۝٦
Translation: He may say (boastfully); Wealth have I squandered in abundance!

ArabicText: أَیَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّمۡ یَرَهُۥۤ أَحَدٌ ۝٧
Translation: Thinketh he that none beholdeth him?

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُۥ عَیۡنَیۡنِ ۝٨
Translation: Have We not made for him a pair of eyes?-

ArabicText: وَلِسَانࣰا وَشَفَتَیۡنِ ۝٩
Translation: And a tongue, and a pair of lips?-

ArabicText: وَهَدَیۡنَـٰهُ ٱلنَّجۡدَیۡنِ ۝١٠
Translation: And shown him the two highways?

ArabicText: فَلَا ٱقۡتَحَمَ ٱلۡعَقَبَةَ ۝١١
Translation: But he hath made no haste on the path that is steep.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡعَقَبَةُ ۝١٢
Translation: And what will explain to thee the path that is steep?-
(It is:) freeing the bondman;

ArabicText: أَوۡ إِطۡعَـٰمࣱ فِی یَوۡمࣲ ذِی مَسۡغَبَةࣲ ۝١٤
Translation: Or the giving of food in a day of privation

ArabicText: یَتِیمࣰا ذَا مَقۡرَبَةٍ ۝١٥
Translation: To the orphan with claims of relationship,

ArabicText: أَوۡ مِسۡكِینࣰا ذَا مَتۡرَبَةࣲ ۝١٦
Translation: Or to the indigent (down) in the dust.

ArabicText: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ ۝١٧
Translation: Then will he be of those who believe, and enjoin patience, (constancy, and self-restraint), and enjoin deeds of kindness and compassion.

ArabicText: أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَیۡمَنَةِ ۝١٨
Translation: Such are the Companions of the Right Hand.

ArabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ ۝١٩
Translation: But those who reject Our Signs, they are the (unhappy) Companions of the Left Hand.

ArabicText: عَلَیۡهِمۡ نَارࣱ مُّؤۡصَدَةُۢ ۝٢٠
Translation: On them will be Fire vaulted over (all round).

ArabicText: وَٱلشَّمۡسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا ۝١
Translation: By the Sun and his (glorious) splendour;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا ۝٢
Translation: By the Moon as she follows him;

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا ۝٣
Translation: By the Day as it shows up (the Sun´s) glory;

ArabicText: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا یَغۡشَىٰهَا ۝٤
Translation: By the Night as it conceals it;

ArabicText: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا ۝٥
Translation: By the Firmament and its (wonderful) structure;

ArabicText: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا ۝٦
Translation: By the Earth and its (wide) expanse:

ArabicText: وَنَفۡسࣲ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا ۝٧
Translation: By the Soul, and the proportion and order given to it;

ArabicText: فَأَلۡهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقۡوَىٰهَا ۝٨
Translation: And its enlightenment as to its wrong and its right;-

ArabicText: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا ۝٩
Translation: Truly he succeeds that purifies it,

ArabicText: وَقَدۡ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا ۝١٠
Translation: And he fails that corrupts it!

ArabicText: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِطَغۡوَىٰهَاۤ ۝١١
Translation: The Thamud (people) rejected (their prophet) through their inordinate wrong-doing,

ArabicText: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشۡقَىٰهَا ۝١٢
Translation: Behold, the most wicked man among them was deputed (for impiety).

ArabicText: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡیَـٰهَا ۝١٣
Translation: But the Messenger of Allah said to them: "It is a She-camel of Allah! And (bar her not from) having her drink!"

ArabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَیۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا ۝١٤
Translation: Then they rejected him (as a false prophet), and they hamstrung her. So their Lord, on account of their crime, obliterated their traces and made them equal (in destruction, high and low)!

ArabicText: وَلَا یَخَافُ عُقۡبَـٰهَا ۝١٥
Translation: And for Him is no fear of its consequences.

ArabicText: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا یَغۡشَىٰ ۝١
Translation: By the Night as it conceals (the light);

ArabicText: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ ۝٢
Translation: By the Day as it appears in glory;

ArabicText: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰۤ ۝٣
Translation: By (the mystery of) the creation of male and female;-

ArabicText: إِنَّ سَعۡیَكُمۡ لَشَتَّىٰ ۝٤
Translation: Verily, (the ends) ye strive for are diverse.

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أَعۡطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ ۝٥
Translation: So he who gives (in charity) and fears (Allah),

ArabicText: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ ۝٦
Translation: And (in all sincerity) testifies to the best,-

ArabicText: فَسَنُیَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡیُسۡرَىٰ ۝٧
Translation: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Bliss.

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ ۝٨
Translation: But he who is a greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient,

ArabicText: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ ۝٩
Translation: And gives the lie to the best,-

ArabicText: فَسَنُیَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡعُسۡرَىٰ ۝١٠
Translation: We will indeed make smooth for him the path to Misery;

ArabicText: وَمَا یُغۡنِی عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥۤ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰۤ ۝١١
Translation: Nor will his wealth profit him when he falls headlong (into the Pit).

ArabicText: إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا لَلۡهُدَىٰ ۝١٢
Translation: Verily We take upon Ourselves to guide,

ArabicText: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلۡـَٔاخِرَةَ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ ۝١٣
Translation: And verily unto Us (belong) the End and the Beginning.

ArabicText: فَأَنذَرۡتُكُمۡ نَارࣰا تَلَظَّىٰ ۝١٤
Translation: Therefore do I warn you of a Fire blazing fiercely;

ArabicText: لَا یَصۡلَىٰهَاۤ إِلَّا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى ۝١٥
Translation: None shall reach it but those most unfortunate ones

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ ۝١٦
Translation: Who give the lie to Truth and turn their backs.

ArabicText: وَسَیُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَتۡقَى ۝١٧
Translation: But those most devoted to Allah shall be removed far from it,-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی یُؤۡتِی مَالَهُۥ یَتَزَكَّىٰ ۝١٨
Translation: Those who spend their wealth for increase in self-purification,

ArabicText: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعۡمَةࣲ تُجۡزَىٰۤ ۝١٩
Translation: And have in their minds no favour from anyone for which a reward is expected in return,

ArabicText: إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَاۤءَ وَجۡهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ ۝٢٠
Translation: But only the desire to seek for the Countenance of their Lord Most High;

ArabicText: وَلَسَوۡفَ یَرۡضَىٰ ۝٢١
Translation: And soon will they attain (complete) satisfaction.

ArabicText: وَٱلضُّحَىٰ ۝١
Translation: By the Glorious Morning Light,

ArabicText: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ ۝٢
Translation: And by the Night when it is still,-

ArabicText: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ ۝٣
Translation: Thy Guardian-Lord hath not forsaken thee, nor is He displeased.

ArabicText: وَلَلۡـَٔاخِرَةُ خَیۡرࣱ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ ۝٤
Translation: And verily the Hereafter will be better for thee than the present.

ArabicText: وَلَسَوۡفَ یُعۡطِیكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرۡضَىٰۤ ۝٥
Translation: And soon will thy Guardian-Lord give thee (that wherewith) thou shalt be well-pleased.

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ یَجِدۡكَ یَتِیمࣰا فَـَٔاوَىٰ ۝٦
Translation: Did He not find thee an orphan and give thee shelter (and care)?

ArabicText: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَاۤلࣰّا فَهَدَىٰ ۝٧
Translation: And He found thee wandering, and He gave thee guidance.

ArabicText: وَوَجَدَكَ عَاۤىِٕلࣰا فَأَغۡنَىٰ ۝٨
Translation: And He found thee in need, and made thee independent.

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡیَتِیمَ فَلَا تَقۡهَرۡ ۝٩
Translation: Therefore, treat not the orphan with harshness,

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّاۤىِٕلَ فَلَا تَنۡهَرۡ ۝١٠
Translation: Nor repulse the petitioner (unheard);

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا بِنِعۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثۡ ۝١١
Translation: But the bounty of the Lord - rehearse and proclaim!

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ نَشۡرَحۡ لَكَ صَدۡرَكَ ۝١
Translation: Have We not expanded thee thy breast?-

ArabicText: وَوَضَعۡنَا عَنكَ وِزۡرَكَ ۝٢
Translation: And removed from thee thy burden

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِیۤ أَنقَضَ ظَهۡرَكَ ۝٣
Translation: The which did gall thy back?-

ArabicText: وَرَفَعۡنَا لَكَ ذِكۡرَكَ ۝٤
Translation: And raised high the esteem (in which) thou (art held)?

ArabicText: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ یُسۡرًا ۝٥
Translation: So, verily, with every difficulty, there is relief:

ArabicText: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ یُسۡرࣰا ۝٦
Translation: Verily, with every difficulty there is relief.

ArabicText: فَإِذَا فَرَغۡتَ فَٱنصَبۡ ۝٧
Translation: Therefore, when thou art free (from thine immediate task), still labour hard,

ArabicText: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرۡغَب ۝٨
Translation: And to thy Lord turn (all) thy attention.

ArabicText: بِّسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلتِّینِ وَٱلزَّیۡتُونِ ۝١
Translation: By the Fig and the Olive,

ArabicText: وَطُورِ سِینِینَ ۝٢
Translation: And the Mount of Sinai,

ArabicText: وَهَـٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ ٱلۡأَمِینِ ۝٣
Translation: And this City of security,-

ArabicText: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ فِیۤ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِیمࣲ ۝٤
Translation: We have indeed created man in the best of moulds,

ArabicText: ثُمَّ رَدَدۡنَـٰهُ أَسۡفَلَ سَـٰفِلِینَ ۝٥
Translation: Then do We abase him (to be) the lowest of the low,-

ArabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَیۡرُ مَمۡنُونࣲ ۝٦
Translation: Except such as believe and do righteous deeds: For they shall have a reward unfailing.

ArabicText: فَمَا یُكَذِّبُكَ بَعۡدُ بِٱلدِّینِ ۝٧
Translation: Then what can, after this, contradict thee, as to the judgment (to come)?

ArabicText: أَلَیۡسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحۡكَمِ ٱلۡحَـٰكِمِینَ ۝٨
Translation: Is not Allah the wisest of judges?

ArabicText: ٱقۡرَأۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِی خَلَقَ ۝١
Translation: Proclaim! (or read!) in the name of thy Lord and Cherisher, Who created-

ArabicText: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ مِنۡ عَلَقٍ ۝٢
Translation: Created man, out of a (mere) clot of congealed blood:

ArabicText: ٱقۡرَأۡ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلۡأَكۡرَمُ ۝٣
Translation: Proclaim! And thy Lord is Most Bountiful,-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی عَلَّمَ بِٱلۡقَلَمِ ۝٤
Translation: He Who taught (the use of) the pen,-

ArabicText: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ مَا لَمۡ یَعۡلَمۡ ۝٥
Translation: Taught man that which he knew not.

ArabicText: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ لَیَطۡغَىٰۤ ۝٦
Translation: Day, but man doth transgress all bounds,

ArabicText: أَن رَّءَاهُ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰۤ ۝٧
Translation: In that he looketh upon himself as self-sufficient.

ArabicText: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلرُّجۡعَىٰۤ ۝٨
Translation: Verily, to thy Lord is the return (of all).

ArabicText: أَرَءَیۡتَ ٱلَّذِی یَنۡهَىٰ ۝٩
Translation: Seest thou one who forbids-

ArabicText: عَبۡدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰۤ ۝١٠
Translation: A votary when he (turns) to pray?

ArabicText: أَرَءَیۡتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى ٱلۡهُدَىٰۤ ۝١١
Translation: Seest thou if he is on (the road of) Guidance?-

ArabicText: أَوۡ أَمَرَ بِٱلتَّقۡوَىٰۤ ۝١٢
Translation: Or enjoins Righteousness?

ArabicText: أَرَءَیۡتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰۤ ۝١٣
Translation: Seest thou if he denies (Truth) and turns away?

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ یَعۡلَم بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ یَرَىٰ ۝١٤
Translation: Knoweth he not that Allah doth see?

ArabicText: كَلَّا لَىِٕن لَّمۡ یَنتَهِ لَنَسۡفَعَۢا بِٱلنَّاصِیَةِ ۝١٥
Translation: Let him beware! If he desist not, We will drag him by the forelock,-

ArabicText: نَاصِیَةࣲ كَـٰذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةࣲ ۝١٦
Translation: A lying, sinful forelock!

ArabicText: فَلۡیَدۡعُ نَادِیَهُۥ ۝١٧
Translation: Then, let him call (for help) to his council (of comrades):

ArabicText: سَنَدۡعُ ٱلزَّبَانِیَةَ ۝١٨
Translation: We will call on the angels of punishment (to deal with him)!

ArabicText: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعۡهُ وَٱسۡجُدۡ وَٱقۡتَرِب ۩ ۝١٩
Translation: Day, heed him not: But bow down in adoration, and bring thyself the closer (to Allah)!

ArabicText: بِّسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ إِنَّاۤ أَنزَلۡنَـٰهُ فِی لَیۡلَةِ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ ۝١
Translation: We have indeed revealed this (Message) in the Night of Power:

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا لَیۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ ۝٢
Translation: And what will explain to thee what the night of power is?

ArabicText: لَیۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ خَیۡرࣱ مِّنۡ أَلۡفِ شَهۡرࣲ ۝٣
Translation: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.

ArabicText: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِیهَا بِإِذۡنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمۡرࣲ ۝٤
Translation: Therein come down the angels and the Spirit by Allah´s permission, on every errand:

ArabicText: سَلَـٰمٌ هِیَ حَتَّىٰ مَطۡلَعِ ٱلۡفَجۡرِ ۝٥
Translation: Peace!...This until the rise of morn!

ArabicText: لَمۡ یَكُنِ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَـٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِینَ مُنفَكِّینَ حَتَّىٰ تَأۡتِیَهُمُ ٱلۡبَیِّنَةُ ۝١
Translation: Those who reject (Truth), among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists, were not going to depart (from their ways) until there should come to them Clear Evidence,-

ArabicText: رَسُولࣱ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ یَتۡلُوا۟ صُحُفࣰا مُّطَهَّرَةࣰ ۝٢
Translation: An messenger from Allah, rehearsing scriptures kept pure and holy:

ArabicText: فِیهَا كُتُبࣱ قَیِّمَةࣱ ۝٣
Translation: Wherein are laws (or decrees) right and straight.

ArabicText: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِینَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلۡكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَاۤءَتۡهُمُ ٱلۡبَیِّنَةُ ۝٤
Translation: Nor did the People of the Book make schisms, until after there came to them Clear Evidence.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أُمِرُوۤا۟ إِلَّا لِیَعۡبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخۡلِصِینَ لَهُ ٱلدِّینَ حُنَفَاۤءَ وَیُقِیمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَیُؤۡتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَۚ وَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ دِینُ ٱلۡقَیِّمَةِ ۝٥
Translation: And they have been commanded no more than this: To worship Allah, offering Him sincere devotion, being true (in faith); to establish regular prayer; and to practise regular charity; and that is the Religion Right and Straight.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَـٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِینَ فِی نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِینَ فِیهَاۤۚ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمۡ شَرُّ ٱلۡبَرِیَّةِ ۝٦
Translation: Those who reject (Truth), among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists, will be in Hell-Fire, to dwell therein (for aye). They are the worst of creatures.

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمۡ خَیۡرُ ٱلۡبَرِیَّةِ ۝٧
Translation: Those who have faith and do righteous deeds,- they are the best of creatures.

ArabicText: جَزَاۤؤُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّـٰتُ عَدۡنࣲ تَجۡرِی مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِینَ فِیهَاۤ أَبَدࣰاۖ رَّضِیَ ٱللَّهُ عَنۡهُمۡ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنۡهُۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ لِمَنۡ خَشِیَ رَبَّهُۥ ۝٨
Translation: Their reward is with Allah: Gardens of Eternity, beneath which rivers flow; they will dwell therein for ever; Allah well pleased with them, and they with Him: all this for such as fear their Lord and Cherisher.

ArabicText: إِذَا زُلۡزِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ زِلۡزَالَهَا ۝١
Translation: When the earth is shaken to her (utmost) convulsion,

ArabicText: وَأَخۡرَجَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ أَثۡقَالَهَا ۝٢
Translation: And the earth throws up her burdens (from within),

ArabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مَا لَهَا ۝٣
Translation: And man cries (distressed): ´What is the matter with her?´-

ArabicText: یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ تُحَدِّثُ أَخۡبَارَهَا ۝٤
Translation: On that Day will she declare her tidings:

ArabicText: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوۡحَىٰ لَهَا ۝٥
Translation: For that thy Lord will have given her inspiration.

ArabicText: یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَصۡدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشۡتَاتࣰا لِّیُرَوۡا۟ أَعۡمَـٰلَهُمۡ ۝٦
Translation: On that Day will men proceed in companies sorted out, to be shown the deeds that they (had done).

ArabicText: فَمَن یَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَیۡرࣰا یَرَهُۥ ۝٧
Translation: Then shall anyone who has done an atom´s weight of good, see it!

ArabicText: وَمَن یَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةࣲ شَرࣰّا یَرَهُۥ ۝٨
Translation: And anyone who has done an atom´s weight of evil, shall see it.

ArabicText: وَٱلۡعَـٰدِیَـٰتِ ضَبۡحࣰا ۝١
Translation: By the (Steeds) that run, with panting (breath),

ArabicText: فَٱلۡمُورِیَـٰتِ قَدۡحࣰا ۝٢
Translation: And strike sparks of fire,

ArabicText: فَٱلۡمُغِیرَ ٰ⁠تِ صُبۡحࣰا ۝٣
Translation: And push home the charge in the morning,

ArabicText: فَأَثَرۡنَ بِهِۦ نَقۡعࣰا ۝٤
Translation: And raise the dust in clouds the while,

ArabicText: فَوَسَطۡنَ بِهِۦ جَمۡعًا ۝٥
Translation: And penetrate forthwith into the midst (of the foe) en masse;-

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ لِرَبِّهِۦ لَكَنُودࣱ ۝٦
Translation: Truly man is, to his Lord, ungrateful;

ArabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ لَشَهِیدࣱ ۝٧
Translation: And to that (fact) he bears witness (by his deeds);

ArabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ لِحُبِّ ٱلۡخَیۡرِ لَشَدِیدٌ ۝٨
Translation: And violent is he in his love of wealth.

ArabicText: ۞ أَفَلَا یَعۡلَمُ إِذَا بُعۡثِرَ مَا فِی ٱلۡقُبُورِ ۝٩
Translation: Does he not know,- when that which is in the graves is scattered abroad

ArabicText: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِی ٱلصُّدُورِ ۝١٠
Translation: And that which is (locked up) in (human) breasts is made manifest-

ArabicText: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّخَبِیرُۢ ۝١١
Translation: That their Lord had been Well-acquainted with them, (even to) that Day?

ArabicText: ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ ۝١
Translation: The (Day) of Noise and Clamour:

ArabicText: مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ ۝٢
Translation: What is the (Day) of Noise and Clamour?

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ ۝٣
Translation: And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamour is?

ArabicText: یَوۡمَ یَكُونُ ٱلنَّاسُ كَٱلۡفَرَاشِ ٱلۡمَبۡثُوثِ ۝٤
Translation: (It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about,

ArabicText: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ ٱلۡمَنفُوشِ ۝٥
Translation: And the mountains will be like carded wool.

ArabicText: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتۡ مَوَ ٰ⁠زِینُهُۥ ۝٦
Translation: Then, he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) heavy,

ArabicText: فَهُوَ فِی عِیشَةࣲ رَّاضِیَةࣲ ۝٧
Translation: Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.

ArabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَفَّتۡ مَوَ ٰ⁠زِینُهُۥ ۝٨
Translation: But he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) light,-

ArabicText: فَأُمُّهُۥ هَاوِیَةࣱ ۝٩
Translation: Will have his home in a (bottomless) Pit.

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا هِیَهۡ ۝١٠
Translation: And what will explain to thee what this is?

ArabicText: نَارٌ حَامِیَةُۢ ۝١١
Translation: (It is) a Fire Blazing fiercely!

ArabicText: أَلۡهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ ۝١
Translation: The mutual rivalry for piling up (the good things of this world) diverts you (from the more serious things),

ArabicText: حَتَّىٰ زُرۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَقَابِرَ ۝٢
Translation: Until ye visit the graves.

ArabicText: كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٣
Translation: But nay, ye soon shall know (the reality).

ArabicText: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ ۝٤
Translation: Again, ye soon shall know!

ArabicText: كَلَّا لَوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عِلۡمَ ٱلۡیَقِینِ ۝٥
Translation: Nay, were ye to know with certainty of mind, (ye would beware!)

ArabicText: لَتَرَوُنَّ ٱلۡجَحِیمَ ۝٦
Translation: Ye shall certainly see Hell-Fire!

ArabicText: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَیۡنَ ٱلۡیَقِینِ ۝٧
Translation: Again, ye shall see it with certainty of sight!

ArabicText: ثُمَّ لَتُسۡـَٔلُنَّ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ عَنِ ٱلنَّعِیمِ ۝٨
Translation: Then, shall ye be questioned that Day about the joy (ye indulged in!).

ArabicText: وَٱلۡعَصۡرِ ۝١
Translation: By (the Token of) Time (through the ages),

ArabicText: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ لَفِی خُسۡرٍ ۝٢
Translation: Verily Man is in loss,

ArabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ ۝٣
Translation: Except such as have Faith, and do righteous deeds, and (join together) in the mutual teaching of Truth, and of Patience and Constancy.

ArabicText: وَیۡلࣱ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةࣲ لُّمَزَةٍ ۝١
Translation: Woe to every (kind of) scandal-monger and-backbiter,

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی جَمَعَ مَالࣰا وَعَدَّدَهُۥ ۝٢
Translation: Who pileth up wealth and layeth it by,

ArabicText: یَحۡسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُۥۤ أَخۡلَدَهُۥ ۝٣
Translation: Thinking that his wealth would make him last for ever!

ArabicText: كَلَّاۖ لَیُنۢبَذَنَّ فِی ٱلۡحُطَمَةِ ۝٤
Translation: By no means! He will be sure to be thrown into That which Breaks to Pieces,

ArabicText: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡحُطَمَةُ ۝٥
Translation: And what will explain to thee That which Breaks to Pieces?

ArabicText: نَارُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُوقَدَةُ ۝٦
Translation: (It is) the Fire of (the Wrath of) Allah kindled (to a blaze),

ArabicText: ٱلَّتِی تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى ٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةِ ۝٧
Translation: The which doth mount (Right) to the Hearts:

ArabicText: إِنَّهَا عَلَیۡهِم مُّؤۡصَدَةࣱ ۝٨
Translation: It shall be made into a vault over them,

ArabicText: فِی عَمَدࣲ مُّمَدَّدَةِۭ ۝٩
Translation: In columns outstretched.

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَیۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصۡحَـٰبِ ٱلۡفِیلِ ۝١
Translation: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the Companions of the Elephant?

ArabicText: أَلَمۡ یَجۡعَلۡ كَیۡدَهُمۡ فِی تَضۡلِیلࣲ ۝٢
Translation: Did He not make their treacherous plan go astray?

ArabicText: وَأَرۡسَلَ عَلَیۡهِمۡ طَیۡرًا أَبَابِیلَ ۝٣
Translation: And He sent against them Flights of Birds,

ArabicText: تَرۡمِیهِم بِحِجَارَةࣲ مِّن سِجِّیلࣲ ۝٤
Translation: Striking them with stones of baked clay.

ArabicText: فَجَعَلَهُمۡ كَعَصۡفࣲ مَّأۡكُولِۭ ۝٥
Translation: Then did He make them like an empty field of stalks and straw, (of which the corn) has been eaten up.

ArabicText: لِإِیلَـٰفِ قُرَیۡشٍ ۝١
Translation: For the covenants (of security and safeguard enjoyed) by the Quraish,

ArabicText: إِۦلَـٰفِهِمۡ رِحۡلَةَ ٱلشِّتَاۤءِ وَٱلصَّیۡفِ ۝٢
Translation: Their covenants (covering) journeys by winter and summer,-

ArabicText: فَلۡیَعۡبُدُوا۟ رَبَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلۡبَیۡتِ ۝٣
Translation: Let them adore the Lord of this House,

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِیۤ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعࣲ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ ۝٤
Translation: Who provides them with food against hunger, and with security against fear (of danger).

ArabicText: أَرَءَیۡتَ ٱلَّذِی یُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّینِ ۝١
Translation: Seest thou one who denies the Judgment (to come)?

ArabicText: فَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلَّذِی یَدُعُّ ٱلۡیَتِیمَ ۝٢
Translation: Then such is the (man) who repulses the orphan (with harshness),

ArabicText: وَلَا یَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِینِ ۝٣
Translation: And encourages not the feeding of the indigent.

ArabicText: فَوَیۡلࣱ لِّلۡمُصَلِّینَ ۝٤
Translation: So woe to the worshippers

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ عَن صَلَاتِهِمۡ سَاهُونَ ۝٥
Translation: Who are neglectful of their prayers,

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِینَ هُمۡ یُرَاۤءُونَ ۝٦
Translation: Those who (want but) to be seen (of men),

ArabicText: وَیَمۡنَعُونَ ٱلۡمَاعُونَ ۝٧
Translation: But refuse (to supply) (even) neighbourly needs.

ArabicText: إِنَّاۤ أَعۡطَیۡنَـٰكَ ٱلۡكَوۡثَرَ ۝١
Translation: To thee have We granted the Fount (of Abundance).

ArabicText: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَٱنۡحَرۡ ۝٢
Translation: Therefore to thy Lord turn in Prayer and Sacrifice.

ArabicText: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ ٱلۡأَبۡتَرُ ۝٣
Translation: For he who hateth thee, he will be cut off (from Future Hope).

ArabicText: قُلۡ یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡكَـٰفِرُونَ ۝١
Translation: Say : O ye that reject Faith!

ArabicText: لَاۤ أَعۡبُدُ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ ۝٢
Translation: I worship not that which ye worship,

ArabicText: وَلَاۤ أَنتُمۡ عَـٰبِدُونَ مَاۤ أَعۡبُدُ ۝٣
Translation: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.

ArabicText: وَلَاۤ أَنَا۠ عَابِدࣱ مَّا عَبَدتُّمۡ ۝٤
Translation: And I will not worship that which ye have been wont to worship,

ArabicText: وَلَاۤ أَنتُمۡ عَـٰبِدُونَ مَاۤ أَعۡبُدُ ۝٥
Translation: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.

ArabicText: لَكُمۡ دِینُكُمۡ وَلِیَ دِینِ ۝٦
Translation: To you be your Way, and to me mine.

ArabicText: إِذَا جَاۤءَ نَصۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡفَتۡحُ ۝١
Translation: When comes the Help of Allah, and Victory,

ArabicText: وَرَأَیۡتَ ٱلنَّاسَ یَدۡخُلُونَ فِی دِینِ ٱللَّهِ أَفۡوَاجࣰا ۝٢
Translation: And thou dost see the people enter Allah´s Religion in crowds,

ArabicText: فَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرۡهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابَۢا ۝٣
Translation: Celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and pray for His Forgiveness: For He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy).

ArabicText: تَبَّتۡ یَدَاۤ أَبِی لَهَبࣲ وَتَبَّ ۝١
Translation: Perish the hands of the Father of Flame! Perish he!

ArabicText: مَاۤ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ ۝٢
Translation: No profit to him from all his wealth, and all his gains!

ArabicText: سَیَصۡلَىٰ نَارࣰا ذَاتَ لَهَبࣲ ۝٣
Translation: Burnt soon will he be in a Fire of Blazing Flame!

ArabicText: وَٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ حَمَّالَةَ ٱلۡحَطَبِ ۝٤
Translation: His wife shall carry the (crackling) wood - As fuel!-

ArabicText: فِی جِیدِهَا حَبۡلࣱ مِّن مَّسَدِۭ ۝٥
Translation: A twisted rope of palm-leaf fibre round her (own) neck!

ArabicText: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ ۝١
Translation: Say: He is Allah, the One and Only;

ArabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ ۝٢
Translation: Allah, the Eternal, Absolute;

ArabicText: لَمۡ یَلِدۡ وَلَمۡ یُولَدۡ ۝٣
Translation: He begetteth not, nor is He begotten;

ArabicText: وَلَمۡ یَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدُۢ ۝٤
Translation: And there is none like unto Him.

ArabicText: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡفَلَقِ ۝١
Translation: Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of the Dawn

ArabicText: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ ۝٢
Translation: From the mischief of created things;

ArabicText: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ ۝٣
Translation: From the mischief of Darkness as it overspreads;

ArabicText: وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّـٰثَـٰتِ فِی ٱلۡعُقَدِ ۝٤
Translation: From the mischief of those who practise secret arts;

ArabicText: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ ۝٥
Translation: And from the mischief of the envious one as he practises envy.

ArabicText: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ ۝١
Translation: Say: I seek refuge with the Lord and Cherisher of Mankind,

ArabicText: مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ ۝٢
Translation: The King (or Ruler) of Mankind,

ArabicText: إِلَـٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ ۝٣
Translation: The god (or judge) of Mankind,-

ArabicText: مِن شَرِّ ٱلۡوَسۡوَاسِ ٱلۡخَنَّاسِ ۝٤
Translation: From the mischief of the Whisperer (of Evil), who withdraws (after his whisper),-

ArabicText: ٱلَّذِی یُوَسۡوِسُ فِی صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ ۝٥
Translation: (The same) who whispers into the hearts of Mankind,-

ArabicText: مِنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ ۝٦
Translation: Among Jinns and among men.
